00067 /*!
00068  * \note I M P O R T A N T :
00069  *
00070  *    The speed of extension handling will likely be among the most important
00071  * aspects of this PBX.  The switching scheme as it exists right now isn't
00072  * terribly bad (it's O(N+M), where N is the # of extensions and M is the avg #
00073  * of priorities, but a constant search time here would be great ;-)
00074  *
00075  */
00076 
00077 #ifdef LOW_MEMORY
00078 #define EXT_DATA_SIZE 256
00079 #else
00080 #define EXT_DATA_SIZE 8192
00081 #endif
00082 
00083 #define SWITCH_DATA_LENGTH 256
00084 
00085 #define VAR_BUF_SIZE 4096
00086 
00087 #define  VAR_NORMAL     1
00088 #define  VAR_SOFTTRAN   2
00089 #define  VAR_HARDTRAN   3
00090 
00091 #define BACKGROUND_SKIP    (1 << 0)
00092 #define BACKGROUND_NOANSWER   (1 << 1)
00093 #define BACKGROUND_MATCHEXTEN (1 << 2)
00094 #define BACKGROUND_PLAYBACK   (1 << 3)
00095 
00096 AST_APP_OPTIONS(background_opts, {
00097    AST_APP_OPTION('s', BACKGROUND_SKIP),
00098    AST_APP_OPTION('n', BACKGROUND_NOANSWER),
00099    AST_APP_OPTION('m', BACKGROUND_MATCHEXTEN),
00100    AST_APP_OPTION('p', BACKGROUND_PLAYBACK),
00101 });
00102 
00103 #define WAITEXTEN_MOH      (1 << 0)
00104 
00105 AST_APP_OPTIONS(waitexten_opts, {
00106    AST_APP_OPTION_ARG('m', WAITEXTEN_MOH, 0),
00107 });

00109 struct ast_context;
00110 struct ast_app;

00112 /*!
00113    \brief ast_exten: An extension
00114    The dialplan is saved as a linked list with each context
00115    having it's own linked list of extensions - one item per
00116    priority.
00117 */
00118 struct ast_exten {
00119    char *exten;         /*!< Extension name */
00120    int matchcid;        /*!< Match caller id ? */
00121    const char *cidmatch;      /*!< Caller id to match for this extension */
00122    int priority;        /*!< Priority */
00123    const char *label;      /*!< Label */
00124    struct ast_context *parent;   /*!< The context this extension belongs to  */
00125    const char *app;     /*!< Application to execute */
00126    struct ast_app *cached_app;     /*!< Cached location of application */
00127    void *data;       /*!< Data to use (arguments) */
00128    void (*datad)(void *);     /*!< Data destructor */
00129    struct ast_exten *peer;    /*!< Next higher priority with our extension */
00130    const char *registrar;     /*!< Registrar */
00131    struct ast_exten *next;    /*!< Extension with a greater ID */
00132    char stuff[0];
00133 };
00134 
00135 /*! \brief ast_include: include= support in extensions.conf */
00136 struct ast_include {
00137    const char *name;
00138    const char *rname;         /*!< Context to include */
00139    const char *registrar;        /*!< Registrar */
00140    int hastime;            /*!< If time construct exists */
00141    struct ast_timing timing;               /*!< time construct */
00142    struct ast_include *next;     /*!< Link them together */
00143    char stuff[0];
00144 };
00145 
00146 /*! \brief ast_sw: Switch statement in extensions.conf */
00147 struct ast_sw {
00148    char *name;
00149    const char *registrar;        /*!< Registrar */
00150    char *data;          /*!< Data load */
00151    int eval;
00152    AST_LIST_ENTRY(ast_sw) list;
00153    char *tmpdata;
00154    char stuff[0];
00155 };
00156 
00157 /*! \brief ast_ignorepat: Ignore patterns in dial plan */
00158 struct ast_ignorepat {
00159    const char *registrar;
00160    struct ast_ignorepat *next;
00161    const char pattern[0];
00162 };
00163 
00164 /*! \brief ast_context: An extension context */
00165 struct ast_context {
00166    ast_rwlock_t lock;         /*!< A lock to prevent multiple threads from clobbering the context */
00167    struct ast_exten *root;       /*!< The root of the list of extensions */
00168    struct ast_context *next;     /*!< Link them together */
00169    struct ast_include *includes;    /*!< Include other contexts */
00170    struct ast_ignorepat *ignorepats;   /*!< Patterns for which to continue playing dialtone */
00171    const char *registrar;        /*!< Registrar */
00172    AST_LIST_HEAD_NOLOCK(, ast_sw) alts;   /*!< Alternative switches */
00173    ast_mutex_t macrolock;        /*!< A lock to implement "exclusive" macros - held whilst a call is executing in the macro */
00174    char name[0];           /*!< Name of the context */
00175 };
00176 
00177 
00178 /*! \brief ast_app: A registered application */
00179 struct ast_app {
00180    int (*execute)(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data);
00181    const char *synopsis;         /*!< Synopsis text for 'show applications' */
00182    const char *description;      /*!< Description (help text) for 'show application &lt;name&gt;' */
00183    AST_RWLIST_ENTRY(ast_app) list;     /*!< Next app in list */
00184    struct module *module;        /*!< Module this app belongs to */
00185    char name[0];           /*!< Name of the application */
00186 };
00187 
00188 /*! \brief ast_state_cb: An extension state notify register item */
00189 struct ast_state_cb {
00190    int id;
00191    void *data;
00192    ast_state_cb_type callback;
00193    struct ast_state_cb *next;
00194 };
00195 
00196 /*! \brief Structure for dial plan hints
00197 
00198   \note Hints are pointers from an extension in the dialplan to one or
00199   more devices (tech/name) 
00200    - See \ref AstExtState
00201 */
00202 struct ast_hint {
00203    struct ast_exten *exten;   /*!< Extension */
00204    int laststate;          /*!< Last known state */
00205    struct ast_state_cb *callbacks;  /*!< Callback list for this extension */
00206    AST_RWLIST_ENTRY(ast_hint) list;/*!< Pointer to next hint in list */
00207 };

00278    "This application will play the given list of files while waiting for an\n"
00279    "extension to be dialed by the calling channel. To continue waiting for digits\n"
00280    "after this application has finished playing files, the WaitExten application\n"
00281    "should be used. The 'langoverride' option explicitly specifies which language\n"
00282    "to attempt to use for the requested sound files. If a 'context' is specified,\n"
00283    "this is the dialplan context that this application will use when exiting to a\n"

00290    "          hasn't been answered yet). If this happens, the\n"
00291    "          application will return immediately.\n"
00292    "    n - Don't answer the channel before playing the files.\n"
00293    "    m - Only break if a digit hit matches a one digit\n"
00294    "          extension in the destination context.\n"
00295    "This application sets the following channel variable upon completion:\n"

00323    { "Goto", pbx_builtin_goto,
00324    "Jump to a particular priority, extension, or context",
00325    "  Goto([[context|]extension|]priority): This application will set the current\n"
00326    "context, extension, and priority in the channel structure. After it completes, the\n"
00327    "pbx engine will continue dialplan execution at the specified location.\n"
00328    "If no specific extension, or extension and context, are specified, then this\n"
00329    "application will just set the specified priority of the current extension.\n"
00330    "  At least a priority is required as an argument, or the goto will return a -1,\n"
00331    "and the channel and call will be terminated.\n"
00332    "  If the location that is put into the channel information is bogus, and asterisk cannot\n"
00333         "find that location in the dialplan,\n"
00334    "then the execution engine will try to find and execute the code in the 'i' (invalid)\n"
00335    "extension in the current context. If that does not exist, it will try to execute the\n"
00336    "'h' extension. If either or neither the 'h' or 'i' extensions have been defined, the\n"
00337    "channel is hung up, and the execution of instructions on the channel is terminated.\n"
00338    "What this means is that, for example, you specify a context that does not exist, then\n"
00339    "it will not be possible to find the 'h' or 'i' extensions, and the call will terminate!\n"
00340    },
00341 
00342    { "GotoIf", pbx_builtin_gotoif,
00343    "Conditional goto",
00344    "  GotoIf(condition?[labeliftrue]:[labeliffalse]): This application will set the current\n"
00345    "context, extension, and priority in the channel structure based on the evaluation of\n"
00346    "the given condition. After this application completes, the\n"
00347    "pbx engine will continue dialplan execution at the specified location in the dialplan.\n"
00348    "The channel will continue at\n"
00349    "'labeliftrue' if the condition is true, or 'labeliffalse' if the condition is\n"
00350    "false. The labels are specified with the same syntax as used within the Goto\n"
00351    "application.  If the label chosen by the condition is omitted, no jump is\n"
00352    "performed, and the execution passes to the next instruction.\n"
00353    "If the target location is bogus, and does not exist, the execution engine will try \n"
00354    "to find and execute the code in the 'i' (invalid)\n"
00355    "extension in the current context. If that does not exist, it will try to execute the\n"
00356    "'h' extension. If either or neither the 'h' or 'i' extensions have been defined, the\n"
00357    "channel is hung up, and the execution of instructions on the channel is terminated.\n"
00358    "Remember that this command can set the current context, and if the context specified\n"
00359    "does not exist, then it will not be able to find any 'h' or 'i' extensions there, and\n"
00360    "the channel and call will both be terminated!\n"
00361    },

00489 static struct ast_context *contexts;
00490 AST_RWLOCK_DEFINE_STATIC(conlock);     /*!< Lock for the ast_context list */
00491 
00492 static AST_RWLIST_HEAD_STATIC(apps, ast_app);

00494 static AST_RWLIST_HEAD_STATIC(switches, ast_switch);
00495 
00496 static int stateid = 1;
00497 /* WARNING:
00498    When holding this list's lock, do _not_ do anything that will cause conlock
00499    to be taken, unless you _already_ hold it. The ast_merge_contexts_and_delete
00500    function will take the locks in conlock/hints order, so any other
00501    paths that require both locks must also take them in that order.
00502 */
00503 static AST_RWLIST_HEAD_STATIC(hints, ast_hint);
00504 struct ast_state_cb *statecbs;
00505 
00506 /*
00507    \note This function is special. It saves the stack so that no matter
00508    how many times it is called, it returns to the same place */
00509 int pbx_exec(struct ast_channel *c,       /*!< Channel */
00510         struct ast_app *app,     /*!< Application */
00511         void *data)        /*!< Data for execution */
00512 {
00513    int res;
00514 
00515    const char *saved_c_appl;
00516    const char *saved_c_data;
00517 
00518    if (c->cdr &&  !ast_check_hangup(c))
00519       ast_cdr_setapp(c->cdr, app->name, data);
00520 
00521    /* save channel values */
00522    saved_c_appl= c->appl;
00523    saved_c_data= c->data;
00524 
00525    c->appl = app->name;
00526    c->data = data;
00527    /* XXX remember what to to when we have linked apps to modules */
00528    if (app->module) {
00529       /* XXX LOCAL_USER_ADD(app->module) */
00530    }
00531    res = app->execute(c, data);
00532    if (app->module) {
00533       /* XXX LOCAL_USER_REMOVE(app->module) */
00534    }
00535    /* restore channel values */
00536    c->appl = saved_c_appl;
00537    c->data = saved_c_data;
00538    return res;
00539 }
00540 
00541 
00542 /*! Go no deeper than this through includes (not counting loops) */
00543 #define AST_PBX_MAX_STACK  128
00544 
00545 /*! \brief Find application handle in linked list
00546  */
00547 struct ast_app *pbx_findapp(const char *app)
00548 {
00549    struct ast_app *tmp;
00550 
00551    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&apps);
00552    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&apps, tmp, list) {
00553       if (!strcasecmp(tmp->name, app))
00554          break;
00555    }
00556    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&apps);
00557 
00558    return tmp;
00559 }
00560 
00561 static struct ast_switch *pbx_findswitch(const char *sw)
00562 {
00563    struct ast_switch *asw;
00564 
00565    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&switches);
00566    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&switches, asw, list) {
00567       if (!strcasecmp(asw->name, sw))
00568          break;
00569    }
00570    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&switches);
00571 
00572    return asw;
00573 }
00574 
00575 static inline int include_valid(struct ast_include *i)
00576 {
00577    if (!i->hastime)
00578       return 1;
00579 
00580    return ast_check_timing(&(i->timing));
00581 }
00582 
00583 static void pbx_destroy(struct ast_pbx *p)
00584 {
00585    free(p);
00586 }
00587 
00588 /*
00589  * Special characters used in patterns:
00590  * '_'   underscore is the leading character of a pattern.
00591  *    In other position it is treated as a regular char.
00592  * ' ' '-'  space and '-' are separator and ignored.
00593  * .  one or more of any character. Only allowed at the end of
00594  *    a pattern.
00595  * !  zero or more of anything. Also impacts the result of CANMATCH
00596  *    and MATCHMORE. Only allowed at the end of a pattern.
00597  *    In the core routine, ! causes a match with a return code of 2.
00598  *    In turn, depending on the search mode: (XXX check if it is implemented)
00599  *    - E_MATCH retuns 1 (does match)
00600  *    - E_MATCHMORE returns 0 (no match)
00601  *    - E_CANMATCH returns 1 (does match)
00602  *
00603  * /  should not appear as it is considered the separator of the CID info.
00604  *    XXX at the moment we may stop on this char.
00605  *
00606  * X Z N match ranges 0-9, 1-9, 2-9 respectively.
00607  * [  denotes the start of a set of character. Everything inside
00608  *    is considered literally. We can have ranges a-d and individual
00609  *    characters. A '[' and '-' can be considered literally if they
00610  *    are just before ']'.
00611  *    XXX currently there is no way to specify ']' in a range, nor \ is
00612  *    considered specially.
00613  *
00614  * When we compare a pattern with a specific extension, all characters in the extension
00615  * itself are considered literally with the only exception of '-' which is considered
00616  * as a separator and thus ignored.
00617  * XXX do we want to consider space as a separator as well ?
00618  * XXX do we want to consider the separators in non-patterns as well ?
00619  */
00620 
00621 /*!
00622  * \brief helper functions to sort extensions and patterns in the desired way,
00623  * so that more specific patterns appear first.
00624  *
00625  * ext_cmp1 compares individual characters (or sets of), returning
00626  * an int where bits 0-7 are the ASCII code of the first char in the set,
00627  * while bit 8-15 are the cardinality of the set minus 1.
00628  * This way more specific patterns (smaller cardinality) appear first.
00629  * Wildcards have a special value, so that we can directly compare them to
00630  * sets by subtracting the two values. In particular:
00631  *    0x000xx     one character, xx
00632  *    0x0yyxx     yy character set starting with xx
00633  *    0x10000     '.' (one or more of anything)
00634  *    0x20000     '!' (zero or more of anything)
00635  *    0x30000     NUL (end of string)
00636  *    0x40000     error in set.
00637  * The pointer to the string is advanced according to needs.
00638  * NOTES:
00639  * 1. the empty set is equivalent to NUL.
00640  * 2. given that a full set has always 0 as the first element,
00641  *    we could encode the special cases as 0xffXX where XX
00642  *    is 1, 2, 3, 4 as used above.
00643  */
00644 static int ext_cmp1(const char **p)
00645 {
00646    uint32_t chars[8];
00647    int c, cmin = 0xff, count = 0;
00648    const char *end;
00649 
00650    /* load, sign extend and advance pointer until we find
00651     * a valid character.
00652     */
00653    while ( (c = *(*p)++) && (c == ' ' || c == '-') )
00654       ;  /* ignore some characters */
00655 
00656    /* always return unless we have a set of chars */
00657    switch (c) {
00658    default: /* ordinary character */
00659       return 0x0000 | (c & 0xff);
00660 
00661    case 'N':   /* 2..9 */
00662       return 0x0700 | '2' ;
00663 
00664    case 'X':   /* 0..9 */
00665       return 0x0900 | '0';
00666 
00667    case 'Z':   /* 1..9 */
00668       return 0x0800 | '1';
00669 
00670    case '.':   /* wildcard */
00671       return 0x10000;
00672 
00673    case '!':   /* earlymatch */
00674       return 0x20000;   /* less specific than NULL */
00675 
00676    case '\0':  /* empty string */
00677       *p = NULL;
00678       return 0x30000;
00679 
00680    case '[':   /* pattern */
00681       break;
00682    }
00683    /* locate end of set */
00684    end = strchr(*p, ']');  
00685 
00686    if (end == NULL) {
00687       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Wrong usage of [] in the extension\n");
00688       return 0x40000;   /* XXX make this entry go last... */
00689    }
00690 
00691    bzero(chars, sizeof(chars));  /* clear all chars in the set */
00692    for (; *p < end  ; (*p)++) {
00693       unsigned char c1, c2;   /* first-last char in range */
00694       c1 = (unsigned char)((*p)[0]);
00695       if (*p + 2 < end && (*p)[1] == '-') { /* this is a range */
00696          c2 = (unsigned char)((*p)[2]);
00697          *p += 2; /* skip a total of 3 chars */
00698       } else         /* individual character */
00699          c2 = c1;
00700       if (c1 < cmin)
00701          cmin = c1;
00702       for (; c1 <= c2; c1++) {
00703          uint32_t mask = 1 << (c1 % 32);
00704          if ( (chars[ c1 / 32 ] & mask) == 0)
00705             count += 0x100;
00706          chars[ c1 / 32 ] |= mask;
00707       }
00708    }
00709    (*p)++;
00710    return count == 0 ? 0x30000 : (count | cmin);
00711 }
00712 
00713 /*!
00714  * \brief the full routine to compare extensions in rules.
00715  */
00716 static int ext_cmp(const char *a, const char *b)
00717 {
00718    /* make sure non-patterns come first.
00719     * If a is not a pattern, it either comes first or
00720     * we use strcmp to compare the strings.
00721     */
00722    int ret = 0;
00723 
00724    if (a[0] != '_')
00725       return (b[0] == '_') ? -1 : strcmp(a, b);
00726 
00727    /* Now we know a is a pattern; if b is not, a comes first */
00728    if (b[0] != '_')
00729       return 1;
00730 #if 0 /* old mode for ext matching */
00731    return strcmp(a, b);
00732 #endif
00733    /* ok we need full pattern sorting routine */
00734    while (!ret && a && b)
00735       ret = ext_cmp1(&a) - ext_cmp1(&b);
00736    if (ret == 0)
00737       return 0;
00738    else
00739       return (ret > 0) ? 1 : -1;
00740 }
00741 
00742 /*!
00743  * When looking up extensions, we can have different requests
00744  * identified by the 'action' argument, as follows.
00745  * Note that the coding is such that the low 4 bits are the
00746  * third argument to extension_match_core.
00747  */
00748 enum ext_match_t {
00749    E_MATCHMORE =  0x00, /* extension can match but only with more 'digits' */
00750    E_CANMATCH =   0x01, /* extension can match with or without more 'digits' */
00751    E_MATCH =   0x02, /* extension is an exact match */
00752    E_MATCH_MASK = 0x03, /* mask for the argument to extension_match_core() */
00753    E_SPAWN =   0x12, /* want to spawn an extension. Requires exact match */
00754    E_FINDLABEL =  0x22  /* returns the priority for a given label. Requires exact match */
00755 };
00756 
00757 /*
00758  * Internal function for ast_extension_{match|close}
00759  * return 0 on no-match, 1 on match, 2 on early match.
00760  * mode is as follows:
00761  * E_MATCH     success only on exact match
00762  * E_MATCHMORE success only on partial match (i.e. leftover digits in pattern)
00763  * E_CANMATCH  either of the above.
00764  */
00765 
00766 static int _extension_match_core(const char *pattern, const char *data, enum ext_match_t mode)
00767 {
00768    mode &= E_MATCH_MASK;   /* only consider the relevant bits */
00769 
00770    if ( (mode == E_MATCH) && (pattern[0] == '_') && (strcasecmp(pattern,data)==0) ) /* note: if this test is left out, then _x. will not match _x. !!! */
00771       return 1;
00772 
00773    if (pattern[0] != '_') { /* not a pattern, try exact or partial match */
00774       int ld = strlen(data), lp = strlen(pattern);
00775 
00776       if (lp < ld)      /* pattern too short, cannot match */
00777          return 0;
00778       /* depending on the mode, accept full or partial match or both */
00779       if (mode == E_MATCH)
00780          return !strcmp(pattern, data); /* 1 on match, 0 on fail */
00781       if (ld == 0 || !strncasecmp(pattern, data, ld)) /* partial or full match */
00782          return (mode == E_MATCHMORE) ? lp > ld : 1; /* XXX should consider '!' and '/' ? */
00783       else
00784          return 0;
00785    }
00786    pattern++; /* skip leading _ */
00787    /*
00788     * XXX below we stop at '/' which is a separator for the CID info. However we should
00789     * not store '/' in the pattern at all. When we insure it, we can remove the checks.
00790     */
00791    while (*data && *pattern && *pattern != '/') {
00792       const char *end;
00793 
00794       if (*data == '-') { /* skip '-' in data (just a separator) */
00795          data++;
00796          continue;
00797       }
00798       switch (toupper(*pattern)) {
00799       case '[':   /* a range */
00800          end = strchr(pattern+1, ']'); /* XXX should deal with escapes ? */
00801          if (end == NULL) {
00802             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Wrong usage of [] in the extension\n");
00803             return 0;   /* unconditional failure */
00804          }
00805          for (pattern++; pattern != end; pattern++) {
00806             if (pattern+2 < end && pattern[1] == '-') { /* this is a range */
00807                if (*data >= pattern[0] && *data <= pattern[2])
00808                   break;   /* match found */
00809                else {
00810                   pattern += 2; /* skip a total of 3 chars */
00811                   continue;
00812                }
00813             } else if (*data == pattern[0])
00814                break;   /* match found */
00815          }
00816          if (pattern == end)
00817             return 0;
00818          pattern = end; /* skip and continue */
00819          break;
00820       case 'N':
00821          if (*data < '2' || *data > '9')
00822             return 0;
00823          break;
00824       case 'X':
00825          if (*data < '0' || *data > '9')
00826             return 0;
00827          break;
00828       case 'Z':
00829          if (*data < '1' || *data > '9')
00830             return 0;
00831          break;
00832       case '.':   /* Must match, even with more digits */
00833          return 1;
00834       case '!':   /* Early match */
00835          return 2;
00836       case ' ':
00837       case '-':   /* Ignore these in patterns */
00838          data--; /* compensate the final data++ */
00839          break;
00840       default:
00841          if (*data != *pattern)
00842             return 0;
00843       }
00844       data++;
00845       pattern++;
00846    }
00847    if (*data)        /* data longer than pattern, no match */
00848       return 0;
00849    /*
00850     * match so far, but ran off the end of the data.
00851     * Depending on what is next, determine match or not.
00852     */
00853    if (*pattern == '\0' || *pattern == '/')  /* exact match */
00854       return (mode == E_MATCHMORE) ? 0 : 1;  /* this is a failure for E_MATCHMORE */
00855    else if (*pattern == '!')        /* early match */
00856       return 2;
00857    else                 /* partial match */
00858       return (mode == E_MATCH) ? 0 : 1;   /* this is a failure for E_MATCH */
00859 }
00860 
00861 /*
00862  * Wrapper around _extension_match_core() to do performance measurement
00863  * using the profiling code.
00864  */
00865 static int extension_match_core(const char *pattern, const char *data, enum ext_match_t mode)
00866 {
00867    int i;
00868    static int prof_id = -2;   /* marker for 'unallocated' id */
00869    if (prof_id == -2)
00870       prof_id = ast_add_profile("ext_match", 0);
00871    ast_mark(prof_id, 1);
00872    i = _extension_match_core(pattern, data, mode);
00873    ast_mark(prof_id, 0);
00874    return i;
00875 }
00876 
00877 int ast_extension_match(const char *pattern, const char *data)
00878 {
00879    return extension_match_core(pattern, data, E_MATCH);
00880 }
00881 
00882 int ast_extension_close(const char *pattern, const char *data, int needmore)
00883 {
00884    if (needmore != E_MATCHMORE && needmore != E_CANMATCH)
00885       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "invalid argument %d\n", needmore);
00886    return extension_match_core(pattern, data, needmore);
00887 }
00888 
00889 struct ast_context *ast_context_find(const char *name)
00890 {
00891    struct ast_context *tmp = NULL;
00892    ast_rdlock_contexts();
00893    while ( (tmp = ast_walk_contexts(tmp)) ) {
00894       if (!name || !strcasecmp(name, tmp->name))
00895          break;
00896    }
00897    ast_unlock_contexts();
00898    return tmp;
00899 }
00900 
00901 #define STATUS_NO_CONTEXT  1
00902 #define STATUS_NO_EXTENSION   2
00903 #define STATUS_NO_PRIORITY 3
00904 #define STATUS_NO_LABEL    4
00905 #define STATUS_SUCCESS     5
00906 
00907 static int matchcid(const char *cidpattern, const char *callerid)
00908 {
00909    /* If the Caller*ID pattern is empty, then we're matching NO Caller*ID, so
00910       failing to get a number should count as a match, otherwise not */
00911 
00912    if (ast_strlen_zero(callerid))
00913       return ast_strlen_zero(cidpattern) ? 1 : 0;
00914 
00915    return ast_extension_match(cidpattern, callerid);
00916 }
00917 
00918 /* request and result for pbx_find_extension */
00919 struct pbx_find_info {
00920 #if 0
00921    const char *context;
00922    const char *exten;
00923    int priority;
00924 #endif
00925 
00926    char *incstack[AST_PBX_MAX_STACK];      /* filled during the search */
00927    int stacklen;                   /* modified during the search */
00928    int status;                     /* set on return */
00929    struct ast_switch *swo;         /* set on return */
00930    const char *data;               /* set on return */
00931    const char *foundcontext;       /* set on return */
00932 };
00933 
00934 static struct ast_exten *pbx_find_extension(struct ast_channel *chan,
00935    struct ast_context *bypass, struct pbx_find_info *q,
00936    const char *context, const char *exten, int priority,
00937    const char *label, const char *callerid, enum ext_match_t action)
00938 {
00939    int x, res;
00940    struct ast_context *tmp;
00941    struct ast_exten *e, *eroot;
00942    struct ast_include *i;
00943    struct ast_sw *sw;
00944 
00945    /* Initialize status if appropriate */
00946    if (q->stacklen == 0) {
00947       q->status = STATUS_NO_CONTEXT;
00948       q->swo = NULL;
00949       q->data = NULL;
00950       q->foundcontext = NULL;
00951    } else if (q->stacklen >= AST_PBX_MAX_STACK) {
00952       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Maximum PBX stack exceeded\n");
00953       return NULL;
00954    }
00955 
00956    /* Check first to see if we've already been checked */
00957    for (x = 0; x < q->stacklen; x++) {
00958       if (!strcasecmp(q->incstack[x], context))
00959          return NULL;
00960    }
00961 
00962    if (bypass) /* bypass means we only look there */
00963       tmp = bypass;
00964    else {   /* look in contexts */
00965       tmp = NULL;
00966       while ((tmp = ast_walk_contexts(tmp)) ) {
00967          if (!strcmp(tmp->name, context))
00968             break;
00969       }
00970       if (!tmp)
00971          return NULL;
00972    }
00973 
00974    if (q->status < STATUS_NO_EXTENSION)
00975       q->status = STATUS_NO_EXTENSION;
00976 
00977    /* scan the list trying to match extension and CID */
00978    eroot = NULL;
00979    while ( (eroot = ast_walk_context_extensions(tmp, eroot)) ) {
00980       int match = extension_match_core(eroot->exten, exten, action);
00981       /* 0 on fail, 1 on match, 2 on earlymatch */
00982 
00983       if (!match || (eroot->matchcid && !matchcid(eroot->cidmatch, callerid)))
00984          continue;   /* keep trying */
00985       if (match == 2 && action == E_MATCHMORE) {
00986          /* We match an extension ending in '!'.
00987           * The decision in this case is final and is NULL (no match).
00988           */
00989          return NULL;
00990       }
00991       /* found entry, now look for the right priority */
00992       if (q->status < STATUS_NO_PRIORITY)
00993          q->status = STATUS_NO_PRIORITY;
00994       e = NULL;
00995       while ( (e = ast_walk_extension_priorities(eroot, e)) ) {
00996          /* Match label or priority */
00997          if (action == E_FINDLABEL) {
00998             if (q->status < STATUS_NO_LABEL)
00999                q->status = STATUS_NO_LABEL;
01000             if (label && e->label && !strcmp(label, e->label))
01001                break;   /* found it */
01002          } else if (e->priority == priority) {
01003             break;   /* found it */
01004          } /* else keep searching */
01005       }
01006       if (e) { /* found a valid match */
01007          q->status = STATUS_SUCCESS;
01008          q->foundcontext = context;
01009          return e;
01010       }
01011    }
01012    /* Check alternative switches */
01013    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&tmp->alts, sw, list) {
01014       struct ast_switch *asw = pbx_findswitch(sw->name);
01015       ast_switch_f *aswf = NULL;
01016       char *datap;
01017 
01018       if (!asw) {
01019          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No such switch '%s'\n", sw->name);
01020          continue;
01021       }
01022       /* Substitute variables now */
01023       if (sw->eval)
01024          pbx_substitute_variables_helper(chan, sw->data, sw->tmpdata, SWITCH_DATA_LENGTH - 1);
01025 
01026       /* equivalent of extension_match_core() at the switch level */
01027       if (action == E_CANMATCH)
01028          aswf = asw->canmatch;
01029       else if (action == E_MATCHMORE)
01030          aswf = asw->matchmore;
01031       else /* action == E_MATCH */
01032          aswf = asw->exists;
01033       datap = sw->eval ? sw->tmpdata : sw->data;
01034       res = !aswf ? 0 : aswf(chan, context, exten, priority, callerid, datap);
01035       if (res) {  /* Got a match */
01036          q->swo = asw;
01037          q->data = datap;
01038          q->foundcontext = context;
01039          /* XXX keep status = STATUS_NO_CONTEXT ? */
01040          return NULL;
01041       }
01042    }
01043    q->incstack[q->stacklen++] = tmp->name;   /* Setup the stack */
01044    /* Now try any includes we have in this context */
01045    for (i = tmp->includes; i; i = i->next) {
01046       if (include_valid(i)) {
01047          if ((e = pbx_find_extension(chan, bypass, q, i->rname, exten, priority, label, callerid, action)))
01048             return e;
01049          if (q->swo)
01050             return NULL;
01051       }
01052    }
01053    return NULL;
01054 }
01055 
01056 /*! \brief extract offset:length from variable name.
01057  * Returns 1 if there is a offset:length part, which is
01058  * trimmed off (values go into variables)
01059  */
01060 static int parse_variable_name(char *var, int *offset, int *length, int *isfunc)
01061 {
01062    int parens=0;
01063 
01064    *offset = 0;
01065    *length = INT_MAX;
01066    *isfunc = 0;
01067    for (; *var; var++) {
01068       if (*var == '(') {
01069          (*isfunc)++;
01070          parens++;
01071       } else if (*var == ')') {
01072          parens--;
01073       } else if (*var == ':' && parens == 0) {
01074          *var++ = '\0';
01075          sscanf(var, "%d:%d", offset, length);
01076          return 1; /* offset:length valid */
01077       }
01078    }
01079    return 0;
01080 }
01081 
01082 /*! \brief takes a substring. It is ok to call with value == workspace.
01083  *
01084  * offset < 0 means start from the end of the string and set the beginning
01085  *   to be that many characters back.
01086  * length is the length of the substring.  A value less than 0 means to leave
01087  * that many off the end.
01088  * Always return a copy in workspace.
01089  */
01090 static char *substring(const char *value, int offset, int length, char *workspace, size_t workspace_len)
01091 {
01092    char *ret = workspace;
01093    int lr;  /* length of the input string after the copy */
01094 
01095    ast_copy_string(workspace, value, workspace_len); /* always make a copy */
01096 
01097    lr = strlen(ret); /* compute length after copy, so we never go out of the workspace */
01098 
01099    /* Quick check if no need to do anything */
01100    if (offset == 0 && length >= lr) /* take the whole string */
01101       return ret;
01102 
01103    if (offset < 0)   {  /* translate negative offset into positive ones */
01104       offset = lr + offset;
01105       if (offset < 0) /* If the negative offset was greater than the length of the string, just start at the beginning */
01106          offset = 0;
01107    }
01108 
01109    /* too large offset result in empty string so we know what to return */
01110    if (offset >= lr)
01111       return ret + lr;  /* the final '\0' */
01112 
01113    ret += offset;    /* move to the start position */
01114    if (length >= 0 && length < lr - offset)  /* truncate if necessary */
01115       ret[length] = '\0';
01116    else if (length < 0) {
01117       if (lr > offset - length) /* After we remove from the front and from the rear, is there anything left? */
01118          ret[lr + length - offset] = '\0';
01119       else
01120          ret[0] = '\0';
01121    }
01122 
01123    return ret;
01124 }
01125 
01126 /*! \brief  Support for Asterisk built-in variables in the dialplan
01127 
01128 \note See also
01129    - \ref AstVar  Channel variables
01130    - \ref AstCauses The HANGUPCAUSE variable
01131  */
01132 void pbx_retrieve_variable(struct ast_channel *c, const char *var, char **ret, char *workspace, int workspacelen, struct varshead *headp)
01133 {
01134    const char not_found = '\0';
01135    char *tmpvar;
01136    const char *s; /* the result */
01137    int offset, length;
01138    int i, need_substring;
01139    struct varshead *places[2] = { headp, &globals };  /* list of places where we may look */
01140 
01141    if (c) {
01142       places[0] = &c->varshead;
01143    }
01144    /*
01145     * Make a copy of var because parse_variable_name() modifies the string.
01146     * Then if called directly, we might need to run substring() on the result;
01147     * remember this for later in 'need_substring', 'offset' and 'length'
01148     */
01149    tmpvar = ast_strdupa(var); /* parse_variable_name modifies the string */
01150    need_substring = parse_variable_name(tmpvar, &offset, &length, &i /* ignored */);
01151 
01152    /*
01153     * Look first into predefined variables, then into variable lists.
01154     * Variable 's' points to the result, according to the following rules:
01155     * s == &not_found (set at the beginning) means that we did not find a
01156     * matching variable and need to look into more places.
01157     * If s != &not_found, s is a valid result string as follows:
01158     * s = NULL if the variable does not have a value;
01159     * you typically do this when looking for an unset predefined variable.
01160     * s = workspace if the result has been assembled there;
01161     * typically done when the result is built e.g. with an snprintf(),
01162     * so we don't need to do an additional copy.
01163     * s != workspace in case we have a string, that needs to be copied
01164     * (the ast_copy_string is done once for all at the end).
01165     * Typically done when the result is already available in some string.
01166     */
01167    s = &not_found;   /* default value */
01168    if (c) { /* This group requires a valid channel */
01169       /* Names with common parts are looked up a piece at a time using strncmp. */
01170       if (!strncmp(var, "CALL", 4)) {
01171          if (!strncmp(var + 4, "ING", 3)) {
01172             if (!strcmp(var + 7, "PRES")) {        /* CALLINGPRES */
01173                snprintf(workspace, workspacelen, "%d", c->cid.cid_pres);
01174                s = workspace;
01175             } else if (!strcmp(var + 7, "ANI2")) {    /* CALLINGANI2 */
01176                snprintf(workspace, workspacelen, "%d", c->cid.cid_ani2);
01177                s = workspace;
01178             } else if (!strcmp(var + 7, "TON")) {     /* CALLINGTON */
01179                snprintf(workspace, workspacelen, "%d", c->cid.cid_ton);
01180                s = workspace;
01181             } else if (!strcmp(var + 7, "TNS")) {     /* CALLINGTNS */
01182                snprintf(workspace, workspacelen, "%d", c->cid.cid_tns);
01183                s = workspace;
01184             }
01185          }
01186       } else if (!strcmp(var, "HINT")) {
01187          s = ast_get_hint(workspace, workspacelen, NULL, 0, c, c->context, c->exten) ? workspace : NULL;
01188       } else if (!strcmp(var, "HINTNAME")) {
01189          s = ast_get_hint(NULL, 0, workspace, workspacelen, c, c->context, c->exten) ? workspace : NULL;
01190       } else if (!strcmp(var, "EXTEN")) {
01191          s = c->exten;
01192       } else if (!strcmp(var, "CONTEXT")) {
01193          s = c->context;
01194       } else if (!strcmp(var, "PRIORITY")) {
01195          snprintf(workspace, workspacelen, "%d", c->priority);
01196          s = workspace;
01197       } else if (!strcmp(var, "CHANNEL")) {
01198          s = c->name;
01199       } else if (!strcmp(var, "UNIQUEID")) {
01200          s = c->uniqueid;
01201       } else if (!strcmp(var, "HANGUPCAUSE")) {
01202          snprintf(workspace, workspacelen, "%d", c->hangupcause);
01203          s = workspace;
01204       }
01205    }
01206    if (s == &not_found) { /* look for more */
01207       if (!strcmp(var, "EPOCH")) {
01208          snprintf(workspace, workspacelen, "%u",(int)time(NULL));
01209          s = workspace;
01210       } else if (!strcmp(var, "SYSTEMNAME")) {
01211          s = ast_config_AST_SYSTEM_NAME;
01212       }
01213    }
01214    /* if not found, look into chanvars or global vars */
01215    for (i = 0; s == &not_found && i < (sizeof(places) / sizeof(places[0])); i++) {
01216       struct ast_var_t *variables;
01217       if (!places[i])
01218          continue;
01219       if (places[i] == &globals)
01220          ast_rwlock_rdlock(&globalslock);
01221       AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(places[i], variables, entries) {
01222          if (strcasecmp(ast_var_name(variables), var)==0) {
01223             s = ast_var_value(variables);
01224             break;
01225          }
01226       }
01227       if (places[i] == &globals)
01228          ast_rwlock_unlock(&globalslock);
01229    }
01230    if (s == &not_found || s == NULL)
01231       *ret = NULL;
01232    else {
01233       if (s != workspace)
01234          ast_copy_string(workspace, s, workspacelen);
01235       *ret = workspace;
01236       if (need_substring)
01237          *ret = substring(*ret, offset, length, workspace, workspacelen);
01238    }
01239 }
01240 
01241 static int handle_show_functions(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
01242 {
01243    struct ast_custom_function *acf;
01244    int count_acf = 0;
01245    int like = 0;
01246 
01247    if (argc == 5 && (!strcmp(argv[3], "like")) ) {
01248       like = 1;
01249    } else if (argc != 3) {
01250       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
01251    }
01252 
01253    ast_cli(fd, "%s Custom Functions:\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------------\n", like ? "Matching" : "Installed");
01254 
01255    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&acf_root);
01256    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&acf_root, acf, acflist) {
01257       if (!like || strstr(acf->name, argv[4])) {
01258          count_acf++;
01259          ast_cli(fd, "%-20.20s  %-35.35s  %s\n", acf->name, acf->syntax, acf->synopsis);
01260       }
01261    }
01262    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&acf_root);
01263 
01264    ast_cli(fd, "%d %scustom functions installed.\n", count_acf, like ? "matching " : "");
01265 
01266    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
01267 }
01268 
01269 static int handle_show_function(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
01270 {
01271    struct ast_custom_function *acf;
01272    /* Maximum number of characters added by terminal coloring is 22 */
01273    char infotitle[64 + AST_MAX_APP + 22], syntitle[40], destitle[40];
01274    char info[64 + AST_MAX_APP], *synopsis = NULL, *description = NULL;
01275    char stxtitle[40], *syntax = NULL;
01276    int synopsis_size, description_size, syntax_size;
01277 
01278    if (argc < 4)
01279       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
01280 
01281    if (!(acf = ast_custom_function_find(argv[3]))) {
01282       ast_cli(fd, "No function by that name registered.\n");
01283       return RESULT_FAILURE;
01284 
01285    }
01286 
01287    if (acf->synopsis)
01288       synopsis_size = strlen(acf->synopsis) + 23;
01289    else
01290       synopsis_size = strlen("Not available") + 23;
01291    synopsis = alloca(synopsis_size);
01292 
01293    if (acf->desc)
01294       description_size = strlen(acf->desc) + 23;
01295    else
01296       description_size = strlen("Not available") + 23;
01297    description = alloca(description_size);
01298 
01299    if (acf->syntax)
01300       syntax_size = strlen(acf->syntax) + 23;
01301    else
01302       syntax_size = strlen("Not available") + 23;
01303    syntax = alloca(syntax_size);
01304 
01305    snprintf(info, 64 + AST_MAX_APP, "\n  -= Info about function '%s' =- \n\n", acf->name);
01306    term_color(infotitle, info, COLOR_MAGENTA, 0, 64 + AST_MAX_APP + 22);
01307    term_color(stxtitle, "[Syntax]\n", COLOR_MAGENTA, 0, 40);
01308    term_color(syntitle, "[Synopsis]\n", COLOR_MAGENTA, 0, 40);
01309    term_color(destitle, "[Description]\n", COLOR_MAGENTA, 0, 40);
01310    term_color(syntax,
01311          acf->syntax ? acf->syntax : "Not available",
01312          COLOR_CYAN, 0, syntax_size);
01313    term_color(synopsis,
01314          acf->synopsis ? acf->synopsis : "Not available",
01315          COLOR_CYAN, 0, synopsis_size);
01316    term_color(description,
01317          acf->desc ? acf->desc : "Not available",
01318          COLOR_CYAN, 0, description_size);
01319 
01320    ast_cli(fd,"%s%s%s\n\n%s%s\n\n%s%s\n", infotitle, stxtitle, syntax, syntitle, synopsis, destitle, description);
01321 
01322    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
01323 }
01324 
01325 static char *complete_show_function(const char *line, const char *word, int pos, int state)
01326 {
01327    struct ast_custom_function *acf;
01328    char *ret = NULL;
01329    int which = 0;
01330    int wordlen = strlen(word);
01331 
01332    /* case-insensitive for convenience in this 'complete' function */
01333    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&acf_root);
01334    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&acf_root, acf, acflist) {
01335       if (!strncasecmp(word, acf->name, wordlen) && ++which > state) {
01336          ret = strdup(acf->name);
01337          break;
01338       }
01339    }
01340    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&acf_root);
01341 
01342    return ret;
01343 }
01344 
01345 struct ast_custom_function *ast_custom_function_find(const char *name)
01346 {
01347    struct ast_custom_function *acf = NULL;
01348 
01349    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&acf_root);
01350    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&acf_root, acf, acflist) {
01351       if (!strcmp(name, acf->name))
01352          break;
01353    }
01354    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&acf_root);
01355 
01356    return acf;
01357 }
01358 
01359 int ast_custom_function_unregister(struct ast_custom_function *acf)
01360 {
01361    struct ast_custom_function *cur;
01362 
01363    if (!acf)
01364       return -1;
01365 
01366    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&acf_root);
01367    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&acf_root, cur, acflist) {
01368       if (cur == acf) {
01369          AST_RWLIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&acf_root, acflist);
01370          if (option_verbose > 1)
01371             ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Unregistered custom function %s\n", acf->name);
01372          break;
01373       }
01374    }
01375    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END
01376    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&acf_root);
01377 
01378    return acf ? 0 : -1;
01379 }
01380 
01381 int ast_custom_function_register(struct ast_custom_function *acf)
01382 {
01383    struct ast_custom_function *cur;
01384 
01385    if (!acf)
01386       return -1;
01387 
01388    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&acf_root);
01389 
01390    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&acf_root, cur, acflist) {
01391       if (!strcmp(acf->name, cur->name)) {
01392          ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Function %s already registered.\n", acf->name);
01393          AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&acf_root);
01394          return -1;
01395       }
01396    }
01397 
01398    /* Store in alphabetical order */
01399    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&acf_root, cur, acflist) {
01400       if (strcasecmp(acf->name, cur->name) < 0) {
01401          AST_RWLIST_INSERT_BEFORE_CURRENT(&acf_root, acf, acflist);
01402          break;
01403       }
01404    }
01405    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END
01406    if (!cur)
01407       AST_RWLIST_INSERT_TAIL(&acf_root, acf, acflist);
01408 
01409    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&acf_root);
01410 
01411    if (option_verbose > 1)
01412       ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Registered custom function %s\n", acf->name);
01413 
01414    return 0;
01415 }
01416 
01417 /*! \brief return a pointer to the arguments of the function,
01418  * and terminates the function name with '\\0'
01419  */
01420 static char *func_args(char *function)
01421 {
01422    char *args = strchr(function, '(');
01423 
01424    if (!args)
01425       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Function doesn't contain parentheses.  Assuming null argument.\n");
01426    else {
01427       char *p;
01428       *args++ = '\0';
01429       if ((p = strrchr(args, ')')) )
01430          *p = '\0';
01431       else
01432          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Can't find trailing parenthesis?\n");
01433    }
01434    return args;
01435 }
01436 
01437 int ast_func_read(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *function, char *workspace, size_t len)
01438 {
01439    char *copy = ast_strdupa(function);
01440    char *args = func_args(copy);
01441    struct ast_custom_function *acfptr = ast_custom_function_find(copy);
01442 
01443    if (acfptr == NULL)
01444       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Function %s not registered\n", copy);
01445    else if (!acfptr->read)
01446       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Function %s cannot be read\n", copy);
01447    else
01448       return acfptr->read(chan, copy, args, workspace, len);
01449    return -1;
01450 }
01451 
01452 int ast_func_write(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *function, const char *value)
01453 {
01454    char *copy = ast_strdupa(function);
01455    char *args = func_args(copy);
01456    struct ast_custom_function *acfptr = ast_custom_function_find(copy);
01457 
01458    if (acfptr == NULL)
01459       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Function %s not registered\n", copy);
01460    else if (!acfptr->write)
01461       ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Function %s cannot be written to\n", copy);
01462    else
01463       return acfptr->write(chan, copy, args, value);
01464 
01465    return -1;
01466 }
01467 
01468 static void pbx_substitute_variables_helper_full(struct ast_channel *c, struct varshead *headp, const char *cp1, char *cp2, int count)
01469 {
01470    /* Substitutes variables into cp2, based on string cp1, and assuming cp2 to be
01471       zero-filled */
01472    char *cp4;
01473    const char *tmp, *whereweare;
01474    int length, offset, offset2, isfunction;
01475    char *workspace = NULL;
01476    char *ltmp = NULL, *var = NULL;
01477    char *nextvar, *nextexp, *nextthing;
01478    char *vars, *vare;
01479    int pos, brackets, needsub, len;
01480 
01481    whereweare=tmp=cp1;
01482    while (!ast_strlen_zero(whereweare) && count) {
01483       /* Assume we're copying the whole remaining string */
01484       pos = strlen(whereweare);
01485       nextvar = NULL;
01486       nextexp = NULL;
01487       nextthing = strchr(whereweare, '$');
01488       if (nextthing) {
01489          switch (nextthing[1]) {
01490          case '{':
01491             nextvar = nextthing;
01492             pos = nextvar - whereweare;
01493             break;
01494          case '[':
01495             nextexp = nextthing;
01496             pos = nextexp - whereweare;
01497             break;
01498          }
01499       }
01500 
01501       if (pos) {
01502          /* Can't copy more than 'count' bytes */
01503          if (pos > count)
01504             pos = count;
01505 
01506          /* Copy that many bytes */
01507          memcpy(cp2, whereweare, pos);
01508 
01509          count -= pos;
01510          cp2 += pos;
01511          whereweare += pos;
01512       }
01513 
01514       if (nextvar) {
01515          /* We have a variable.  Find the start and end, and determine
01516             if we are going to have to recursively call ourselves on the
01517             contents */
01518          vars = vare = nextvar + 2;
01519          brackets = 1;
01520          needsub = 0;
01521 
01522          /* Find the end of it */
01523          while (brackets && *vare) {
01524             if ((vare[0] == '$') && (vare[1] == '{')) {
01525                needsub++;
01526             } else if (vare[0] == '{') {
01527                brackets++;
01528             } else if (vare[0] == '}') {
01529                brackets--;
01530             } else if ((vare[0] == '$') && (vare[1] == '['))
01531                needsub++;
01532             vare++;
01533          }
01534          if (brackets)
01535             ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Error in extension logic (missing '}')\n");
01536          len = vare - vars - 1;
01537 
01538          /* Skip totally over variable string */
01539          whereweare += (len + 3);
01540 
01541          if (!var)
01542             var = alloca(VAR_BUF_SIZE);
01543 
01544          /* Store variable name (and truncate) */
01545          ast_copy_string(var, vars, len + 1);
01546 
01547          /* Substitute if necessary */
01548          if (needsub) {
01549             if (!ltmp)
01550                ltmp = alloca(VAR_BUF_SIZE);
01551 
01552             memset(ltmp, 0, VAR_BUF_SIZE);
01553             pbx_substitute_variables_helper_full(c, headp, var, ltmp, VAR_BUF_SIZE - 1);
01554             vars = ltmp;
01555          } else {
01556             vars = var;
01557          }
01558 
01559          if (!workspace)
01560             workspace = alloca(VAR_BUF_SIZE);
01561 
01562          workspace[0] = '\0';
01563 
01564          parse_variable_name(vars, &offset, &offset2, &isfunction);
01565          if (isfunction) {
01566             /* Evaluate function */
01567             if (c || !headp)
01568                cp4 = ast_func_read(c, vars, workspace, VAR_BUF_SIZE) ? NULL : workspace;
01569             else {
01570                struct varshead old;
01571                struct ast_channel *c = ast_channel_alloc(0, 0, "", "", "", "", "", 0, "Bogus/%p", vars);
01572                if (c) {
01573                   memcpy(&old, &c->varshead, sizeof(old));
01574                   memcpy(&c->varshead, headp, sizeof(c->varshead));
01575                   cp4 = ast_func_read(c, vars, workspace, VAR_BUF_SIZE) ? NULL : workspace;
01576                   /* Don't deallocate the varshead that was passed in */
01577                   memcpy(&c->varshead, &old, sizeof(c->varshead));
01578                   ast_channel_free(c);
01579                } else
01580                   ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unable to allocate bogus channel for variable substitution.  Function results may be blank.\n");
01581             }
01582             if (option_debug)
01583                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Function result is '%s'\n", cp4 ? cp4 : "(null)");
01584          } else {
01585             /* Retrieve variable value */
01586             pbx_retrieve_variable(c, vars, &cp4, workspace, VAR_BUF_SIZE, headp);
01587          }
01588          if (cp4) {
01589             cp4 = substring(cp4, offset, offset2, workspace, VAR_BUF_SIZE);
01590 
01591             length = strlen(cp4);
01592             if (length > count)
01593                length = count;
01594             memcpy(cp2, cp4, length);
01595             count -= length;
01596             cp2 += length;
01597          }
01598       } else if (nextexp) {
01599          /* We have an expression.  Find the start and end, and determine
01600             if we are going to have to recursively call ourselves on the
01601             contents */
01602          vars = vare = nextexp + 2;
01603          brackets = 1;
01604          needsub = 0;
01605 
01606          /* Find the end of it */
01607          while (brackets && *vare) {
01608             if ((vare[0] == '$') && (vare[1] == '[')) {
01609                needsub++;
01610                brackets++;
01611                vare++;
01612             } else if (vare[0] == '[') {
01613                brackets++;
01614             } else if (vare[0] == ']') {
01615                brackets--;
01616             } else if ((vare[0] == '$') && (vare[1] == '{')) {
01617                needsub++;
01618                vare++;
01619             }
01620             vare++;
01621          }
01622          if (brackets)
01623             ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Error in extension logic (missing ']')\n");
01624          len = vare - vars - 1;
01625 
01626          /* Skip totally over expression */
01627          whereweare += (len + 3);
01628 
01629          if (!var)
01630             var = alloca(VAR_BUF_SIZE);
01631 
01632          /* Store variable name (and truncate) */
01633          ast_copy_string(var, vars, len + 1);
01634 
01635          /* Substitute if necessary */
01636          if (needsub) {
01637             if (!ltmp)
01638                ltmp = alloca(VAR_BUF_SIZE);
01639 
01640             memset(ltmp, 0, VAR_BUF_SIZE);
01641             pbx_substitute_variables_helper_full(c, headp, var, ltmp, VAR_BUF_SIZE - 1);
01642             vars = ltmp;
01643          } else {
01644             vars = var;
01645          }
01646 
01647          length = ast_expr(vars, cp2, count);
01648 
01649          if (length) {
01650             if (option_debug)
01651                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Expression result is '%s'\n", cp2);
01652             count -= length;
01653             cp2 += length;
01654          }
01655       } else
01656          break;
01657    }
01658 }
01659 
01660 void pbx_substitute_variables_helper(struct ast_channel *c, const char *cp1, char *cp2, int count)
01661 {
01662    pbx_substitute_variables_helper_full(c, (c) ? &c->varshead : NULL, cp1, cp2, count);
01663 }
01664 
01665 void pbx_substitute_variables_varshead(struct varshead *headp, const char *cp1, char *cp2, int count)
01666 {
01667    pbx_substitute_variables_helper_full(NULL, headp, cp1, cp2, count);
01668 }
01669 
01670 static void pbx_substitute_variables(char *passdata, int datalen, struct ast_channel *c, struct ast_exten *e)
01671 {
01672    memset(passdata, 0, datalen);
01673 
01674    /* No variables or expressions in e->data, so why scan it? */
01675    if (e->data && !strchr(e->data, '$') && !strstr(e->data,"${") && !strstr(e->data,"$[") && !strstr(e->data,"$(")) {
01676       ast_copy_string(passdata, e->data, datalen);
01677       return;
01678    }
01679 
01680    pbx_substitute_variables_helper(c, e->data, passdata, datalen - 1);
01681 }
01682 
01683 /*! \brief The return value depends on the action:
01684  *
01685  * E_MATCH, E_CANMATCH, E_MATCHMORE require a real match,
01686  * and return 0 on failure, -1 on match;
01687  * E_FINDLABEL maps the label to a priority, and returns
01688  * the priority on success, ... XXX
01689  * E_SPAWN, spawn an application,
01690  * and return 0 on success, -1 on failure.
01691  */
01692 static int pbx_extension_helper(struct ast_channel *c, struct ast_context *con,
01693    const char *context, const char *exten, int priority,
01694    const char *label, const char *callerid, enum ext_match_t action)
01695 {
01696    struct ast_exten *e;
01697    struct ast_app *app;
01698    int res;
01699    struct pbx_find_info q = { .stacklen = 0 }; /* the rest is reset in pbx_find_extension */
01700    char passdata[EXT_DATA_SIZE];
01701 
01702    int matching_action = (action == E_MATCH || action == E_CANMATCH || action == E_MATCHMORE);
01703 
01704    ast_rdlock_contexts();
01705    e = pbx_find_extension(c, con, &q, context, exten, priority, label, callerid, action);
01706    if (e) {
01707       if (matching_action) {
01708          ast_unlock_contexts();
01709          return -1;  /* success, we found it */
01710       } else if (action == E_FINDLABEL) { /* map the label to a priority */
01711          res = e->priority;
01712          ast_unlock_contexts();
01713          return res; /* the priority we were looking for */
01714       } else { /* spawn */
01715          if (!e->cached_app)
01716             e->cached_app = pbx_findapp(e->app);
01717          app = e->cached_app;
01718          ast_unlock_contexts();
01719          if (!app) {
01720             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No application '%s' for extension (%s, %s, %d)\n", e->app, context, exten, priority);
01721             return -1;
01722          }
01723          if (c->context != context)
01724             ast_copy_string(c->context, context, sizeof(c->context));
01725          if (c->exten != exten)
01726             ast_copy_string(c->exten, exten, sizeof(c->exten));
01727          c->priority = priority;
01728          pbx_substitute_variables(passdata, sizeof(passdata), c, e);
01729          if (option_debug) {
01730             char atmp[80];
01731             char atmp2[EXT_DATA_SIZE+100];
01732             if (option_debug)
01733                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Launching '%s'\n", app->name);
01734             snprintf(atmp, sizeof(atmp), "STACK-%s-%s-%d", context, exten, priority);
01735             snprintf(atmp2, sizeof(atmp2), "%s(\"%s\", \"%s\") %s",
01736                app->name, c->name, passdata, "in new stack");
01737             pbx_builtin_setvar_helper(c, atmp, atmp2);
01738          }
01739          if (option_verbose > 2) {
01740             char tmp[80], tmp2[80], tmp3[EXT_DATA_SIZE];
01741             ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Executing [%s@%s:%d] %s(\"%s\", \"%s\") %s\n",
01742                exten, context, priority,
01743                term_color(tmp, app->name, COLOR_BRCYAN, 0, sizeof(tmp)),
01744                term_color(tmp2, c->name, COLOR_BRMAGENTA, 0, sizeof(tmp2)),
01745                term_color(tmp3, passdata, COLOR_BRMAGENTA, 0, sizeof(tmp3)),
01746                "in new stack");
01747          }
01748          manager_event(EVENT_FLAG_CALL, "Newexten",
01749                "Channel: %s\r\n"
01750                "Context: %s\r\n"
01751                "Extension: %s\r\n"
01752                "Priority: %d\r\n"
01753                "Application: %s\r\n"
01754                "AppData: %s\r\n"
01755                "Uniqueid: %s\r\n",
01756                c->name, c->context, c->exten, c->priority, app->name, passdata, c->uniqueid);
01757          return pbx_exec(c, app, passdata);  /* 0 on success, -1 on failure */
01758       }
01759    } else if (q.swo) {  /* not found here, but in another switch */
01760       ast_unlock_contexts();
01761       if (matching_action)
01762          return -1;
01763       else {
01764          if (!q.swo->exec) {
01765             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No execution engine for switch %s\n", q.swo->name);
01766             res = -1;
01767          }
01768          return q.swo->exec(c, q.foundcontext ? q.foundcontext : context, exten, priority, callerid, q.data);
01769       }
01770    } else { /* not found anywhere, see what happened */
01771       ast_unlock_contexts();
01772       switch (q.status) {
01773       case STATUS_NO_CONTEXT:
01774          if (!matching_action)
01775             ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Cannot find extension context '%s'\n", context);
01776          break;
01777       case STATUS_NO_EXTENSION:
01778          if (!matching_action)
01779             ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Cannot find extension '%s' in context '%s'\n", exten, context);
01780          break;
01781       case STATUS_NO_PRIORITY:
01782          if (!matching_action)
01783             ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "No such priority %d in extension '%s' in context '%s'\n", priority, exten, context);
01784          break;
01785       case STATUS_NO_LABEL:
01786          if (context)
01787             ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "No such label '%s' in extension '%s' in context '%s'\n", label, exten, context);
01788          break;
01789       default:
01790          if (option_debug)
01791             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Shouldn't happen!\n");
01792       }
01793 
01794       return (matching_action) ? 0 : -1;
01795    }
01796 }
01797 
01798 /*! \brief  ast_hint_extension: Find hint for given extension in context */
01799 static struct ast_exten *ast_hint_extension(struct ast_channel *c, const char *context, const char *exten)
01800 {
01801    struct ast_exten *e;
01802    struct pbx_find_info q = { .stacklen = 0 }; /* the rest is set in pbx_find_context */
01803 
01804    ast_rdlock_contexts();
01805    e = pbx_find_extension(c, NULL, &q, context, exten, PRIORITY_HINT, NULL, "", E_MATCH);
01806    ast_unlock_contexts();
01807 
01808    return e;
01809 }
01810 
01811 /*! \brief  ast_extensions_state2: Check state of extension by using hints */
01812 static int ast_extension_state2(struct ast_exten *e)
01813 {
01814    char hint[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];
01815    char *cur, *rest;
01816    int allunavailable = 1, allbusy = 1, allfree = 1, allonhold = 1;
01817    int busy = 0, inuse = 0, ring = 0;
01818 
01819    if (!e)
01820       return -1;
01821 
01822    ast_copy_string(hint, ast_get_extension_app(e), sizeof(hint));
01823 
01824    rest = hint;   /* One or more devices separated with a & character */
01825    while ( (cur = strsep(&rest, "&")) ) {
01826       int res = ast_device_state(cur);
01827       switch (res) {
01828       case AST_DEVICE_NOT_INUSE:
01829          allunavailable = 0;
01830          allbusy = 0;
01831          allonhold = 0;
01832          break;
01833       case AST_DEVICE_INUSE:
01834          inuse = 1;
01835          allunavailable = 0;
01836          allfree = 0;
01837          allonhold = 0;
01838          break;
01839       case AST_DEVICE_RINGING:
01840          ring = 1;
01841          allunavailable = 0;
01842          allfree = 0;
01843          allonhold = 0;
01844          break;
01845       case AST_DEVICE_RINGINUSE:
01846          inuse = 1;
01847          ring = 1;
01848          allunavailable = 0;
01849          allfree = 0;
01850          allonhold = 0;
01851          break;
01852       case AST_DEVICE_ONHOLD:
01853          allunavailable = 0;
01854          allfree = 0;
01855          break;
01856       case AST_DEVICE_BUSY:
01857          allunavailable = 0;
01858          allfree = 0;
01859          allonhold = 0;
01860          busy = 1;
01861          break;
01862       case AST_DEVICE_UNAVAILABLE:
01863       case AST_DEVICE_INVALID:
01864          allbusy = 0;
01865          allfree = 0;
01866          allonhold = 0;
01867          break;
01868       default:
01869          allunavailable = 0;
01870          allbusy = 0;
01871          allfree = 0;
01872          allonhold = 0;
01873       }
01874    }
01875 
01876    if (!inuse && ring)
01877       return AST_EXTENSION_RINGING;
01878    if (inuse && ring)
01879       return (AST_EXTENSION_INUSE | AST_EXTENSION_RINGING);
01880    if (inuse)
01881       return AST_EXTENSION_INUSE;
01882    if (allfree)
01883       return AST_EXTENSION_NOT_INUSE;
01884    if (allonhold)
01885       return AST_EXTENSION_ONHOLD;
01886    if (allbusy)
01887       return AST_EXTENSION_BUSY;
01888    if (allunavailable)
01889       return AST_EXTENSION_UNAVAILABLE;
01890    if (busy)
01891       return AST_EXTENSION_INUSE;
01892 
01893    return AST_EXTENSION_NOT_INUSE;
01894 }
01895 
01896 /*! \brief  ast_extension_state2str: Return extension_state as string */
01897 const char *ast_extension_state2str(int extension_state)
01898 {
01899    int i;
01900 
01901    for (i = 0; (i < (sizeof(extension_states) / sizeof(extension_states[0]))); i++) {
01902       if (extension_states[i].extension_state == extension_state)
01903          return extension_states[i].text;
01904    }
01905    return "Unknown";
01906 }
01907 
01908 /*! \brief  ast_extension_state: Check extension state for an extension by using hint */
01909 int ast_extension_state(struct ast_channel *c, const char *context, const char *exten)
01910 {
01911    struct ast_exten *e;
01912 
01913    e = ast_hint_extension(c, context, exten);   /* Do we have a hint for this extension ? */
01914    if (!e)
01915       return -1;           /* No hint, return -1 */
01916 
01917    return ast_extension_state2(e);        /* Check all devices in the hint */
01918 }
01919 
01920 void ast_hint_state_changed(const char *device)
01921 {
01922    struct ast_hint *hint;
01923 
01924    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&hints);
01925 
01926    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&hints, hint, list) {
01927       struct ast_state_cb *cblist;
01928       char buf[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];
01929       char *parse = buf;
01930       char *cur;
01931       int state;
01932 
01933       ast_copy_string(buf, ast_get_extension_app(hint->exten), sizeof(buf));
01934       while ( (cur = strsep(&parse, "&")) ) {
01935          if (!strcasecmp(cur, device))
01936             break;
01937       }
01938       if (!cur)
01939          continue;
01940 
01941       /* Get device state for this hint */
01942       state = ast_extension_state2(hint->exten);
01943 
01944       if ((state == -1) || (state == hint->laststate))
01945          continue;
01946 
01947       /* Device state changed since last check - notify the watchers */
01948 
01949       /* For general callbacks */
01950       for (cblist = statecbs; cblist; cblist = cblist->next)
01951          cblist->callback(hint->exten->parent->name, hint->exten->exten, state, cblist->data);
01952 
01953       /* For extension callbacks */
01954       for (cblist = hint->callbacks; cblist; cblist = cblist->next)
01955          cblist->callback(hint->exten->parent->name, hint->exten->exten, state, cblist->data);
01956 
01957       hint->laststate = state;   /* record we saw the change */
01958    }
01959 
01960    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
01961 }
01962 
01963 /*! \brief  ast_extension_state_add: Add watcher for extension states */
01964 int ast_extension_state_add(const char *context, const char *exten,
01965              ast_state_cb_type callback, void *data)
01966 {
01967    struct ast_hint *hint;
01968    struct ast_state_cb *cblist;
01969    struct ast_exten *e;
01970 
01971    /* If there's no context and extension:  add callback to statecbs list */
01972    if (!context && !exten) {
01973       AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&hints);
01974 
01975       for (cblist = statecbs; cblist; cblist = cblist->next) {
01976          if (cblist->callback == callback) {
01977             cblist->data = data;
01978             AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
01979             return 0;
01980          }
01981       }
01982 
01983       /* Now insert the callback */
01984       if (!(cblist = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*cblist)))) {
01985          AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
01986          return -1;
01987       }
01988       cblist->id = 0;
01989       cblist->callback = callback;
01990       cblist->data = data;
01991 
01992       cblist->next = statecbs;
01993       statecbs = cblist;
01994 
01995       AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
01996       return 0;
01997    }
01998 
01999    if (!context || !exten)
02000       return -1;
02001 
02002    /* This callback type is for only one hint, so get the hint */
02003    e = ast_hint_extension(NULL, context, exten);
02004    if (!e) {
02005       return -1;
02006    }
02007 
02008    /* Find the hint in the list of hints */
02009    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&hints);
02010 
02011    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&hints, hint, list) {
02012       if (hint->exten == e)
02013          break;
02014    }
02015 
02016    if (!hint) {
02017       /* We have no hint, sorry */
02018       AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
02019       return -1;
02020    }
02021 
02022    /* Now insert the callback in the callback list  */
02023    if (!(cblist = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*cblist)))) {
02024       AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
02025       return -1;
02026    }
02027    cblist->id = stateid++;    /* Unique ID for this callback */
02028    cblist->callback = callback;  /* Pointer to callback routine */
02029    cblist->data = data;    /* Data for the callback */
02030 
02031    cblist->next = hint->callbacks;
02032    hint->callbacks = cblist;
02033 
02034    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
02035    return cblist->id;
02036 }
02037 
02038 /*! \brief  ast_extension_state_del: Remove a watcher from the callback list */
02039 int ast_extension_state_del(int id, ast_state_cb_type callback)
02040 {
02041    struct ast_state_cb **p_cur = NULL; /* address of pointer to us */
02042    int ret = -1;
02043 
02044    if (!id && !callback)
02045       return -1;
02046 
02047    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&hints);
02048 
02049    if (!id) {  /* id == 0 is a callback without extension */
02050       for (p_cur = &statecbs; *p_cur; p_cur = &(*p_cur)->next) {
02051          if ((*p_cur)->callback == callback)
02052             break;
02053       }
02054    } else { /* callback with extension, find the callback based on ID */
02055       struct ast_hint *hint;
02056       AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&hints, hint, list) {
02057          for (p_cur = &hint->callbacks; *p_cur; p_cur = &(*p_cur)->next) {
02058             if ((*p_cur)->id == id)
02059                break;
02060          }
02061          if (*p_cur) /* found in the inner loop */
02062             break;
02063       }
02064    }
02065    if (p_cur && *p_cur) {
02066       struct ast_state_cb *cur = *p_cur;
02067       *p_cur = cur->next;
02068       free(cur);
02069       ret = 0;
02070    }
02071    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
02072    return ret;
02073 }
02074 
02075 /*! \brief  ast_add_hint: Add hint to hint list, check initial extension state */
02076 static int ast_add_hint(struct ast_exten *e)
02077 {
02078    struct ast_hint *hint;
02079 
02080    if (!e)
02081       return -1;
02082 
02083    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&hints);
02084 
02085    /* Search if hint exists, do nothing */
02086    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&hints, hint, list) {
02087       if (hint->exten == e) {
02088          AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
02089          if (option_debug > 1)
02090             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "HINTS: Not re-adding existing hint %s: %s\n", ast_get_extension_name(e), ast_get_extension_app(e));
02091          return -1;
02092       }
02093    }
02094 
02095    if (option_debug > 1)
02096       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "HINTS: Adding hint %s: %s\n", ast_get_extension_name(e), ast_get_extension_app(e));
02097 
02098    if (!(hint = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*hint)))) {
02099       AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
02100       return -1;
02101    }
02102    /* Initialize and insert new item at the top */
02103    hint->exten = e;
02104    hint->laststate = ast_extension_state2(e);
02105    AST_RWLIST_INSERT_HEAD(&hints, hint, list);
02106 
02107    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
02108    return 0;
02109 }
02110 
02111 /*! \brief  ast_change_hint: Change hint for an extension */
02112 static int ast_change_hint(struct ast_exten *oe, struct ast_exten *ne)
02113 {
02114    struct ast_hint *hint;
02115    int res = -1;
02116 
02117    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&hints);
02118    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&hints, hint, list) {
02119       if (hint->exten == oe) {
02120             hint->exten = ne;
02121          res = 0;
02122          break;
02123       }
02124    }
02125    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
02126 
02127    return res;
02128 }
02129 
02130 /*! \brief  ast_remove_hint: Remove hint from extension */
02131 static int ast_remove_hint(struct ast_exten *e)
02132 {
02133    /* Cleanup the Notifys if hint is removed */
02134    struct ast_hint *hint;
02135    struct ast_state_cb *cblist, *cbprev;
02136    int res = -1;
02137 
02138    if (!e)
02139       return -1;
02140 
02141    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&hints, hint, list) {
02142       if (hint->exten == e) {
02143          cbprev = NULL;
02144          cblist = hint->callbacks;
02145          while (cblist) {
02146             /* Notify with -1 and remove all callbacks */
02147             cbprev = cblist;
02148             cblist = cblist->next;
02149             cbprev->callback(hint->exten->parent->name, hint->exten->exten, AST_EXTENSION_DEACTIVATED, cbprev->data);
02150             free(cbprev);
02151             }
02152             hint->callbacks = NULL;
02153          AST_RWLIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&hints, list);
02154             free(hint);
02155             res = 0;
02156          break;
02157       }
02158    }
02159    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END
02160 
02161    return res;
02162 }
02163 
02164 
02165 /*! \brief  ast_get_hint: Get hint for channel */
02166 int ast_get_hint(char *hint, int hintsize, char *name, int namesize, struct ast_channel *c, const char *context, const char *exten)
02167 {
02168    struct ast_exten *e = ast_hint_extension(c, context, exten);
02169 
02170    if (e) {
02171       if (hint)
02172          ast_copy_string(hint, ast_get_extension_app(e), hintsize);
02173       if (name) {
02174          const char *tmp = ast_get_extension_app_data(e);
02175          if (tmp)
02176             ast_copy_string(name, tmp, namesize);
02177       }
02178       return -1;
02179    }
02180    return 0;
02181 }
02182 
02183 int ast_exists_extension(struct ast_channel *c, const char *context, const char *exten, int priority, const char *callerid)
02184 {
02185    return pbx_extension_helper(c, NULL, context, exten, priority, NULL, callerid, E_MATCH);
02186 }
