02188 int ast_findlabel_extension(struct ast_channel *c, const char *context, const char *exten, const char *label, const char *callerid)
02189 {
02190    return pbx_extension_helper(c, NULL, context, exten, 0, label, callerid, E_FINDLABEL);
02191 }
02192 
02193 int ast_findlabel_extension2(struct ast_channel *c, struct ast_context *con, const char *exten, const char *label, const char *callerid)
02194 {
02195    return pbx_extension_helper(c, con, NULL, exten, 0, label, callerid, E_FINDLABEL);
02196 }
02197 
02198 int ast_canmatch_extension(struct ast_channel *c, const char *context, const char *exten, int priority, const char *callerid)
02199 {
02200    return pbx_extension_helper(c, NULL, context, exten, priority, NULL, callerid, E_CANMATCH);
02201 }
02202 
02203 int ast_matchmore_extension(struct ast_channel *c, const char *context, const char *exten, int priority, const char *callerid)
02204 {
02205    return pbx_extension_helper(c, NULL, context, exten, priority, NULL, callerid, E_MATCHMORE);
02206 }
02207 
02208 int ast_spawn_extension(struct ast_channel *c, const char *context, const char *exten, int priority, const char *callerid)
02209 {
02210    return pbx_extension_helper(c, NULL, context, exten, priority, NULL, callerid, E_SPAWN);
02211 }
02212 
02213 /* helper function to set extension and priority */
02214 static void set_ext_pri(struct ast_channel *c, const char *exten, int pri)
02215 {
02216    ast_copy_string(c->exten, exten, sizeof(c->exten));
02217    c->priority = pri;
02218 }
02219 
02220 /*!
02221  * \brief collect digits from the channel into the buffer,
02222  * return -1 on error, 0 on timeout or done.
02223  */
02224 static int collect_digits(struct ast_channel *c, int waittime, char *buf, int buflen, int pos)
02225 {
02226    int digit;
02227 
02228    buf[pos] = '\0';  /* make sure it is properly terminated */
02229    while (ast_matchmore_extension(c, c->context, buf, 1, c->cid.cid_num)) {
02230       /* As long as we're willing to wait, and as long as it's not defined,
02231          keep reading digits until we can't possibly get a right answer anymore.  */
02232       digit = ast_waitfordigit(c, waittime * 1000);
02233       if (c->_softhangup == AST_SOFTHANGUP_ASYNCGOTO) {
02234          c->_softhangup = 0;
02235       } else {
02236          if (!digit) /* No entry */
02237             break;
02238          if (digit < 0) /* Error, maybe a  hangup */
02239             return -1;
02240          if (pos < buflen - 1) { /* XXX maybe error otherwise ? */
02241             buf[pos++] = digit;
02242             buf[pos] = '\0';
02243          }
02244          waittime = c->pbx->dtimeout;
02245       }
02246    }
02247    return 0;
02248 }
02249 
02250 static int __ast_pbx_run(struct ast_channel *c)
02251 {
02252    int found = 0; /* set if we find at least one match */
02253    int res = 0;
02254    int autoloopflag;
02255    int error = 0;    /* set an error conditions */
02256 
02257    /* A little initial setup here */
02258    if (c->pbx) {
02259       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s already has PBX structure??\n", c->name);
02260       /* XXX and now what ? */
02261       free(c->pbx);
02262    }
02263    if (!(c->pbx = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*c->pbx))))
02264       return -1;
02265    if (c->amaflags) {
02266       if (!c->cdr) {
02267          c->cdr = ast_cdr_alloc();
02268          if (!c->cdr) {
02269             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to create Call Detail Record\n");
02270             free(c->pbx);
02271             return -1;
02272          }
02273          ast_cdr_init(c->cdr, c);
02274       }
02275    }
02276    /* Set reasonable defaults */
02277    c->pbx->rtimeout = 10;
02278    c->pbx->dtimeout = 5;
02279 
02280    autoloopflag = ast_test_flag(c, AST_FLAG_IN_AUTOLOOP);   /* save value to restore at the end */
02281    ast_set_flag(c, AST_FLAG_IN_AUTOLOOP);
02282 
02283    /* Start by trying whatever the channel is set to */
02284    if (!ast_exists_extension(c, c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->cid.cid_num)) {
02285       /* If not successful fall back to 's' */
02286       if (option_verbose > 1)
02287          ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Starting %s at %s,%s,%d failed so falling back to exten 's'\n", c->name, c->context, c->exten, c->priority);
02288       /* XXX the original code used the existing priority in the call to
02289        * ast_exists_extension(), and reset it to 1 afterwards.
02290        * I believe the correct thing is to set it to 1 immediately.
02291        */
02292       set_ext_pri(c, "s", 1);
02293       if (!ast_exists_extension(c, c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->cid.cid_num)) {
02294          /* JK02: And finally back to default if everything else failed */
02295          if (option_verbose > 1)
02296             ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Starting %s at %s,%s,%d still failed so falling back to context 'default'\n", c->name, c->context, c->exten, c->priority);
02297          ast_copy_string(c->context, "default", sizeof(c->context));
02298       }
02299    }
02300    if (c->cdr && ast_tvzero(c->cdr->start))
02301       ast_cdr_start(c->cdr);
02302    for (;;) {
02303       char dst_exten[256]; /* buffer to accumulate digits */
02304       int pos = 0;      /* XXX should check bounds */
02305       int digit = 0;
02306 
02307       /* loop on priorities in this context/exten */
02308       while (ast_exists_extension(c, c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->cid.cid_num)) {
02309          found = 1;
02310          if ((res = ast_spawn_extension(c, c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->cid.cid_num))) {
02311             /* Something bad happened, or a hangup has been requested. */
02312             if (strchr("0123456789ABCDEF*#", res)) {
02313                if (option_debug)
02314                   ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Oooh, got something to jump out with ('%c')!\n", res);
02315                pos = 0;
02316                dst_exten[pos++] = digit = res;
02317                dst_exten[pos] = '\0';
02318                break;
02319             }
02320             if (res == AST_PBX_KEEPALIVE) {
02321                if (option_debug)
02322                   ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Spawn extension (%s,%s,%d) exited KEEPALIVE on '%s'\n", c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->name);
02323                if (option_verbose > 1)
02324                   ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Spawn extension (%s, %s, %d) exited KEEPALIVE on '%s'\n", c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->name);
02325                error = 1;
02326                break;
02327             }
02328             if (option_debug)
02329                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Spawn extension (%s,%s,%d) exited non-zero on '%s'\n", c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->name);
02330             if (option_verbose > 1)
02331                ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Spawn extension (%s, %s, %d) exited non-zero on '%s'\n", c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->name);
02332             if (c->_softhangup == AST_SOFTHANGUP_ASYNCGOTO) {
02333                c->_softhangup =0;
02334             } else if (c->_softhangup == AST_SOFTHANGUP_TIMEOUT) {
02335                /* atimeout, nothing bad */
02336             } else {
02337                if (c->cdr)
02338                   ast_cdr_update(c);
02339                error = 1;
02340                break;
02341             }
02342          }
02343          if (c->_softhangup == AST_SOFTHANGUP_TIMEOUT && ast_exists_extension(c,c->context,"T",1,c->cid.cid_num)) {
02344             set_ext_pri(c, "T", 0); /* 0 will become 1 with the c->priority++; at the end */
02345             /* If the AbsoluteTimeout is not reset to 0, we'll get an infinite loop */
02346             c->whentohangup = 0;
02347             c->_softhangup &= ~AST_SOFTHANGUP_TIMEOUT;
02348          } else if (c->_softhangup) {
02349             if (option_debug)
02350                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Extension %s, priority %d returned normally even though call was hung up\n",
02351                   c->exten, c->priority);
02352             error = 1;
02353             break;
02354          }
02355          c->priority++;
02356       } /* end while  - from here on we can use 'break' to go out */
02357       if (error)
02358          break;
02359 
02360       /* XXX we get here on non-existing extension or a keypress or hangup ? */
02361 
02362       if (!ast_exists_extension(c, c->context, c->exten, 1, c->cid.cid_num)) {
02363          /* If there is no match at priority 1, it is not a valid extension anymore.
02364           * Try to continue at "i", 1 or exit if the latter does not exist.
02365           */
02366          if (ast_exists_extension(c, c->context, "i", 1, c->cid.cid_num)) {
02367             if (option_verbose > 2)
02368                ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Sent into invalid extension '%s' in context '%s' on %s\n", c->exten, c->context, c->name);
02369             pbx_builtin_setvar_helper(c, "INVALID_EXTEN", c->exten);
02370             set_ext_pri(c, "i", 1);
02371          } else {
02372             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Channel '%s' sent into invalid extension '%s' in context '%s', but no invalid handler\n",
02373                c->name, c->exten, c->context);
02374             error = 1; /* we know what to do with it */
02375             break;
02376          }
02377       } else if (c->_softhangup == AST_SOFTHANGUP_TIMEOUT) {
02378          /* If we get this far with AST_SOFTHANGUP_TIMEOUT, then we know that the "T" extension is next. */
02379          c->_softhangup = 0;
02380       } else { /* keypress received, get more digits for a full extension */
02381          int waittime = 0;
02382          if (digit)
02383             waittime = c->pbx->dtimeout;
02384          else if (!autofallthrough)
02385             waittime = c->pbx->rtimeout;
02386          if (!waittime) {
02387             const char *status = pbx_builtin_getvar_helper(c, "DIALSTATUS");
02388             if (!status)
02389                status = "UNKNOWN";
02390             if (option_verbose > 2)
02391                ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Auto fallthrough, channel '%s' status is '%s'\n", c->name, status);
02392             if (!strcasecmp(status, "CONGESTION"))
02393                res = pbx_builtin_congestion(c, "10");
02394             else if (!strcasecmp(status, "CHANUNAVAIL"))
02395                res = pbx_builtin_congestion(c, "10");
02396             else if (!strcasecmp(status, "BUSY"))
02397                res = pbx_builtin_busy(c, "10");
02398             error = 1; /* XXX disable message */
02399             break;   /* exit from the 'for' loop */
02400          }
02401 
02402          if (collect_digits(c, waittime, dst_exten, sizeof(dst_exten), pos))
02403             break;
02404          if (ast_exists_extension(c, c->context, dst_exten, 1, c->cid.cid_num)) /* Prepare the next cycle */
02405             set_ext_pri(c, dst_exten, 1);
02406          else {
02407             /* No such extension */
02408             if (!ast_strlen_zero(dst_exten)) {
02409                /* An invalid extension */
02410                if (ast_exists_extension(c, c->context, "i", 1, c->cid.cid_num)) {
02411                   if (option_verbose > 2)
02412                      ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Invalid extension '%s' in context '%s' on %s\n", dst_exten, c->context, c->name);
02413                   pbx_builtin_setvar_helper(c, "INVALID_EXTEN", dst_exten);
02414                   set_ext_pri(c, "i", 1);
02415                } else {
02416                   ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Invalid extension '%s', but no rule 'i' in context '%s'\n", dst_exten, c->context);
02417                   found = 1; /* XXX disable message */
02418                   break;
02419                }
02420             } else {
02421                /* A simple timeout */
02422                if (ast_exists_extension(c, c->context, "t", 1, c->cid.cid_num)) {
02423                   if (option_verbose > 2)
02424                      ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Timeout on %s\n", c->name);
02425                   set_ext_pri(c, "t", 1);
02426                } else {
02427                   ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Timeout, but no rule 't' in context '%s'\n", c->context);
02428                   found = 1; /* XXX disable message */
02429                   break;
02430                }
02431             }
02432          }
02433          if (c->cdr) {
02434             if (option_verbose > 2)
02435                ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "CDR updated on %s\n",c->name);
02436             ast_cdr_update(c);
02437          }
02438       }
02439    }
02440    if (!found && !error)
02441       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Don't know what to do with '%s'\n", c->name);
02442    if ((res != AST_PBX_KEEPALIVE) && ast_exists_extension(c, c->context, "h", 1, c->cid.cid_num)) {
02443       if (c->cdr && ast_opt_end_cdr_before_h_exten)
02444          ast_cdr_end(c->cdr);
02445       set_ext_pri(c, "h", 1);
02446       while (ast_exists_extension(c, c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->cid.cid_num)) {
02447          if ((res = ast_spawn_extension(c, c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->cid.cid_num))) {
02448             /* Something bad happened, or a hangup has been requested. */
02449             if (option_debug)
02450                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Spawn extension (%s,%s,%d) exited non-zero on '%s'\n", c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->name);
02451             if (option_verbose > 1)
02452                ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Spawn extension (%s, %s, %d) exited non-zero on '%s'\n", c->context, c->exten, c->priority, c->name);
02453             break;
02454          }
02455          c->priority++;
02456       }
02457    }
02458    ast_set2_flag(c, autoloopflag, AST_FLAG_IN_AUTOLOOP);
02459 
02460    pbx_destroy(c->pbx);
02461    c->pbx = NULL;
02462    if (res != AST_PBX_KEEPALIVE)
02463       ast_hangup(c);
02464    return 0;
02465 }
02466 
02467 /* Returns 0 on success, non-zero if a configured limit (maxcalls, maxload, minmemfree) was reached */
02468 static int increase_call_count(const struct ast_channel *c)
02469 {
02470    int failed = 0;
02471    double curloadavg;
02472 #if defined(HAVE_SYSINFO)
02473    long curfreemem;
02474    struct sysinfo sys_info;
02475 #endif
02476 
02477    ast_mutex_lock(&maxcalllock);
02478    if (option_maxcalls) {
02479       if (countcalls >= option_maxcalls) {
02480          ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Maximum call limit of %d calls exceeded by '%s'!\n", option_maxcalls, c->name);
02481          failed = -1;
02482       }
02483    }
02484    if (option_maxload) {
02485       getloadavg(&curloadavg, 1);
02486       if (curloadavg >= option_maxload) {
02487          ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Maximum loadavg limit of %f load exceeded by '%s' (currently %f)!\n", option_maxload, c->name, curloadavg);
02488          failed = -1;
02489       }
02490    }
02491 #if defined(HAVE_SYSINFO)
02492    if (option_minmemfree) {
02493       if (!sysinfo(&sys_info)) {
02494          /* make sure that the free system memory is above the configured low watermark
02495           * convert the amount of freeram from mem_units to MB */
02496          curfreemem = sys_info.freeram / sys_info.mem_unit; 
02497          curfreemem /= 1024*1024; 
02498          if (curfreemem < option_minmemfree) {
02499             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Available system memory (~%ldMB) is below the configured low watermark (%ldMB)\n", curfreemem, option_minmemfree);
02500             failed = -1;
02501          }
02502       }
02503    }
02504 #endif
02505       
02506    if (!failed)
02507       countcalls++;
02508    ast_mutex_unlock(&maxcalllock);
02509 
02510    return failed;
02511 }
02512 
02513 static void decrease_call_count(void)
02514 {
02515    ast_mutex_lock(&maxcalllock);
02516    if (countcalls > 0)
02517       countcalls--;
02518    ast_mutex_unlock(&maxcalllock);
02519 }
02520 
02521 static void destroy_exten(struct ast_exten *e)
02522 {
02523    if (e->priority == PRIORITY_HINT)
02524       ast_remove_hint(e);
02525 
02526    if (e->datad)
02527       e->datad(e->data);
02528    free(e);
02529 }
02530 
02531 static void *pbx_thread(void *data)
02532 {
02533    /* Oh joyeous kernel, we're a new thread, with nothing to do but
02534       answer this channel and get it going.
02535    */
02536    /* NOTE:
02537       The launcher of this function _MUST_ increment 'countcalls'
02538       before invoking the function; it will be decremented when the
02539       PBX has finished running on the channel
02540     */
02541    struct ast_channel *c = data;
02542 
02543    __ast_pbx_run(c);
02544    decrease_call_count();
02545 
02546    pthread_exit(NULL);
02547 
02548    return NULL;
02549 }
02550 
02551 enum ast_pbx_result ast_pbx_start(struct ast_channel *c)
02552 {
02553    pthread_t t;
02554 
02555    if (!c) {
02556       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Asked to start thread on NULL channel?\n");
02557       return AST_PBX_FAILED;
02558    }
02559 
02560    if (increase_call_count(c))
02561       return AST_PBX_CALL_LIMIT;
02562 
02563    /* Start a new thread, and get something handling this channel. */
02564    if (ast_pthread_create_detached(&t, NULL, pbx_thread, c)) {
02565       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed to create new channel thread\n");
02566       return AST_PBX_FAILED;
02567    }
02568 
02569    return AST_PBX_SUCCESS;
02570 }
02571 
02572 enum ast_pbx_result ast_pbx_run(struct ast_channel *c)
02573 {
02574    enum ast_pbx_result res = AST_PBX_SUCCESS;
02575 
02576    if (increase_call_count(c))
02577       return AST_PBX_CALL_LIMIT;
02578 
02579    res = __ast_pbx_run(c);
02580    decrease_call_count();
02581 
02582    return res;
02583 }
02584 
02585 int ast_active_calls(void)
02586 {
02587    return countcalls;
02588 }
02589 
02590 int pbx_set_autofallthrough(int newval)
02591 {
02592    int oldval = autofallthrough;
02593    autofallthrough = newval;
02594    return oldval;
02595 }
02596 
02597 /* lookup for a context with a given name,
02598  * return with conlock held if found, NULL if not found
02599  */
02600 static struct ast_context *find_context_locked(const char *context)
02601 {
02602    struct ast_context *c = NULL;
02603 
02604    ast_rdlock_contexts();
02605    while ( (c = ast_walk_contexts(c)) ) {
02606       if (!strcmp(ast_get_context_name(c), context))
02607          return c;
02608    }
02609    ast_unlock_contexts();
02610 
02611    return NULL;
02612 }
02613 
02614 /*
02615  * This function locks contexts list by &conlist, search for the right context
02616  * structure, leave context list locked and call ast_context_remove_include2
02617  * which removes include, unlock contexts list and return ...
02618  */
02619 int ast_context_remove_include(const char *context, const char *include, const char *registrar)
02620 {
02621    int ret = -1;
02622    struct ast_context *c = find_context_locked(context);
02623 
02624    if (c) {
02625       /* found, remove include from this context ... */
02626       ret = ast_context_remove_include2(c, include, registrar);
02627       ast_unlock_contexts();
02628    }
02629    return ret;
02630 }
02631 
02632 /*
02633  * When we call this function, &conlock lock must be locked, because when
02634  * we giving *con argument, some process can remove/change this context
02635  * and after that there can be segfault.
02636  *
02637  * This function locks given context, removes include, unlock context and
02638  * return.
02639  */
02640 int ast_context_remove_include2(struct ast_context *con, const char *include, const char *registrar)
02641 {
02642    struct ast_include *i, *pi = NULL;
02643    int ret = -1;
02644 
02645    ast_wrlock_context(con);
02646 
02647    /* find our include */
02648    for (i = con->includes; i; pi = i, i = i->next) {
02649       if (!strcmp(i->name, include) &&
02650             (!registrar || !strcmp(i->registrar, registrar))) {
02651          /* remove from list */
02652          if (pi)
02653             pi->next = i->next;
02654          else
02655             con->includes = i->next;
02656          /* free include and return */
02657          free(i);
02658          ret = 0;
02659          break;
02660       }
02661    }
02662 
02663    ast_unlock_context(con);
02664 
02665    return ret;
02666 }
02667 
02668 /*!
02669  * \note This function locks contexts list by &conlist, search for the rigt context
02670  * structure, leave context list locked and call ast_context_remove_switch2
02671  * which removes switch, unlock contexts list and return ...
02672  */
02673 int ast_context_remove_switch(const char *context, const char *sw, const char *data, const char *registrar)
02674 {
02675    int ret = -1; /* default error return */
02676    struct ast_context *c = find_context_locked(context);
02677 
02678    if (c) {
02679       /* remove switch from this context ... */
02680       ret = ast_context_remove_switch2(c, sw, data, registrar);
02681       ast_unlock_contexts();
02682    }
02683    return ret;
02684 }
02685 
02686 /*!
02687  * \brief This function locks given context, removes switch, unlock context and
02688  * return.
02689  * \note When we call this function, &conlock lock must be locked, because when
02690  * we giving *con argument, some process can remove/change this context
02691  * and after that there can be segfault.
02692  *
02693  */
02694 int ast_context_remove_switch2(struct ast_context *con, const char *sw, const char *data, const char *registrar)
02695 {
02696    struct ast_sw *i;
02697    int ret = -1;
02698 
02699    ast_wrlock_context(con);
02700 
02701    /* walk switches */
02702    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&con->alts, i, list) {
02703       if (!strcmp(i->name, sw) && !strcmp(i->data, data) &&
02704          (!registrar || !strcmp(i->registrar, registrar))) {
02705          /* found, remove from list */
02706          AST_LIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&con->alts, list);
02707          free(i); /* free switch and return */
02708          ret = 0;
02709          break;
02710       }
02711    }
02712    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END
02713 
02714    ast_unlock_context(con);
02715 
02716    return ret;
02717 }
02718 
02719 /*
02720  * \note This functions lock contexts list, search for the right context,
02721  * call ast_context_remove_extension2, unlock contexts list and return.
02722  * In this function we are using
02723  */
02724 int ast_context_remove_extension(const char *context, const char *extension, int priority, const char *registrar)
02725 {
02726    int ret = -1; /* default error return */
02727    struct ast_context *c = find_context_locked(context);
02728 
02729    if (c) { /* ... remove extension ... */
02730       ret = ast_context_remove_extension2(c, extension, priority, registrar);
02731       ast_unlock_contexts();
02732    }
02733    return ret;
02734 }
02735 
02736 /*!
02737  * \brief This functionc locks given context, search for the right extension and
02738  * fires out all peer in this extensions with given priority. If priority
02739  * is set to 0, all peers are removed. After that, unlock context and
02740  * return.
02741  * \note When do you want to call this function, make sure that &conlock is locked,
02742  * because some process can handle with your *con context before you lock
02743  * it.
02744  *
02745  */
02746 int ast_context_remove_extension2(struct ast_context *con, const char *extension, int priority, const char *registrar)
02747 {
02748    struct ast_exten *exten, *prev_exten = NULL;
02749    struct ast_exten *peer;
02750 
02751    ast_wrlock_context(con);
02752 
02753    /* scan the extension list to find matching extension-registrar */
02754    for (exten = con->root; exten; prev_exten = exten, exten = exten->next) {
02755       if (!strcmp(exten->exten, extension) &&
02756          (!registrar || !strcmp(exten->registrar, registrar)))
02757          break;
02758    }
02759    if (!exten) {
02760       /* we can't find right extension */
02761       ast_unlock_context(con);
02762       return -1;
02763    }
02764 
02765    /* should we free all peers in this extension? (priority == 0)? */
02766    if (priority == 0) {
02767       /* remove this extension from context list */
02768       if (prev_exten)
02769          prev_exten->next = exten->next;
02770       else
02771          con->root = exten->next;
02772 
02773       /* fire out all peers */
02774       while ( (peer = exten) ) {
02775          exten = peer->peer; /* prepare for next entry */
02776          destroy_exten(peer);
02777       }
02778    } else {
02779       /* scan the priority list to remove extension with exten->priority == priority */
02780       struct ast_exten *previous_peer = NULL;
02781 
02782       for (peer = exten; peer; previous_peer = peer, peer = peer->peer) {
02783          if (peer->priority == priority &&
02784                (!registrar || !strcmp(peer->registrar, registrar) ))
02785             break; /* found our priority */
02786       }
02787       if (!peer) { /* not found */
02788          ast_unlock_context(con);
02789          return -1;
02790       }
02791       /* we are first priority extension? */
02792       if (!previous_peer) {
02793          /*
02794           * We are first in the priority chain, so must update the extension chain.
02795           * The next node is either the next priority or the next extension
02796           */
02797          struct ast_exten *next_node = peer->peer ? peer->peer : peer->next;
02798 
02799          if (!prev_exten)  /* change the root... */
02800             con->root = next_node;
02801          else
02802             prev_exten->next = next_node; /* unlink */
02803          if (peer->peer)   /* XXX update the new head of the pri list */
02804             peer->peer->next = peer->next;
02805       } else { /* easy, we are not first priority in extension */
02806          previous_peer->peer = peer->peer;
02807       }
02808 
02809       /* now, free whole priority extension */
02810       destroy_exten(peer);
02811       /* XXX should we return -1 ? */
02812    }
02813    ast_unlock_context(con);
02814    return 0;
02815 }
02816 
02817 
02818 /*!
02819  * \note This function locks contexts list by &conlist, searches for the right context
02820  * structure, and locks the macrolock mutex in that context.
02821  * macrolock is used to limit a macro to be executed by one call at a time.
02822  */
02823 int ast_context_lockmacro(const char *context)
02824 {
02825    struct ast_context *c = NULL;
02826    int ret = -1;
02827 
02828    ast_rdlock_contexts();
02829 
02830    while ((c = ast_walk_contexts(c))) {
02831       if (!strcmp(ast_get_context_name(c), context)) {
02832          ret = 0;
02833          break;
02834       }
02835    }
02836 
02837    ast_unlock_contexts();
02838 
02839    /* if we found context, lock macrolock */
02840    if (ret == 0) 
02841       ret = ast_mutex_lock(&c->macrolock);
02842 
02843    return ret;
02844 }
02845 
02846 /*!
02847  * \note This function locks contexts list by &conlist, searches for the right context
02848  * structure, and unlocks the macrolock mutex in that context.
02849  * macrolock is used to limit a macro to be executed by one call at a time.
02850  */
02851 int ast_context_unlockmacro(const char *context)
02852 {
02853    struct ast_context *c = NULL;
02854    int ret = -1;
02855 
02856    ast_rdlock_contexts();
02857 
02858    while ((c = ast_walk_contexts(c))) {
02859       if (!strcmp(ast_get_context_name(c), context)) {
02860          ret = 0;
02861          break;
02862       }
02863    }
02864 
02865    ast_unlock_contexts();
02866 
02867    /* if we found context, unlock macrolock */
02868    if (ret == 0) 
02869       ret = ast_mutex_unlock(&c->macrolock);
02870 
02871    return ret;
02872 }
02873 
02874 /*! \brief Dynamically register a new dial plan application */
02875 int ast_register_application(const char *app, int (*execute)(struct ast_channel *, void *), const char *synopsis, const char *description)
02876 {
02877    struct ast_app *tmp, *cur = NULL;
02878    char tmps[80];
02879    int length;
02880 
02881    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&apps);
02882    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&apps, tmp, list) {
02883       if (!strcasecmp(app, tmp->name)) {
02884          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Already have an application '%s'\n", app);
02885          AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&apps);
02886          return -1;
02887       }
02888    }
02889 
02890    length = sizeof(*tmp) + strlen(app) + 1;
02891 
02892    if (!(tmp = ast_calloc(1, length))) {
02893       AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&apps);
02894       return -1;
02895    }
02896 
02897    strcpy(tmp->name, app);
02898    tmp->execute = execute;
02899    tmp->synopsis = synopsis;
02900    tmp->description = description;
02901 
02902    /* Store in alphabetical order */
02903    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&apps, cur, list) {
02904       if (strcasecmp(tmp->name, cur->name) < 0) {
02905          AST_RWLIST_INSERT_BEFORE_CURRENT(&apps, tmp, list);
02906          break;
02907       }
02908    }
02909    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END
02910    if (!cur)
02911       AST_RWLIST_INSERT_TAIL(&apps, tmp, list);
02912 
02913    if (option_verbose > 1)
02914       ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Registered application '%s'\n", term_color(tmps, tmp->name, COLOR_BRCYAN, 0, sizeof(tmps)));
02915 
02916    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&apps);
02917 
02918    return 0;
02919 }
02920 
02921 /*
02922  * Append to the list. We don't have a tail pointer because we need
02923  * to scan the list anyways to check for duplicates during insertion.
02924  */
02925 int ast_register_switch(struct ast_switch *sw)
02926 {
02927    struct ast_switch *tmp;
02928 
02929    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&switches);
02930    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&switches, tmp, list) {
02931       if (!strcasecmp(tmp->name, sw->name)) {
02932          AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&switches);
02933          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Switch '%s' already found\n", sw->name);
02934          return -1;
02935       }
02936    }
02937    AST_RWLIST_INSERT_TAIL(&switches, sw, list);
02938    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&switches);
02939 
02940    return 0;
02941 }
02942 
02943 void ast_unregister_switch(struct ast_switch *sw)
02944 {
02945    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&switches);
02946    AST_RWLIST_REMOVE(&switches, sw, list);
02947    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&switches);
02948 }

02991 
02992 /*
02993  * \brief 'show application' CLI command implementation functions ...
02994  */
02995 
02996 /*
02997  * There is a possibility to show informations about more than one
02998  * application at one time. You can type 'show application Dial Echo' and
02999  * you will see informations about these two applications ...
03000  */
03001 static char *complete_show_application(const char *line, const char *word, int pos, int state)
03002 {
03003    struct ast_app *a;
03004    char *ret = NULL;
03005    int which = 0;
03006    int wordlen = strlen(word);
03007 
03008    /* return the n-th [partial] matching entry */
03009    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&apps);
03010    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&apps, a, list) {
03011       if (!strncasecmp(word, a->name, wordlen) && ++which > state) {
03012          ret = strdup(a->name);
03013          break;
03014       }
03015    }
03016    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&apps);
03017 
03018    return ret;
03019 }
03020 
03021 static int handle_show_application(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03022 {
03023    struct ast_app *a;
03024    int app, no_registered_app = 1;
03025 
03026    if (argc < 4)
03027       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
03028 
03029    /* ... go through all applications ... */
03030    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&apps);
03031    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&apps, a, list) {
03032       /* ... compare this application name with all arguments given
03033        * to 'show application' command ... */
03034       for (app = 3; app < argc; app++) {
03035          if (!strcasecmp(a->name, argv[app])) {
03036             /* Maximum number of characters added by terminal coloring is 22 */
03037             char infotitle[64 + AST_MAX_APP + 22], syntitle[40], destitle[40];
03038             char info[64 + AST_MAX_APP], *synopsis = NULL, *description = NULL;
03039             int synopsis_size, description_size;
03040 
03041             no_registered_app = 0;
03042 
03043             if (a->synopsis)
03044                synopsis_size = strlen(a->synopsis) + 23;
03045             else
03046                synopsis_size = strlen("Not available") + 23;
03047             synopsis = alloca(synopsis_size);
03048 
03049             if (a->description)
03050                description_size = strlen(a->description) + 23;
03051             else
03052                description_size = strlen("Not available") + 23;
03053             description = alloca(description_size);
03054 
03055             if (synopsis && description) {
03056                snprintf(info, 64 + AST_MAX_APP, "\n  -= Info about application '%s' =- \n\n", a->name);
03057                term_color(infotitle, info, COLOR_MAGENTA, 0, 64 + AST_MAX_APP + 22);
03058                term_color(syntitle, "[Synopsis]\n", COLOR_MAGENTA, 0, 40);
03059                term_color(destitle, "[Description]\n", COLOR_MAGENTA, 0, 40);
03060                term_color(synopsis,
03061                            a->synopsis ? a->synopsis : "Not available",
03062                            COLOR_CYAN, 0, synopsis_size);
03063                term_color(description,
03064                            a->description ? a->description : "Not available",
03065                            COLOR_CYAN, 0, description_size);
03066 
03067                ast_cli(fd,"%s%s%s\n\n%s%s\n", infotitle, syntitle, synopsis, destitle, description);
03068             } else {
03069                /* ... one of our applications, show info ...*/
03070                ast_cli(fd,"\n  -= Info about application '%s' =- \n\n"
03071                   "[Synopsis]\n  %s\n\n"
03072                   "[Description]\n%s\n",
03073                   a->name,
03074                   a->synopsis ? a->synopsis : "Not available",
03075                   a->description ? a->description : "Not available");
03076             }
03077          }
03078       }
03079    }
03080    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&apps);
03081 
03082    /* we found at least one app? no? */
03083    if (no_registered_app) {
03084       ast_cli(fd, "Your application(s) is (are) not registered\n");
03085       return RESULT_FAILURE;
03086    }
03087 
03088    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03089 }
03090 
03091 #ifdef AST_DEVMODE
03092 static char core_dumpappdocs_help[] =
03093 "Usage: core dump appdocs [application]\n"
03094 "       Dump Application documentation to /tmp/ast_appdocs.tex.\n";
03095 
03096 static int handle_core_dumpappdocs(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03097 {
03098    struct ast_app *app;
03099    FILE *f;
03100    char *appname = NULL;
03101    const char *fn = "/tmp/ast_appdocs.tex";
03102 
03103    if (argc > 3)
03104       appname = argv[3];
03105 
03106    if (!(f = fopen(fn, "w+"))) {
03107       ast_cli(fd, "Unable to open %s for writing!\n", fn);
03108       return RESULT_FAILURE;
03109    }
03110 
03111    fprintf(f, "%% This file is automatically generated.  Any manual edits will be lost.\n");
03112 
03113    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&apps);
03114    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&apps, app, list) {
03115       if (appname && strcasecmp(app->name, appname))
03116          continue;
03117 
03118       fprintf(f, "\\section{%s}\n"
03119             "\\subsection{Synopsis}\n"
03120             "\\begin{verbatim}\n"
03121             "%s\n"
03122             "\\end{verbatim}\n"
03123             "\\subsection{Description}\n"
03124             "\\begin{verbatim}\n"
03125             "%s\n"
03126             "\\end{verbatim}\n\n\n", app->name, app->synopsis, app->description);
03127 
03128       if (appname)
03129          break;
03130    }
03131    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&apps);
03132 
03133    fclose(f);
03134 
03135    ast_cli(fd, "Documentation has been dumped to %s\n", fn);
03136 
03137    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03138 }
03139 #endif
03140 
03141 /*! \brief  handle_show_hints: CLI support for listing registered dial plan hints */
03142 static int handle_show_hints(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03143 {
03144    struct ast_hint *hint;
03145    int num = 0;
03146    int watchers;
03147    struct ast_state_cb *watcher;
03148 
03149    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&hints);
03150    if (AST_RWLIST_EMPTY(&hints)) {
03151       ast_cli(fd, "There are no registered dialplan hints\n");
03152       AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
03153       return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03154    }
03155    /* ... we have hints ... */
03156    ast_cli(fd, "\n    -= Registered Asterisk Dial Plan Hints =-\n");
03157    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&hints, hint, list) {
03158       watchers = 0;
03159       for (watcher = hint->callbacks; watcher; watcher = watcher->next)
03160          watchers++;
03161       ast_cli(fd, "   %20s@%-20.20s: %-20.20s  State:%-15.15s Watchers %2d\n",
03162          ast_get_extension_name(hint->exten),
03163          ast_get_context_name(ast_get_extension_context(hint->exten)),
03164          ast_get_extension_app(hint->exten),
03165          ast_extension_state2str(hint->laststate), watchers);
03166       num++;
03167    }
03168    ast_cli(fd, "----------------\n");
03169    ast_cli(fd, "- %d hints registered\n", num);
03170    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
03171    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03172 }
03173 
03174 /*! \brief  handle_show_switches: CLI support for listing registered dial plan switches */
03175 static int handle_show_switches(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03176 {
03177    struct ast_switch *sw;
03178 
03179    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&switches);
03180 
03181    if (AST_RWLIST_EMPTY(&switches)) {
03182       AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&switches);
03183       ast_cli(fd, "There are no registered alternative switches\n");
03184       return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03185    }
03186 
03187    ast_cli(fd, "\n    -= Registered Asterisk Alternative Switches =-\n");
03188    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&switches, sw, list)
03189       ast_cli(fd, "%s: %s\n", sw->name, sw->description);
03190 
03191    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&switches);
03192 
03193    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03194 }
03195 
03196 static int handle_show_applications(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03197 {
03198    struct ast_app *a;
03199    int like = 0, describing = 0;
03200    int total_match = 0;    /* Number of matches in like clause */
03201    int total_apps = 0;  /* Number of apps registered */
03202 
03203    AST_RWLIST_RDLOCK(&apps);
03204 
03205    if (AST_RWLIST_EMPTY(&apps)) {
03206       ast_cli(fd, "There are no registered applications\n");
03207       AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&apps);
03208       return -1;
03209    }
03210 
03211    /* core list applications like <keyword> */
03212    if ((argc == 5) && (!strcmp(argv[3], "like"))) {
03213       like = 1;
03214    } else if ((argc > 4) && (!strcmp(argv[3], "describing"))) {
03215       describing = 1;
03216    }
03217 
03218    /* core list applications describing <keyword1> [<keyword2>] [...] */
03219    if ((!like) && (!describing)) {
03220       ast_cli(fd, "    -= Registered Asterisk Applications =-\n");
03221    } else {
03222       ast_cli(fd, "    -= Matching Asterisk Applications =-\n");
03223    }
03224 
03225    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&apps, a, list) {
03226       int printapp = 0;
03227       total_apps++;
03228       if (like) {
03229          if (strcasestr(a->name, argv[4])) {
03230             printapp = 1;
03231             total_match++;
03232          }
03233       } else if (describing) {
03234          if (a->description) {
03235             /* Match all words on command line */
03236             int i;
03237             printapp = 1;
03238             for (i = 4; i < argc; i++) {
03239                if (!strcasestr(a->description, argv[i])) {
03240                   printapp = 0;
03241                } else {
03242                   total_match++;
03243                }
03244             }
03245          }
03246       } else {
03247          printapp = 1;
03248       }
03249 
03250       if (printapp) {
03251          ast_cli(fd,"  %20s: %s\n", a->name, a->synopsis ? a->synopsis : "<Synopsis not available>");
03252       }
03253    }
03254    if ((!like) && (!describing)) {
03255       ast_cli(fd, "    -= %d Applications Registered =-\n",total_apps);
03256    } else {
03257       ast_cli(fd, "    -= %d Applications Matching =-\n",total_match);
03258    }
03259 
03260    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&apps);
03261 
03262    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03263 }
03264 
03265 static char *complete_show_applications(const char *line, const char *word, int pos, int state)
03266 {
03267    static char* choices[] = { "like", "describing", NULL };
03268 
03269    return (pos != 3) ? NULL : ast_cli_complete(word, choices, state);
03270 }
03271 
03272 /*
03273  * 'show dialplan' CLI command implementation functions ...
03274  */
03275 static char *complete_show_dialplan_context(const char *line, const char *word, int pos,
03276    int state)
03277 {
03278    struct ast_context *c = NULL;
03279    char *ret = NULL;
03280    int which = 0;
03281    int wordlen;
03282 
03283    /* we are do completion of [exten@]context on second position only */
03284    if (pos != 2)
03285       return NULL;
03286 
03287    ast_rdlock_contexts();
03288 
03289    wordlen = strlen(word);
03290 
03291    /* walk through all contexts and return the n-th match */
03292    while ( (c = ast_walk_contexts(c)) ) {
03293       if (!strncasecmp(word, ast_get_context_name(c), wordlen) && ++which > state) {
03294          ret = ast_strdup(ast_get_context_name(c));
03295          break;
03296       }
03297    }
03298 
03299    ast_unlock_contexts();
03300 
03301    return ret;
03302 }
03303 
03304 /*! \brief Counters for the show dialplan manager command */
03305 struct dialplan_counters {
03306    int total_items;
03307    int total_context;
03308    int total_exten;
03309    int total_prio;
03310    int context_existence;
03311    int extension_existence;
03312 };
03313 
03314 /*! \brief helper function to print an extension */
03315 static void print_ext(struct ast_exten *e, char * buf, int buflen)
03316 {
03317    int prio = ast_get_extension_priority(e);
03318    if (prio == PRIORITY_HINT) {
03319       snprintf(buf, buflen, "hint: %s",
03320          ast_get_extension_app(e));
03321    } else {
03322       snprintf(buf, buflen, "%d. %s(%s)",
03323          prio, ast_get_extension_app(e),
03324          (char *)ast_get_extension_app_data(e));
03325    }
03326 }
03327 
03328 /* XXX not verified */
03329 static int show_dialplan_helper(int fd, const char *context, const char *exten, struct dialplan_counters *dpc, struct ast_include *rinclude, int includecount, const char *includes[])
03330 {
03331    struct ast_context *c = NULL;
03332    int res = 0, old_total_exten = dpc->total_exten;
03333 
03334    ast_rdlock_contexts();
03335 
03336    /* walk all contexts ... */
03337    while ( (c = ast_walk_contexts(c)) ) {
03338       struct ast_exten *e;
03339       struct ast_include *i;
03340       struct ast_ignorepat *ip;
03341       char buf[256], buf2[256];
03342       int context_info_printed = 0;
03343 
03344       if (context && strcmp(ast_get_context_name(c), context))
03345          continue;   /* skip this one, name doesn't match */
03346 
03347       dpc->context_existence = 1;
03348 
03349       ast_rdlock_context(c);
03350 
03351       /* are we looking for exten too? if yes, we print context
03352        * only if we find our extension.
03353        * Otherwise print context even if empty ?
03354        * XXX i am not sure how the rinclude is handled.
03355        * I think it ought to go inside.
03356        */
03357       if (!exten) {
03358          dpc->total_context++;
03359          ast_cli(fd, "[ Context '%s' created by '%s' ]\n",
03360             ast_get_context_name(c), ast_get_context_registrar(c));
03361          context_info_printed = 1;
03362       }
03363 
03364       /* walk extensions ... */
03365       e = NULL;
03366       while ( (e = ast_walk_context_extensions(c, e)) ) {
03367          struct ast_exten *p;
03368 
03369          if (exten && !ast_extension_match(ast_get_extension_name(e), exten))
03370             continue;   /* skip, extension match failed */
03371 
03372          dpc->extension_existence = 1;
03373 
03374          /* may we print context info? */
03375          if (!context_info_printed) {
03376             dpc->total_context++;
03377             if (rinclude) { /* TODO Print more info about rinclude */
03378                ast_cli(fd, "[ Included context '%s' created by '%s' ]\n",
03379                   ast_get_context_name(c), ast_get_context_registrar(c));
03380             } else {
03381                ast_cli(fd, "[ Context '%s' created by '%s' ]\n",
03382                   ast_get_context_name(c), ast_get_context_registrar(c));
03383             }
03384             context_info_printed = 1;
03385          }
03386          dpc->total_prio++;
03387 
03388          /* write extension name and first peer */
03389          if (e->matchcid)
03390             snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "'%s' (CID match '%s') => ", ast_get_extension_name(e), e->cidmatch);
03391          else
03392             snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "'%s' =>", ast_get_extension_name(e));
03393 
03394          print_ext(e, buf2, sizeof(buf2));
03395 
03396          ast_cli(fd, "  %-17s %-45s [%s]\n", buf, buf2,
03397             ast_get_extension_registrar(e));
03398 
03399          dpc->total_exten++;
03400          /* walk next extension peers */
03401          p = e;   /* skip the first one, we already got it */
03402          while ( (p = ast_walk_extension_priorities(e, p)) ) {
03403             const char *el = ast_get_extension_label(p);
03404             dpc->total_prio++;
03405             if (el)
03406                snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "   [%s]", el);
03407             else
03408                buf[0] = '\0';
03409             print_ext(p, buf2, sizeof(buf2));
03410 
03411             ast_cli(fd,"  %-17s %-45s [%s]\n", buf, buf2,
03412                ast_get_extension_registrar(p));
03413          }
03414       }
03415 
03416       /* walk included and write info ... */
03417       i = NULL;
03418       while ( (i = ast_walk_context_includes(c, i)) ) {
03419          snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "'%s'", ast_get_include_name(i));
03420          if (exten) {
03421             /* Check all includes for the requested extension */
03422             if (includecount >= AST_PBX_MAX_STACK) {
03423                ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Maximum include depth exceeded!\n");
03424             } else {
03425                int dupe=0;
03426                int x;
03427                for (x=0;x<includecount;x++) {
03428                   if (!strcasecmp(includes[x], ast_get_include_name(i))) {
03429                      dupe++;
03430                      break;
03431                   }
03432                }
03433                if (!dupe) {
03434                   includes[includecount] = ast_get_include_name(i);
03435                   show_dialplan_helper(fd, ast_get_include_name(i), exten, dpc, i, includecount + 1, includes);
03436                } else {
03437                   ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Avoiding circular include of %s within %s\n", ast_get_include_name(i), context);
03438                }
03439             }
03440          } else {
03441             ast_cli(fd, "  Include =>        %-45s [%s]\n",
03442                buf, ast_get_include_registrar(i));
03443          }
03444       }
03445 
03446       /* walk ignore patterns and write info ... */
03447       ip = NULL;
03448       while ( (ip = ast_walk_context_ignorepats(c, ip)) ) {
03449          const char *ipname = ast_get_ignorepat_name(ip);
03450          char ignorepat[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];
03451          snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "'%s'", ipname);
03452          snprintf(ignorepat, sizeof(ignorepat), "_%s.", ipname);
03453          if (!exten || ast_extension_match(ignorepat, exten)) {
03454             ast_cli(fd, "  Ignore pattern => %-45s [%s]\n",
03455                buf, ast_get_ignorepat_registrar(ip));
03456          }
03457       }
03458       if (!rinclude) {
03459          struct ast_sw *sw = NULL;
03460          while ( (sw = ast_walk_context_switches(c, sw)) ) {
03461             snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "'%s/%s'",
03462                ast_get_switch_name(sw),
03463                ast_get_switch_data(sw));
03464             ast_cli(fd, "  Alt. Switch =>    %-45s [%s]\n",
03465                buf, ast_get_switch_registrar(sw));
03466          }
03467       }
03468 
03469       ast_unlock_context(c);
03470 
03471       /* if we print something in context, make an empty line */
03472       if (context_info_printed)
03473          ast_cli(fd, "\r\n");
03474    }
03475    ast_unlock_contexts();
03476 
03477    return (dpc->total_exten == old_total_exten) ? -1 : res;
03478 }
03479 
03480 static int handle_show_dialplan(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03481 {
03482    char *exten = NULL, *context = NULL;
03483    /* Variables used for different counters */
03484    struct dialplan_counters counters;
03485 
03486    const char *incstack[AST_PBX_MAX_STACK];
03487    memset(&counters, 0, sizeof(counters));
03488 
03489    if (argc != 2 && argc != 3)
03490       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
03491 
03492    /* we obtain [exten@]context? if yes, split them ... */
03493    if (argc == 3) {
03494       if (strchr(argv[2], '@')) {   /* split into exten & context */
03495          context = ast_strdupa(argv[2]);
03496          exten = strsep(&context, "@");
03497          /* change empty strings to NULL */
03498          if (ast_strlen_zero(exten))
03499             exten = NULL;
03500       } else { /* no '@' char, only context given */
03501          context = argv[2];
03502       }
03503       if (ast_strlen_zero(context))
03504          context = NULL;
03505    }
03506    /* else Show complete dial plan, context and exten are NULL */
03507    show_dialplan_helper(fd, context, exten, &counters, NULL, 0, incstack);
03508 
03509    /* check for input failure and throw some error messages */
03510    if (context && !counters.context_existence) {
03511       ast_cli(fd, "There is no existence of '%s' context\n", context);
03512       return RESULT_FAILURE;
03513    }
03514 
03515    if (exten && !counters.extension_existence) {
03516       if (context)
03517          ast_cli(fd, "There is no existence of %s@%s extension\n",
03518             exten, context);
03519       else
03520          ast_cli(fd,
03521             "There is no existence of '%s' extension in all contexts\n",
03522             exten);
03523       return RESULT_FAILURE;
03524    }
03525 
03526    ast_cli(fd,"-= %d %s (%d %s) in %d %s. =-\n",
03527             counters.total_exten, counters.total_exten == 1 ? "extension" : "extensions",
03528             counters.total_prio, counters.total_prio == 1 ? "priority" : "priorities",
03529             counters.total_context, counters.total_context == 1 ? "context" : "contexts");
03530 
03531    /* everything ok */
03532    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03533 }
03534 
03535 /*! \brief Send ack once */
03536 static void manager_dpsendack(struct mansession *s, const struct message *m)
03537 {
03538    astman_send_listack(s, m, "DialPlan list will follow", "start");
03539 }
03540 
03541 /*! \brief Show dialplan extensions
03542  * XXX this function is similar but not exactly the same as the CLI's
03543  * show dialplan. Must check whether the difference is intentional or not.
03544  */
03545 static int manager_show_dialplan_helper(struct mansession *s, const struct message *m,
03546                const char *actionidtext, const char *context,
03547                const char *exten, struct dialplan_counters *dpc,
03548                struct ast_include *rinclude)
03549 {
03550    struct ast_context *c;
03551    int res=0, old_total_exten = dpc->total_exten;
03552 
03553    if (ast_strlen_zero(exten))
03554       exten = NULL;
03555    if (ast_strlen_zero(context))
03556       context = NULL;
03557 
03558    if (option_debug > 2)
03559       ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "manager_show_dialplan: Context: -%s- Extension: -%s-\n", context, exten);
03560 
03561    /* try to lock contexts */
03562    if (ast_rdlock_contexts()) {
03563       astman_send_error(s, m, "Failed to lock contexts\r\n");
03564       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed to lock contexts list for manager: listdialplan\n");
03565       return -1;
03566    }
03567 
03568    c = NULL;      /* walk all contexts ... */
03569    while ( (c = ast_walk_contexts(c)) ) {
03570       struct ast_exten *e;
03571       struct ast_include *i;
03572       struct ast_ignorepat *ip;
03573 
03574       if (context && strcmp(ast_get_context_name(c), context) != 0)
03575          continue;   /* not the name we want */
03576 
03577       dpc->context_existence = 1;
03578 
03579       if (option_debug > 2)
03580          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "manager_show_dialplan: Found Context: %s \n", ast_get_context_name(c));
03581 
03582       if (ast_rdlock_context(c)) {  /* failed to lock */
03583          if (option_debug > 2)
03584             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "manager_show_dialplan: Failed to lock context\n");
03585          continue;
03586       }
03587 
03588       /* XXX note- an empty context is not printed */
03589       e = NULL;      /* walk extensions in context  */
03590       while ( (e = ast_walk_context_extensions(c, e)) ) {
03591          struct ast_exten *p;
03592 
03593          /* looking for extension? is this our extension? */
03594          if (exten && !ast_extension_match(ast_get_extension_name(e), exten)) {
03595             /* not the one we are looking for, continue */
03596             if (option_debug > 2)
03597                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "manager_show_dialplan: Skipping extension %s\n", ast_get_extension_name(e));
03598             continue;
03599          }
03600          if (option_debug > 2)
03601             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "manager_show_dialplan: Found Extension: %s \n", ast_get_extension_name(e));
03602 
03603          dpc->extension_existence = 1;
03604 
03605          /* may we print context info? */ 
03606          dpc->total_context++;
03607          dpc->total_exten++;
03608 
03609          p = NULL;      /* walk next extension peers */
03610          while ( (p = ast_walk_extension_priorities(e, p)) ) {
03611             int prio = ast_get_extension_priority(p);
03612 
03613             dpc->total_prio++;
03614             if (!dpc->total_items++)
03615                manager_dpsendack(s, m);
03616             astman_append(s, "Event: ListDialplan\r\n%s", actionidtext);
03617             astman_append(s, "Context: %s\r\nExtension: %s\r\n", ast_get_context_name(c), ast_get_extension_name(e) );
03618 
03619             /* XXX maybe make this conditional, if p != e ? */
03620             if (ast_get_extension_label(p))
03621                astman_append(s, "ExtensionLabel: %s\r\n", ast_get_extension_label(p));
03622 
03623             if (prio == PRIORITY_HINT) {
03624                astman_append(s, "Priority: hint\r\nApplication: %s\r\n", ast_get_extension_app(p));
03625             } else {
03626                astman_append(s, "Priority: %d\r\nApplication: %s\r\nAppData: %s\r\n", prio, ast_get_extension_app(p), (char *) ast_get_extension_app_data(p));
03627             }
03628             astman_append(s, "Registrar: %s\r\n\r\n", ast_get_extension_registrar(e));
03629          }
03630       }
03631 
03632       i = NULL;      /* walk included and write info ... */
03633       while ( (i = ast_walk_context_includes(c, i)) ) {
03634          if (exten) {
03635             /* Check all includes for the requested extension */
03636             manager_show_dialplan_helper(s, m, actionidtext, ast_get_include_name(i), exten, dpc, i);
03637          } else {
03638             if (!dpc->total_items++)
03639                manager_dpsendack(s, m);
03640             astman_append(s, "Event: ListDialplan\r\n%s", actionidtext);
03641             astman_append(s, "Context: %s\r\nIncludeContext: %s\r\nRegistrar: %s\r\n", ast_get_context_name(c), ast_get_include_name(i), ast_get_include_registrar(i));
03642             astman_append(s, "\r\n");
03643             if (option_debug > 2)
03644                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "manager_show_dialplan: Found Included context: %s \n", ast_get_include_name(i));
03645          }
03646       }
03647 
03648       ip = NULL;  /* walk ignore patterns and write info ... */
03649       while ( (ip = ast_walk_context_ignorepats(c, ip)) ) {
03650          const char *ipname = ast_get_ignorepat_name(ip);
03651          char ignorepat[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];
03652 
03653          snprintf(ignorepat, sizeof(ignorepat), "_%s.", ipname);
03654          if (!exten || ast_extension_match(ignorepat, exten)) {
03655             if (!dpc->total_items++)
03656                manager_dpsendack(s, m);
03657             astman_append(s, "Event: ListDialplan\r\n%s", actionidtext);
03658             astman_append(s, "Context: %s\r\nIgnorePattern: %s\r\nRegistrar: %s\r\n", ast_get_context_name(c), ipname, ast_get_ignorepat_registrar(ip));
03659             astman_append(s, "\r\n");
03660          }
03661       }
03662       if (!rinclude) {
03663          struct ast_sw *sw = NULL;
03664          while ( (sw = ast_walk_context_switches(c, sw)) ) {
03665             if (!dpc->total_items++)
03666                manager_dpsendack(s, m);
03667             astman_append(s, "Event: ListDialplan\r\n%s", actionidtext);
03668             astman_append(s, "Context: %s\r\nSwitch: %s/%s\r\nRegistrar: %s\r\n", ast_get_context_name(c), ast_get_switch_name(sw), ast_get_switch_data(sw), ast_get_switch_registrar(sw));  
03669             astman_append(s, "\r\n");
03670             if (option_debug > 2)
03671                ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "manager_show_dialplan: Found Switch : %s \n", ast_get_switch_name(sw));
03672          }
03673       }
03674 
03675       ast_unlock_context(c);
03676    }
03677    ast_unlock_contexts();
03678 
03679    if (dpc->total_exten == old_total_exten) {
03680       if (option_debug > 2)
03681          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "manager_show_dialplan: Found nothing new\n");
03682       /* Nothing new under the sun */
03683       return -1;
03684    } else {
03685       return res;
03686    }
03687 }
03688 
03689 /*! \brief  Manager listing of dial plan */
03690 static int manager_show_dialplan(struct mansession *s, const struct message *m)
03691 {
03692    const char *exten, *context;
03693    const char *id = astman_get_header(m, "ActionID");
03694    char idtext[256];
03695    int res;
03696 
03697    /* Variables used for different counters */
03698    struct dialplan_counters counters;
03699 
03700    if (id && !ast_strlen_zero(id))
03701       snprintf(idtext, sizeof(idtext), "ActionID: %s\r\n", id);
03702    else
03703       idtext[0] = '\0';
03704 
03705    memset(&counters, 0, sizeof(counters));
03706 
03707    exten = astman_get_header(m, "Extension");
03708    context = astman_get_header(m, "Context");
03709    
03710    res = manager_show_dialplan_helper(s, m, idtext, context, exten, &counters, NULL);
03711 
03712    if (context && !counters.context_existence) {
03713       char errorbuf[BUFSIZ];
03714    
03715       snprintf(errorbuf, sizeof(errorbuf), "Did not find context %s\r\n", context);
03716       astman_send_error(s, m, errorbuf);
03717       return 0;
03718    }
03719    if (exten && !counters.extension_existence) {
03720       char errorbuf[BUFSIZ];
03721 
03722       if (context)
03723          snprintf(errorbuf, sizeof(errorbuf), "Did not find extension %s@%s\r\n", exten, context);
03724       else
03725          snprintf(errorbuf, sizeof(errorbuf), "Did not find extension %s in any context\r\n", exten);
03726       astman_send_error(s, m, errorbuf);
03727       return 0;
03728    }
03729 
03730    manager_event(EVENT_FLAG_CONFIG, "ShowDialPlanComplete",
03731       "EventList: Complete\r\n"
03732       "ListItems: %d\r\n"
03733       "ListExtensions: %d\r\n"
03734       "ListPriorities: %d\r\n"   
03735       "ListContexts: %d\r\n"  
03736       "%s"
03737       "\r\n", counters.total_items, counters.total_exten, counters.total_prio, counters.total_context, idtext);
03738 
03739    /* everything ok */
03740    return 0;
03741 }

03746 "Variables: \n"
03747 " ActionID: <id>     Action ID for this AMI transaction (optional)\n"
03748 " Extension: <extension>   Extension (Optional)\n"
03749 " Context: <context>    Context (Optional)\n"
03750 "\n";

03753 /*! \brief CLI support for listing global variables in a parseable way */
03754 static int handle_show_globals(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03755 {
03756    int i = 0;
03757    struct ast_var_t *newvariable;
03758 
03759    ast_rwlock_rdlock(&globalslock);
03760    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE (&globals, newvariable, entries) {
03761       i++;
03762       ast_cli(fd, "   %s=%s\n", ast_var_name(newvariable), ast_var_value(newvariable));
03763    }
03764    ast_rwlock_unlock(&globalslock);
03765    ast_cli(fd, "\n    -- %d variables\n", i);
03766 
03767    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03768 }

03770 static int handle_set_global(int fd, int argc, char *argv[])
03771 {
03772    if (argc != 5)
03773       return RESULT_SHOWUSAGE;
03774 
03775    pbx_builtin_setvar_helper(NULL, argv[3], argv[4]);
03776    ast_cli(fd, "\n    -- Global variable %s set to %s\n", argv[3], argv[4]);
03777 
03778    return RESULT_SUCCESS;
03779 }
