03829 
03830 static void unreference_cached_app(struct ast_app *app)
03831 {
03832    struct ast_context *context = NULL;
03833    struct ast_exten *eroot = NULL, *e = NULL;
03834 
03835    ast_rdlock_contexts();
03836    while ((context = ast_walk_contexts(context))) {
03837       while ((eroot = ast_walk_context_extensions(context, eroot))) {
03838          while ((e = ast_walk_extension_priorities(eroot, e))) {
03839             if (e->cached_app == app)
03840                e->cached_app = NULL;
03841          }
03842       }
03843    }
03844    ast_unlock_contexts();
03845 
03846    return;
03847 }
03848 
03849 int ast_unregister_application(const char *app)
03850 {
03851    struct ast_app *tmp;
03852 
03853    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&apps);
03854    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_BEGIN(&apps, tmp, list) {
03855       if (!strcasecmp(app, tmp->name)) {
03856          unreference_cached_app(tmp);
03857          AST_RWLIST_REMOVE_CURRENT(&apps, list);
03858          if (option_verbose > 1)
03859             ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Unregistered application '%s'\n", tmp->name);
03860          free(tmp);
03861          break;
03862       }
03863    }
03864    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE_SAFE_END
03865    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&apps);
03866 
03867    return tmp ? 0 : -1;
03868 }
03869 
03870 static struct ast_context *__ast_context_create(struct ast_context **extcontexts, const char *name, const char *registrar, int existsokay)
03871 {
03872    struct ast_context *tmp, **local_contexts;
03873    int length = sizeof(struct ast_context) + strlen(name) + 1;
03874 
03875    if (!extcontexts) {
03876       ast_wrlock_contexts();
03877       local_contexts = &contexts;
03878    } else
03879       local_contexts = extcontexts;
03880 
03881    for (tmp = *local_contexts; tmp; tmp = tmp->next) {
03882       if (!strcasecmp(tmp->name, name)) {
03883          if (!existsokay) {
03884             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Tried to register context '%s', already in use\n", name);
03885             tmp = NULL;
03886          }
03887          if (!extcontexts)
03888             ast_unlock_contexts();
03889          return tmp;
03890       }
03891    }
03892    if ((tmp = ast_calloc(1, length))) {
03893       ast_rwlock_init(&tmp->lock);
03894       ast_mutex_init(&tmp->macrolock);
03895       strcpy(tmp->name, name);
03896       tmp->root = NULL;
03897       tmp->registrar = registrar;
03898       tmp->next = *local_contexts;
03899       tmp->includes = NULL;
03900       tmp->ignorepats = NULL;
03901       *local_contexts = tmp;
03902       if (option_debug)
03903          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Registered context '%s'\n", tmp->name);
03904       if (option_verbose > 2)
03905          ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Registered extension context '%s'\n", tmp->name);
03906    }
03907 
03908    if (!extcontexts)
03909       ast_unlock_contexts();
03910    return tmp;
03911 }
03912 
03913 struct ast_context *ast_context_create(struct ast_context **extcontexts, const char *name, const char *registrar)
03914 {
03915    return __ast_context_create(extcontexts, name, registrar, 0);
03916 }
03917 
03918 struct ast_context *ast_context_find_or_create(struct ast_context **extcontexts, const char *name, const char *registrar)
03919 {
03920    return __ast_context_create(extcontexts, name, registrar, 1);
03921 }
03922 void __ast_context_destroy(struct ast_context *con, const char *registrar);
03923 
03924 struct store_hint {
03925    char *context;
03926    char *exten;
03927    struct ast_state_cb *callbacks;
03928    int laststate;
03929    AST_LIST_ENTRY(store_hint) list;
03930    char data[1];
03931 };
03932 
03933 AST_LIST_HEAD(store_hints, store_hint);
03934 
03935 /* XXX this does not check that multiple contexts are merged */
03936 void ast_merge_contexts_and_delete(struct ast_context **extcontexts, const char *registrar)
03937 {
03938    struct ast_context *tmp, *lasttmp = NULL;
03939    struct store_hints store = AST_LIST_HEAD_INIT_VALUE;
03940    struct store_hint *this;
03941    struct ast_hint *hint;
03942    struct ast_exten *exten;
03943    int length;
03944    struct ast_state_cb *thiscb, *prevcb;
03945 
03946    /* it is very important that this function hold the hint list lock _and_ the conlock
03947       during its operation; not only do we need to ensure that the list of contexts
03948       and extensions does not change, but also that no hint callbacks (watchers) are
03949       added or removed during the merge/delete process
03950 
03951       in addition, the locks _must_ be taken in this order, because there are already
03952       other code paths that use this order
03953    */
03954    ast_wrlock_contexts();
03955    AST_RWLIST_WRLOCK(&hints);
03956 
03957    /* preserve all watchers for hints associated with this registrar */
03958    AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&hints, hint, list) {
03959       if (hint->callbacks && !strcmp(registrar, hint->exten->parent->registrar)) {
03960          length = strlen(hint->exten->exten) + strlen(hint->exten->parent->name) + 2 + sizeof(*this);
03961          if (!(this = ast_calloc(1, length)))
03962             continue;
03963          this->callbacks = hint->callbacks;
03964          hint->callbacks = NULL;
03965          this->laststate = hint->laststate;
03966          this->context = this->data;
03967          strcpy(this->data, hint->exten->parent->name);
03968          this->exten = this->data + strlen(this->context) + 1;
03969          strcpy(this->exten, hint->exten->exten);
03970          AST_LIST_INSERT_HEAD(&store, this, list);
03971       }
03972    }
03973 
03974    tmp = *extcontexts;
03975    if (registrar) {
03976       /* XXX remove previous contexts from same registrar */
03977       if (option_debug)
03978          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "must remove any reg %s\n", registrar);
03979       __ast_context_destroy(NULL,registrar);
03980       while (tmp) {
03981          lasttmp = tmp;
03982          tmp = tmp->next;
03983       }
03984    } else {
03985       /* XXX remove contexts with the same name */
03986       while (tmp) {
03987          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "must remove %s  reg %s\n", tmp->name, tmp->registrar);
03988          __ast_context_destroy(tmp,tmp->registrar);
03989          lasttmp = tmp;
03990          tmp = tmp->next;
03991       }
03992    }
03993    if (lasttmp) {
03994       lasttmp->next = contexts;
03995       contexts = *extcontexts;
03996       *extcontexts = NULL;
03997    } else
03998       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Requested contexts didn't get merged\n");
03999 
04000    /* restore the watchers for hints that can be found; notify those that
04001       cannot be restored
04002    */
04003    while ((this = AST_LIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&store, list))) {
04004       exten = ast_hint_extension(NULL, this->context, this->exten);
04005       /* Find the hint in the list of hints */
04006       AST_RWLIST_TRAVERSE(&hints, hint, list) {
04007          if (hint->exten == exten)
04008             break;
04009       }
04010       if (!exten || !hint) {
04011          /* this hint has been removed, notify the watchers */
04012          prevcb = NULL;
04013          thiscb = this->callbacks;
04014          while (thiscb) {
04015             prevcb = thiscb;
04016             thiscb = thiscb->next;
04017             prevcb->callback(this->context, this->exten, AST_EXTENSION_REMOVED, prevcb->data);
04018             free(prevcb);
04019             }
04020       } else {
04021          thiscb = this->callbacks;
04022          while (thiscb->next)
04023             thiscb = thiscb->next;
04024          thiscb->next = hint->callbacks;
04025          hint->callbacks = this->callbacks;
04026          hint->laststate = this->laststate;
04027       }
04028       free(this);
04029    }
04030 
04031    AST_RWLIST_UNLOCK(&hints);
04032    ast_unlock_contexts();
04033 
04034    return;
04035 }
04036 
04037 /*
04038  * errno values
04039  *  EBUSY  - can't lock
04040  *  ENOENT - no existence of context
04041  */
04042 int ast_context_add_include(const char *context, const char *include, const char *registrar)
04043 {
04044    int ret = -1;
04045    struct ast_context *c = find_context_locked(context);
04046 
04047    if (c) {
04048       ret = ast_context_add_include2(c, include, registrar);
04049       ast_unlock_contexts();
04050    }
04051    return ret;
04052 }
04053 
04054 /*! \brief Helper for get_range.
04055  * return the index of the matching entry, starting from 1.
04056  * If names is not supplied, try numeric values.
04057  */
04058 static int lookup_name(const char *s, char *const names[], int max)
04059 {
04060    int i;
04061 
04062    if (names) {
04063       for (i = 0; names[i]; i++) {
04064          if (!strcasecmp(s, names[i]))
04065             return i+1;
04066       }
04067    } else if (sscanf(s, "%d", &i) == 1 && i >= 1 && i <= max) {
04068       return i;
04069    }
04070    return 0; /* error return */
04071 }
04072 
04073 /*! \brief helper function to return a range up to max (7, 12, 31 respectively).
04074  * names, if supplied, is an array of names that should be mapped to numbers.
04075  */
04076 static unsigned get_range(char *src, int max, char *const names[], const char *msg)
04077 {
04078    int s, e; /* start and ending position */
04079    unsigned int mask = 0;
04080 
04081    /* Check for whole range */
04082    if (ast_strlen_zero(src) || !strcmp(src, "*")) {
04083       s = 0;
04084       e = max - 1;
04085    } else {
04086       /* Get start and ending position */
04087       char *c = strchr(src, '-');
04088       if (c)
04089          *c++ = '\0';
04090       /* Find the start */
04091       s = lookup_name(src, names, max);
04092       if (!s) {
04093          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Invalid %s '%s', assuming none\n", msg, src);
04094          return 0;
04095       }
04096       s--;
04097       if (c) { /* find end of range */
04098          e = lookup_name(c, names, max);
04099          if (!e) {
04100             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Invalid end %s '%s', assuming none\n", msg, c);
04101             return 0;
04102          }
04103          e--;
04104       } else
04105          e = s;
04106    }
04107    /* Fill the mask. Remember that ranges are cyclic */
04108    mask = 1 << e; /* initialize with last element */
04109    while (s != e) {
04110       if (s >= max) {
04111          s = 0;
04112          mask |= (1 << s);
04113       } else {
04114          mask |= (1 << s);
04115          s++;
04116       }
04117    }
04118    return mask;
04119 }
04120 
04121 /*! \brief store a bitmask of valid times, one bit each 2 minute */
04122 static void get_timerange(struct ast_timing *i, char *times)
04123 {
04124    char *e;
04125    int x;
04126    int s1, s2;
04127    int e1, e2;
04128    /* int cth, ctm; */
04129 
04130    /* start disabling all times, fill the fields with 0's, as they may contain garbage */
04131    memset(i->minmask, 0, sizeof(i->minmask));
04132 
04133    /* 2-minutes per bit, since the mask has only 32 bits :( */
04134    /* Star is all times */
04135    if (ast_strlen_zero(times) || !strcmp(times, "*")) {
04136       for (x=0; x<24; x++)
04137          i->minmask[x] = 0x3fffffff; /* 30 bits */
04138       return;
04139    }
04140    /* Otherwise expect a range */
04141    e = strchr(times, '-');
04142    if (!e) {
04143       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Time range is not valid. Assuming no restrictions based on time.\n");
04144       return;
04145    }
04146    *e++ = '\0';
04147    /* XXX why skip non digits ? */
04148    while (*e && !isdigit(*e))
04149       e++;
04150    if (!*e) {
04151       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Invalid time range.  Assuming no restrictions based on time.\n");
04152       return;
04153    }
04154    if (sscanf(times, "%d:%d", &s1, &s2) != 2) {
04155       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s isn't a time.  Assuming no restrictions based on time.\n", times);
04156       return;
04157    }
04158    if (sscanf(e, "%d:%d", &e1, &e2) != 2) {
04159       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s isn't a time.  Assuming no restrictions based on time.\n", e);
04160       return;
04161    }
04162    /* XXX this needs to be optimized */
04163 #if 1
04164    s1 = s1 * 30 + s2/2;
04165    if ((s1 < 0) || (s1 >= 24*30)) {
04166       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s isn't a valid start time. Assuming no time.\n", times);
04167       return;
04168    }
04169    e1 = e1 * 30 + e2/2;
04170    if ((e1 < 0) || (e1 >= 24*30)) {
04171       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s isn't a valid end time. Assuming no time.\n", e);
04172       return;
04173    }
04174    /* Go through the time and enable each appropriate bit */
04175    for (x=s1;x != e1;x = (x + 1) % (24 * 30)) {
04176       i->minmask[x/30] |= (1 << (x % 30));
04177    }
04178    /* Do the last one */
04179    i->minmask[x/30] |= (1 << (x % 30));
04180 #else
04181    for (cth=0; cth<24; cth++) {
04182       /* Initialize masks to blank */
04183       i->minmask[cth] = 0;
04184       for (ctm=0; ctm<30; ctm++) {
04185          if (
04186          /* First hour with more than one hour */
04187                (((cth == s1) && (ctm >= s2)) &&
04188                 ((cth < e1)))
04189          /* Only one hour */
04190          ||    (((cth == s1) && (ctm >= s2)) &&
04191                 ((cth == e1) && (ctm <= e2)))
04192          /* In between first and last hours (more than 2 hours) */
04193          ||    ((cth > s1) &&
04194                 (cth < e1))
04195          /* Last hour with more than one hour */
04196          ||    ((cth > s1) &&
04197                 ((cth == e1) && (ctm <= e2)))
04198          )
04199             i->minmask[cth] |= (1 << (ctm / 2));
04200       }
04201    }
04202 #endif
04203    /* All done */
04204    return;
04205 }
04206 
04207 static char *days[] =
04208 {
04209    "sun",
04210    "mon",
04211    "tue",
04212    "wed",
04213    "thu",
04214    "fri",
04215    "sat",
04216    NULL,
04217 };
04218 
04219 static char *months[] =
04220 {
04221    "jan",
04222    "feb",
04223    "mar",
04224    "apr",
04225    "may",
04226    "jun",
04227    "jul",
04228    "aug",
04229    "sep",
04230    "oct",
04231    "nov",
04232    "dec",
04233    NULL,
04234 };
04235 
04236 int ast_build_timing(struct ast_timing *i, const char *info_in)
04237 {
04238    char info_save[256];
04239    char *info;
04240 
04241    /* Check for empty just in case */
04242    if (ast_strlen_zero(info_in))
04243       return 0;
04244    /* make a copy just in case we were passed a static string */
04245    ast_copy_string(info_save, info_in, sizeof(info_save));
04246    info = info_save;
04247    /* Assume everything except time */
04248    i->monthmask = 0xfff;   /* 12 bits */
04249    i->daymask = 0x7fffffffU; /* 31 bits */
04250    i->dowmask = 0x7f; /* 7 bits */
04251    /* on each call, use strsep() to move info to the next argument */
04252    get_timerange(i, strsep(&info, "|"));
04253    if (info)
04254       i->dowmask = get_range(strsep(&info, "|"), 7, days, "day of week");
04255    if (info)
04256       i->daymask = get_range(strsep(&info, "|"), 31, NULL, "day");
04257    if (info)
04258       i->monthmask = get_range(strsep(&info, "|"), 12, months, "month");
04259    return 1;
04260 }
04261 
04262 int ast_check_timing(const struct ast_timing *i)
04263 {
04264    struct tm tm;
04265    time_t t = time(NULL);
04266 
04267    localtime_r(&t,&tm);
04268 
04269    /* If it's not the right month, return */
04270    if (!(i->monthmask & (1 << tm.tm_mon)))
04271       return 0;
04272 
04273    /* If it's not that time of the month.... */
04274    /* Warning, tm_mday has range 1..31! */
04275    if (!(i->daymask & (1 << (tm.tm_mday-1))))
04276       return 0;
04277 
04278    /* If it's not the right day of the week */
04279    if (!(i->dowmask & (1 << tm.tm_wday)))
04280       return 0;
04281 
04282    /* Sanity check the hour just to be safe */
04283    if ((tm.tm_hour < 0) || (tm.tm_hour > 23)) {
04284       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Insane time...\n");
04285       return 0;
04286    }
04287 
04288    /* Now the tough part, we calculate if it fits
04289       in the right time based on min/hour */
04290    if (!(i->minmask[tm.tm_hour] & (1 << (tm.tm_min / 2))))
04291       return 0;
04292 
04293    /* If we got this far, then we're good */
04294    return 1;
04295 }
04296 
04297 /*
04298  * errno values
04299  *  ENOMEM - out of memory
04300  *  EBUSY  - can't lock
04301  *  EEXIST - already included
04302  *  EINVAL - there is no existence of context for inclusion
04303  */
04304 int ast_context_add_include2(struct ast_context *con, const char *value,
04305    const char *registrar)
04306 {
04307    struct ast_include *new_include;
04308    char *c;
04309    struct ast_include *i, *il = NULL; /* include, include_last */
04310    int length;
04311    char *p;
04312 
04313    length = sizeof(struct ast_include);
04314    length += 2 * (strlen(value) + 1);
04315 
04316    /* allocate new include structure ... */
04317    if (!(new_include = ast_calloc(1, length)))
04318       return -1;
04319    /* Fill in this structure. Use 'p' for assignments, as the fields
04320     * in the structure are 'const char *'
04321     */
04322    p = new_include->stuff;
04323    new_include->name = p;
04324    strcpy(p, value);
04325    p += strlen(value) + 1;
04326    new_include->rname = p;
04327    strcpy(p, value);
04328    /* Strip off timing info, and process if it is there */
04329    if ( (c = strchr(p, '|')) ) {
04330       *c++ = '\0';
04331            new_include->hastime = ast_build_timing(&(new_include->timing), c);
04332    }
04333    new_include->next      = NULL;
04334    new_include->registrar = registrar;
04335 
04336    ast_wrlock_context(con);
04337 
04338    /* ... go to last include and check if context is already included too... */
04339    for (i = con->includes; i; i = i->next) {
04340       if (!strcasecmp(i->name, new_include->name)) {
04341          free(new_include);
04342          ast_unlock_context(con);
04343          errno = EEXIST;
04344          return -1;
04345       }
04346       il = i;
04347    }
04348 
04349    /* ... include new context into context list, unlock, return */
04350    if (il)
04351       il->next = new_include;
04352    else
04353       con->includes = new_include;
04354    if (option_verbose > 2)
04355       ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Including context '%s' in context '%s'\n", new_include->name, ast_get_context_name(con));
04356 
04357    ast_unlock_context(con);
04358 
04359    return 0;
04360 }
04361 
04362 /*
04363  * errno values
04364  *  EBUSY  - can't lock
04365  *  ENOENT - no existence of context
04366  */
04367 int ast_context_add_switch(const char *context, const char *sw, const char *data, int eval, const char *registrar)
04368 {
04369    int ret = -1;
04370    struct ast_context *c = find_context_locked(context);
04371 
04372    if (c) { /* found, add switch to this context */
04373       ret = ast_context_add_switch2(c, sw, data, eval, registrar);
04374       ast_unlock_contexts();
04375    }
04376    return ret;
04377 }
04378 
04379 /*
04380  * errno values
04381  *  ENOMEM - out of memory
04382  *  EBUSY  - can't lock
04383  *  EEXIST - already included
04384  *  EINVAL - there is no existence of context for inclusion
04385  */
04386 int ast_context_add_switch2(struct ast_context *con, const char *value,
04387    const char *data, int eval, const char *registrar)
04388 {
04389    struct ast_sw *new_sw;
04390    struct ast_sw *i;
04391    int length;
04392    char *p;
04393 
04394    length = sizeof(struct ast_sw);
04395    length += strlen(value) + 1;
04396    if (data)
04397       length += strlen(data);
04398    length++;
04399    if (eval) {
04400       /* Create buffer for evaluation of variables */
04401       length += SWITCH_DATA_LENGTH;
04402       length++;
04403    }
04404 
04405    /* allocate new sw structure ... */
04406    if (!(new_sw = ast_calloc(1, length)))
04407       return -1;
04408    /* ... fill in this structure ... */
04409    p = new_sw->stuff;
04410    new_sw->name = p;
04411    strcpy(new_sw->name, value);
04412    p += strlen(value) + 1;
04413    new_sw->data = p;
04414    if (data) {
04415       strcpy(new_sw->data, data);
04416       p += strlen(data) + 1;
04417    } else {
04418       strcpy(new_sw->data, "");
04419       p++;
04420    }
04421    if (eval)
04422       new_sw->tmpdata = p;
04423    new_sw->eval     = eval;
04424    new_sw->registrar = registrar;
04425 
04426    /* ... try to lock this context ... */
04427    ast_wrlock_context(con);
04428 
04429    /* ... go to last sw and check if context is already swd too... */
04430    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&con->alts, i, list) {
04431       if (!strcasecmp(i->name, new_sw->name) && !strcasecmp(i->data, new_sw->data)) {
04432          free(new_sw);
04433          ast_unlock_context(con);
04434          errno = EEXIST;
04435          return -1;
04436       }
04437    }
04438 
04439    /* ... sw new context into context list, unlock, return */
04440    AST_LIST_INSERT_TAIL(&con->alts, new_sw, list);
04441 
04442    if (option_verbose > 2)
04443       ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Including switch '%s/%s' in context '%s'\n", new_sw->name, new_sw->data, ast_get_context_name(con));
04444 
04445    ast_unlock_context(con);
04446 
04447    return 0;
04448 }
04449 
04450 /*
04451  * EBUSY  - can't lock
04452  * ENOENT - there is not context existence
04453  */
04454 int ast_context_remove_ignorepat(const char *context, const char *ignorepat, const char *registrar)
04455 {
04456    int ret = -1;
04457    struct ast_context *c = find_context_locked(context);
04458 
04459    if (c) {
04460       ret = ast_context_remove_ignorepat2(c, ignorepat, registrar);
04461       ast_unlock_contexts();
04462    }
04463    return ret;
04464 }
04465 
04466 int ast_context_remove_ignorepat2(struct ast_context *con, const char *ignorepat, const char *registrar)
04467 {
04468    struct ast_ignorepat *ip, *ipl = NULL;
04469 
04470    ast_wrlock_context(con);
04471 
04472    for (ip = con->ignorepats; ip; ip = ip->next) {
04473       if (!strcmp(ip->pattern, ignorepat) &&
04474          (!registrar || (registrar == ip->registrar))) {
04475          if (ipl) {
04476             ipl->next = ip->next;
04477             free(ip);
04478          } else {
04479             con->ignorepats = ip->next;
04480             free(ip);
04481          }
04482          ast_unlock_context(con);
04483          return 0;
04484       }
04485       ipl = ip;
04486    }
04487 
04488    ast_unlock_context(con);
04489    errno = EINVAL;
04490    return -1;
04491 }
04492 
04493 /*
04494  * EBUSY - can't lock
04495  * ENOENT - there is no existence of context
04496  */
04497 int ast_context_add_ignorepat(const char *context, const char *value, const char *registrar)
04498 {
04499    int ret = -1;
04500    struct ast_context *c = find_context_locked(context);
04501 
04502    if (c) {
04503       ret = ast_context_add_ignorepat2(c, value, registrar);
04504       ast_unlock_contexts();
04505    }
04506    return ret;
04507 }
04508 
04509 int ast_context_add_ignorepat2(struct ast_context *con, const char *value, const char *registrar)
04510 {
04511    struct ast_ignorepat *ignorepat, *ignorepatc, *ignorepatl = NULL;
04512    int length;
04513    length = sizeof(struct ast_ignorepat);
04514    length += strlen(value) + 1;
04515    if (!(ignorepat = ast_calloc(1, length)))
04516       return -1;
04517    /* The cast to char * is because we need to write the initial value.
04518     * The field is not supposed to be modified otherwise
04519     */
04520    strcpy((char *)ignorepat->pattern, value);
04521    ignorepat->next = NULL;
04522    ignorepat->registrar = registrar;
04523    ast_wrlock_context(con);
04524    for (ignorepatc = con->ignorepats; ignorepatc; ignorepatc = ignorepatc->next) {
04525       ignorepatl = ignorepatc;
04526       if (!strcasecmp(ignorepatc->pattern, value)) {
04527          /* Already there */
04528          ast_unlock_context(con);
04529          errno = EEXIST;
04530          return -1;
04531       }
04532    }
04533    if (ignorepatl)
04534       ignorepatl->next = ignorepat;
04535    else
04536       con->ignorepats = ignorepat;
04537    ast_unlock_context(con);
04538    return 0;
04539 
04540 }
04541 
04542 int ast_ignore_pattern(const char *context, const char *pattern)
04543 {
04544    struct ast_context *con = ast_context_find(context);
04545    if (con) {
04546       struct ast_ignorepat *pat;
04547       for (pat = con->ignorepats; pat; pat = pat->next) {
04548          if (ast_extension_match(pat->pattern, pattern))
04549             return 1;
04550       }
04551    }
04552 
04553    return 0;
04554 }
04555 
04556 /*
04557  * EBUSY   - can't lock
04558  * ENOENT  - no existence of context
04559  *
04560  */
04561 int ast_add_extension(const char *context, int replace, const char *extension,
04562    int priority, const char *label, const char *callerid,
04563    const char *application, void *data, void (*datad)(void *), const char *registrar)
04564 {
04565    int ret = -1;
04566    struct ast_context *c = find_context_locked(context);
04567 
04568    if (c) {
04569       ret = ast_add_extension2(c, replace, extension, priority, label, callerid,
04570          application, data, datad, registrar);
04571       ast_unlock_contexts();
04572    }
04573    return ret;
04574 }
04575 
04576 int ast_explicit_goto(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *context, const char *exten, int priority)
04577 {
04578    if (!chan)
04579       return -1;
04580 
04581    if (!ast_strlen_zero(context))
04582       ast_copy_string(chan->context, context, sizeof(chan->context));
04583    if (!ast_strlen_zero(exten))
04584       ast_copy_string(chan->exten, exten, sizeof(chan->exten));
04585    if (priority > -1) {
04586       chan->priority = priority;
04587       /* see flag description in channel.h for explanation */
04588       if (ast_test_flag(chan, AST_FLAG_IN_AUTOLOOP))
04589          chan->priority--;
04590    }
04591 
04592    return 0;
04593 }
04594 
04595 int ast_async_goto(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *context, const char *exten, int priority)
04596 {
04597    int res = 0;
04598 
04599    ast_channel_lock(chan);
04600 
04601    if (chan->pbx) { /* This channel is currently in the PBX */
04602       ast_explicit_goto(chan, context, exten, priority);
04603       ast_softhangup_nolock(chan, AST_SOFTHANGUP_ASYNCGOTO);
04604    } else {
04605       /* In order to do it when the channel doesn't really exist within
04606          the PBX, we have to make a new channel, masquerade, and start the PBX
04607          at the new location */
04608       struct ast_channel *tmpchan = ast_channel_alloc(0, chan->_state, 0, 0, chan->accountcode, chan->exten, chan->context, chan->amaflags, "AsyncGoto/%s", chan->name);
04609       if (chan->cdr) {
04610          tmpchan->cdr = ast_cdr_dup(chan->cdr);
04611       }
04612       if (!tmpchan)
04613          res = -1;
04614       else {
04615          /* Make formats okay */
04616          tmpchan->readformat = chan->readformat;
04617          tmpchan->writeformat = chan->writeformat;
04618          /* Setup proper location */
04619          ast_explicit_goto(tmpchan,
04620             S_OR(context, chan->context), S_OR(exten, chan->exten), priority);
04621 
04622          /* Masquerade into temp channel */
04623          ast_channel_masquerade(tmpchan, chan);
04624 
04625          /* Grab the locks and get going */
04626          ast_channel_lock(tmpchan);
04627          ast_do_masquerade(tmpchan);
04628          ast_channel_unlock(tmpchan);
04629          /* Start the PBX going on our stolen channel */
04630          if (ast_pbx_start(tmpchan)) {
04631             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to start PBX on %s\n", tmpchan->name);
04632             ast_hangup(tmpchan);
04633             res = -1;
04634          }
04635       }
04636    }
04637    ast_channel_unlock(chan);
04638    return res;
04639 }
04640 
04641 int ast_async_goto_by_name(const char *channame, const char *context, const char *exten, int priority)
04642 {
04643    struct ast_channel *chan;
04644    int res = -1;
04645 
04646    chan = ast_get_channel_by_name_locked(channame);
04647    if (chan) {
04648       res = ast_async_goto(chan, context, exten, priority);
04649       ast_channel_unlock(chan);
04650    }
04651    return res;
04652 }
04653 
04654 /*! \brief copy a string skipping whitespace */
04655 static int ext_strncpy(char *dst, const char *src, int len)
04656 {
04657    int count=0;
04658 
04659    while (*src && (count < len - 1)) {
04660       switch (*src) {
04661       case ' ':
04662          /* otherwise exten => [a-b],1,... doesn't work */
04663          /*    case '-': */
04664          /* Ignore */
04665          break;
04666       default:
04667          *dst = *src;
04668          dst++;
04669       }
04670       src++;
04671       count++;
04672    }
04673    *dst = '\0';
04674 
04675    return count;
04676 }
04677 
04678 /*! \brief add the extension in the priority chain.
04679  * returns 0 on success, -1 on failure
04680  */
04681 static int add_pri(struct ast_context *con, struct ast_exten *tmp,
04682    struct ast_exten *el, struct ast_exten *e, int replace)
04683 {
04684    struct ast_exten *ep;
04685 
04686    for (ep = NULL; e ; ep = e, e = e->peer) {
04687       if (e->priority >= tmp->priority)
04688          break;
04689    }
04690    if (!e) {   /* go at the end, and ep is surely set because the list is not empty */
04691       ep->peer = tmp;
04692       return 0;   /* success */
04693    }
04694    if (e->priority == tmp->priority) {
04695       /* Can't have something exactly the same.  Is this a
04696          replacement?  If so, replace, otherwise, bonk. */
04697       if (!replace) {
04698          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to register extension '%s', priority %d in '%s', already in use\n", tmp->exten, tmp->priority, con->name);
04699          if (tmp->datad)
04700             tmp->datad(tmp->data);
04701          free(tmp);
04702          return -1;
04703       }
04704       /* we are replacing e, so copy the link fields and then update
04705        * whoever pointed to e to point to us
04706        */
04707       tmp->next = e->next; /* not meaningful if we are not first in the peer list */
04708       tmp->peer = e->peer; /* always meaningful */
04709       if (ep)        /* We're in the peer list, just insert ourselves */
04710          ep->peer = tmp;
04711       else if (el)      /* We're the first extension. Take over e's functions */
04712          el->next = tmp;
04713       else        /* We're the very first extension.  */
04714          con->root = tmp;
04715       if (tmp->priority == PRIORITY_HINT)
04716          ast_change_hint(e,tmp);
04717       /* Destroy the old one */
04718       if (e->datad)
04719          e->datad(e->data);
04720       free(e);
04721    } else { /* Slip ourselves in just before e */
04722       tmp->peer = e;
04723       tmp->next = e->next; /* extension chain, or NULL if e is not the first extension */
04724       if (ep)        /* Easy enough, we're just in the peer list */
04725          ep->peer = tmp;
04726       else {         /* we are the first in some peer list, so link in the ext list */
04727          if (el)
04728             el->next = tmp;   /* in the middle... */
04729          else
04730             con->root = tmp; /* ... or at the head */
04731          e->next = NULL;   /* e is no more at the head, so e->next must be reset */
04732       }
04733       /* And immediately return success. */
04734       if (tmp->priority == PRIORITY_HINT)
04735           ast_add_hint(tmp);
04736    }
04737    return 0;
04738 }
04739 
04740 /*! \brief
04741  * Main interface to add extensions to the list for out context.
04742  *
04743  * We sort extensions in order of matching preference, so that we can
04744  * stop the search as soon as we find a suitable match.
04745  * This ordering also takes care of wildcards such as '.' (meaning
04746  * "one or more of any character") and '!' (which is 'earlymatch',
04747  * meaning "zero or more of any character" but also impacts the
04748  * return value from CANMATCH and EARLYMATCH.
04749  *
04750  * The extension match rules defined in the devmeeting 2006.05.05 are
04751  * quite simple: WE SELECT THE LONGEST MATCH.
04752  * In detail, "longest" means the number of matched characters in
04753  * the extension. In case of ties (e.g. _XXX and 333) in the length
04754  * of a pattern, we give priority to entries with the smallest cardinality
04755  * (e.g, [5-9] comes before [2-8] before the former has only 5 elements,
04756  * while the latter has 7, etc.
04757  * In case of same cardinality, the first element in the range counts.
04758  * If we still have a tie, any final '!' will make this as a possibly
04759  * less specific pattern.
04760  *
04761  * EBUSY - can't lock
04762  * EEXIST - extension with the same priority exist and no replace is set
04763  *
04764  */
04765 int ast_add_extension2(struct ast_context *con,
04766    int replace, const char *extension, int priority, const char *label, const char *callerid,
04767    const char *application, void *data, void (*datad)(void *),
04768    const char *registrar)
04769 {
04770    /*
04771     * Sort extensions (or patterns) according to the rules indicated above.
04772     * These are implemented by the function ext_cmp()).
04773     * All priorities for the same ext/pattern/cid are kept in a list,
04774     * using the 'peer' field  as a link field..
04775     */
04776    struct ast_exten *tmp, *e, *el = NULL;
04777    int res;
04778    int length;
04779    char *p;
04780    char expand_buf[VAR_BUF_SIZE] = { 0, };
04781 
04782    /* if we are adding a hint, and there are global variables, and the hint
04783       contains variable references, then expand them
04784    */
04785    ast_rwlock_rdlock(&globalslock);
04786    if (priority == PRIORITY_HINT && AST_LIST_FIRST(&globals) && strstr(application, "${")) {
04787       pbx_substitute_variables_varshead(&globals, application, expand_buf, sizeof(expand_buf));
04788       application = expand_buf;
04789    }
04790    ast_rwlock_unlock(&globalslock);
04791 
04792    length = sizeof(struct ast_exten);
04793    length += strlen(extension) + 1;
04794    length += strlen(application) + 1;
04795    if (label)
04796       length += strlen(label) + 1;
04797    if (callerid)
04798       length += strlen(callerid) + 1;
04799    else
04800       length ++;  /* just the '\0' */
04801 
04802    /* Be optimistic:  Build the extension structure first */
04803    if (!(tmp = ast_calloc(1, length)))
04804       return -1;
04805 
04806    /* use p as dst in assignments, as the fields are const char * */
04807    p = tmp->stuff;
04808    if (label) {
04809       tmp->label = p;
04810       strcpy(p, label);
04811       p += strlen(label) + 1;
04812    }
04813    tmp->exten = p;
04814    p += ext_strncpy(p, extension, strlen(extension) + 1) + 1;
04815    tmp->priority = priority;
04816    tmp->cidmatch = p;   /* but use p for assignments below */
04817    if (callerid) {
04818       p += ext_strncpy(p, callerid, strlen(callerid) + 1) + 1;
04819       tmp->matchcid = 1;
04820    } else {
04821       *p++ = '\0';
04822       tmp->matchcid = 0;
04823    }
04824    tmp->app = p;
04825    strcpy(p, application);
04826    tmp->parent = con;
04827    tmp->data = data;
04828    tmp->datad = datad;
04829    tmp->registrar = registrar;
04830 
04831    ast_wrlock_context(con);
04832    res = 0; /* some compilers will think it is uninitialized otherwise */
04833    for (e = con->root; e; el = e, e = e->next) {   /* scan the extension list */
04834       res = ext_cmp(e->exten, extension);
04835       if (res == 0) { /* extension match, now look at cidmatch */
04836          if (!e->matchcid && !tmp->matchcid)
04837             res = 0;
04838          else if (tmp->matchcid && !e->matchcid)
04839             res = 1;
04840          else if (e->matchcid && !tmp->matchcid)
04841             res = -1;
04842          else
04843             res = strcasecmp(e->cidmatch, tmp->cidmatch);
04844       }
04845       if (res >= 0)
04846          break;
04847    }
04848    if (e && res == 0) { /* exact match, insert in the pri chain */
04849       res = add_pri(con, tmp, el, e, replace);
04850       ast_unlock_context(con);
04851       if (res < 0) {
04852          errno = EEXIST;   /* XXX do we care ? */
04853          return 0; /* XXX should we return -1 maybe ? */
04854       }
04855    } else {
04856       /*
04857        * not an exact match, this is the first entry with this pattern,
04858        * so insert in the main list right before 'e' (if any)
04859        */
04860       tmp->next = e;
04861       if (el)
04862          el->next = tmp;
04863       else
04864          con->root = tmp;
04865       ast_unlock_context(con);
04866       if (tmp->priority == PRIORITY_HINT)
04867          ast_add_hint(tmp);
04868    }
04869    if (option_debug) {
04870       if (tmp->matchcid) {
04871          if (option_debug)
04872             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Added extension '%s' priority %d (CID match '%s') to %s\n",
04873                tmp->exten, tmp->priority, tmp->cidmatch, con->name);
04874       } else {
04875          if (option_debug)
04876             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Added extension '%s' priority %d to %s\n",
04877                tmp->exten, tmp->priority, con->name);
04878       }
04879    }
04880    if (option_verbose > 2) {
04881       if (tmp->matchcid) {
04882          ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Added extension '%s' priority %d (CID match '%s')to %s\n",
04883             tmp->exten, tmp->priority, tmp->cidmatch, con->name);
04884       } else {
04885          ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Added extension '%s' priority %d to %s\n",
04886             tmp->exten, tmp->priority, con->name);
04887       }
04888    }
04889    return 0;
04890 }
04891 
04892 struct async_stat {
04893    pthread_t p;
04894    struct ast_channel *chan;
04895    char context[AST_MAX_CONTEXT];
04896    char exten[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];
04897    int priority;
04898    int timeout;
04899    char app[AST_MAX_EXTENSION];
04900    char appdata[1024];
04901 };
04902 
04903 static void *async_wait(void *data)
04904 {
04905    struct async_stat *as = data;
04906    struct ast_channel *chan = as->chan;
04907    int timeout = as->timeout;
04908    int res;
04909    struct ast_frame *f;
04910    struct ast_app *app;
04911 
04912    while (timeout && (chan->_state != AST_STATE_UP)) {
04913       res = ast_waitfor(chan, timeout);
04914       if (res < 1)
04915          break;
04916       if (timeout > -1)
04917          timeout = res;
04918       f = ast_read(chan);
04919       if (!f)
04920          break;
04921       if (f->frametype == AST_FRAME_CONTROL) {
04922          if ((f->subclass == AST_CONTROL_BUSY)  ||
04923              (f->subclass == AST_CONTROL_CONGESTION) ) {
04924             ast_frfree(f);
04925             break;
04926          }
04927       }
04928       ast_frfree(f);
04929    }
04930    if (chan->_state == AST_STATE_UP) {
04931       if (!ast_strlen_zero(as->app)) {
04932          app = pbx_findapp(as->app);
04933          if (app) {
04934             if (option_verbose > 2)
04935                ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Launching %s(%s) on %s\n", as->app, as->appdata, chan->name);
04936             pbx_exec(chan, app, as->appdata);
04937          } else
04938             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No such application '%s'\n", as->app);
04939       } else {
04940          if (!ast_strlen_zero(as->context))
04941             ast_copy_string(chan->context, as->context, sizeof(chan->context));
04942          if (!ast_strlen_zero(as->exten))
04943             ast_copy_string(chan->exten, as->exten, sizeof(chan->exten));
04944          if (as->priority > 0)
04945             chan->priority = as->priority;
04946          /* Run the PBX */
04947          if (ast_pbx_run(chan)) {
04948             ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Failed to start PBX on %s\n", chan->name);
04949          } else {
04950             /* PBX will have taken care of this */
04951             chan = NULL;
04952          }
04953       }
04954    }
04955    free(as);
04956    if (chan)
04957       ast_hangup(chan);
04958    return NULL;
04959 }
04960 
04961 /*! Function to post an empty cdr after a spool call fails.
04962  *
04963  *  This function posts an empty cdr for a failed spool call
04964  *
04965  */
04966 static int ast_pbx_outgoing_cdr_failed(void)
04967 {
04968    /* allocate a channel */
04969    struct ast_channel *chan = ast_channel_alloc(0, AST_STATE_DOWN, 0, 0, "", "", "", 0, 0);
04970 
04971    if (!chan)
04972       return -1;  /* failure */
04973 
04974    if (!chan->cdr) {
04975       /* allocation of the cdr failed */
04976       ast_channel_free(chan);   /* free the channel */
04977       return -1;                /* return failure */
04978    }
04979 
04980    /* allocation of the cdr was successful */
04981    ast_cdr_init(chan->cdr, chan);  /* initialize our channel's cdr */
04982    ast_cdr_start(chan->cdr);       /* record the start and stop time */
04983    ast_cdr_end(chan->cdr);
04984    ast_cdr_failed(chan->cdr);      /* set the status to failed */
04985    ast_cdr_detach(chan->cdr);      /* post and free the record */
04986    ast_channel_free(chan);         /* free the channel */
04987 
04988    return 0;  /* success */
04989 }
04990 
04991 int ast_pbx_outgoing_exten(const char *type, int format, void *data, int timeout, const char *context, const char *exten, int priority, int *reason, int sync, const char *cid_num, const char *cid_name, struct ast_variable *vars, const char *account, struct ast_channel **channel)
04992 {
04993    struct ast_channel *chan;
04994    struct async_stat *as;
04995    int res = -1, cdr_res = -1;
04996    struct outgoing_helper oh;
04997 
04998    if (sync) {
04999       oh.context = context;
05000       oh.exten = exten;
05001       oh.priority = priority;
05002       oh.cid_num = cid_num;
05003       oh.cid_name = cid_name;
05004       oh.account = account;
05005       oh.vars = vars;
05006       oh.parent_channel = NULL;
05007 
05008       chan = __ast_request_and_dial(type, format, data, timeout, reason, cid_num, cid_name, &oh);
05009       if (channel) {
05010          *channel = chan;
05011          if (chan)
05012             ast_channel_lock(chan);
05013       }
05014       if (chan) {
05015          if (chan->_state == AST_STATE_UP) {
05016                res = 0;
05017             if (option_verbose > 3)
05018                ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_4 "Channel %s was answered.\n", chan->name);
05019 
05020             if (sync > 1) {
05021                if (channel)
05022                   ast_channel_unlock(chan);
05023                if (ast_pbx_run(chan)) {
05024                   ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unable to run PBX on %s\n", chan->name);
05025                   if (channel)
05026                      *channel = NULL;
05027                   ast_hangup(chan);
05028                   res = -1;
05029                }
05030             } else {
05031                if (ast_pbx_start(chan)) {
05032                   ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unable to start PBX on %s\n", chan->name);
05033                   if (channel) {
05034                      *channel = NULL;
05035                      ast_channel_unlock(chan);
05036                   }
05037                   ast_hangup(chan);
05038                   res = -1;
05039                }
05040             }
05041          } else {
05042             if (option_verbose > 3)
05043                ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_4 "Channel %s was never answered.\n", chan->name);
05044 
05045             if (chan->cdr) { /* update the cdr */
05046                /* here we update the status of the call, which sould be busy.
05047                 * if that fails then we set the status to failed */
05048                if (ast_cdr_disposition(chan->cdr, chan->hangupcause))
05049                   ast_cdr_failed(chan->cdr);
05050             }
05051 
05052             if (channel) {
05053                *channel = NULL;
05054                ast_channel_unlock(chan);
05055             }
05056             ast_hangup(chan);
05057          }
05058       }
05059 
05060       if (res < 0) { /* the call failed for some reason */
05061          if (*reason == 0) { /* if the call failed (not busy or no answer)
05062                         * update the cdr with the failed message */
05063             cdr_res = ast_pbx_outgoing_cdr_failed();
05064             if (cdr_res != 0) {
05065                res = cdr_res;
05066                goto outgoing_exten_cleanup;
05067             }
05068          }
05069 
05070          /* create a fake channel and execute the "failed" extension (if it exists) within the requested context */
05071          /* check if "failed" exists */
05072          if (ast_exists_extension(chan, context, "failed", 1, NULL)) {
05073             chan = ast_channel_alloc(0, AST_STATE_DOWN, 0, 0, "", "", "", 0, "OutgoingSpoolFailed");
05074             if (chan) {
05075                if (!ast_strlen_zero(context))
05076                   ast_copy_string(chan->context, context, sizeof(chan->context));
05077                set_ext_pri(chan, "failed", 1);
05078                ast_set_variables(chan, vars);
05079                if (account)
05080                   ast_cdr_setaccount(chan, account);
05081                ast_pbx_run(chan);
05082             }
05083          }
05084       }
05085    } else {
05086       if (!(as = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*as)))) {
05087          res = -1;
05088          goto outgoing_exten_cleanup;
05089       }
05090       chan = ast_request_and_dial(type, format, data, timeout, reason, cid_num, cid_name);
05091       if (channel) {
05092          *channel = chan;
05093          if (chan)
05094             ast_channel_lock(chan);
05095       }
05096       if (!chan) {
05097          free(as);
05098          res = -1;
05099          goto outgoing_exten_cleanup;
05100       }
05101       as->chan = chan;
05102       ast_copy_string(as->context, context, sizeof(as->context));
05103       set_ext_pri(as->chan,  exten, priority);
05104       as->timeout = timeout;
05105       ast_set_variables(chan, vars);
05106       if (account)
05107          ast_cdr_setaccount(chan, account);
05108       if (ast_pthread_create_detached(&as->p, NULL, async_wait, as)) {
05109          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed to start async wait\n");
05110          free(as);
05111          if (channel) {
05112             *channel = NULL;
05113             ast_channel_unlock(chan);
05114          }
05115          ast_hangup(chan);
05116          res = -1;
05117          goto outgoing_exten_cleanup;
05118       }
05119       res = 0;
05120    }
05121 outgoing_exten_cleanup:
05122    ast_variables_destroy(vars);
05123    return res;
05124 }
05125 
05126 struct app_tmp {
05127    char app[256];
05128    char data[256];
05129    struct ast_channel *chan;
05130    pthread_t t;
05131 };
05132 
05133 /*! \brief run the application and free the descriptor once done */
05134 static void *ast_pbx_run_app(void *data)
05135 {
05136    struct app_tmp *tmp = data;
05137    struct ast_app *app;
05138    app = pbx_findapp(tmp->app);
05139    if (app) {
05140       if (option_verbose > 3)
05141          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_4 "Launching %s(%s) on %s\n", tmp->app, tmp->data, tmp->chan->name);
05142       pbx_exec(tmp->chan, app, tmp->data);
05143    } else
05144       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "No such application '%s'\n", tmp->app);
05145    ast_hangup(tmp->chan);
05146    free(tmp);
05147    return NULL;
05148 }
05149 
05150 int ast_pbx_outgoing_app(const char *type, int format, void *data, int timeout, const char *app, const char *appdata, int *reason, int sync, const char *cid_num, const char *cid_name, struct ast_variable *vars, const char *account, struct ast_channel **locked_channel)
05151 {
05152    struct ast_channel *chan;
05153    struct app_tmp *tmp;
05154    int res = -1, cdr_res = -1;
05155    struct outgoing_helper oh;
05156 
05157    memset(&oh, 0, sizeof(oh));
05158    oh.vars = vars;
05159    oh.account = account;
05160 
05161    if (locked_channel)
05162       *locked_channel = NULL;
05163    if (ast_strlen_zero(app)) {
05164       res = -1;
05165       goto outgoing_app_cleanup;
05166    }
05167    if (sync) {
05168       chan = __ast_request_and_dial(type, format, data, timeout, reason, cid_num, cid_name, &oh);
05169       if (chan) {
05170          if (chan->cdr) { /* check if the channel already has a cdr record, if not give it one */
05171             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s already has a call record??\n", chan->name);
05172          } else {
05173             chan->cdr = ast_cdr_alloc();   /* allocate a cdr for the channel */
05174             if (!chan->cdr) {
05175                /* allocation of the cdr failed */
05176                free(chan->pbx);
05177                res = -1;
05178                goto outgoing_app_cleanup;
05179             }
05180             /* allocation of the cdr was successful */
05181             ast_cdr_init(chan->cdr, chan);  /* initialize our channel's cdr */
05182             ast_cdr_start(chan->cdr);
05183          }
05184          ast_set_variables(chan, vars);
05185          if (account)
05186             ast_cdr_setaccount(chan, account);
05187          if (chan->_state == AST_STATE_UP) {
05188             res = 0;
05189             if (option_verbose > 3)
05190                ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_4 "Channel %s was answered.\n", chan->name);
05191             tmp = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*tmp));
05192             if (!tmp)
05193                res = -1;
05194             else {
05195                ast_copy_string(tmp->app, app, sizeof(tmp->app));
05196                if (appdata)
05197                   ast_copy_string(tmp->data, appdata, sizeof(tmp->data));
05198                tmp->chan = chan;
05199                if (sync > 1) {
05200                   if (locked_channel)
05201                      ast_channel_unlock(chan);
05202                   ast_pbx_run_app(tmp);
05203                } else {
05204                   if (locked_channel)
05205                      ast_channel_lock(chan);
05206                   if (ast_pthread_create_detached(&tmp->t, NULL, ast_pbx_run_app, tmp)) {
05207                      ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Unable to spawn execute thread on %s: %s\n", chan->name, strerror(errno));
05208                      free(tmp);
05209                      if (locked_channel)
05210                         ast_channel_unlock(chan);
05211                      ast_hangup(chan);
05212                      res = -1;
05213                   } else {
05214                      if (locked_channel)
05215                         *locked_channel = chan;
05216                   }
05217                }
05218             }
05219          } else {
05220             if (option_verbose > 3)
05221                ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_4 "Channel %s was never answered.\n", chan->name);
05222             if (chan->cdr) { /* update the cdr */
05223                /* here we update the status of the call, which sould be busy.
05224                 * if that fails then we set the status to failed */
05225                if (ast_cdr_disposition(chan->cdr, chan->hangupcause))
05226                   ast_cdr_failed(chan->cdr);
05227             }
05228             ast_hangup(chan);
05229          }
05230       }
05231 
05232       if (res < 0) { /* the call failed for some reason */
05233          if (*reason == 0) { /* if the call failed (not busy or no answer)
05234                         * update the cdr with the failed message */
05235             cdr_res = ast_pbx_outgoing_cdr_failed();
05236             if (cdr_res != 0) {
05237                res = cdr_res;
05238                goto outgoing_app_cleanup;
05239             }
05240          }
05241       }
05242 
05243    } else {
05244       struct async_stat *as;
05245       if (!(as = ast_calloc(1, sizeof(*as)))) {
05246          res = -1;
05247          goto outgoing_app_cleanup;
05248       }
05249       chan = __ast_request_and_dial(type, format, data, timeout, reason, cid_num, cid_name, &oh);
05250       if (!chan) {
05251          free(as);
05252          res = -1;
05253          goto outgoing_app_cleanup;
05254       }
05255       as->chan = chan;
05256       ast_copy_string(as->app, app, sizeof(as->app));
05257       if (appdata)
05258          ast_copy_string(as->appdata,  appdata, sizeof(as->appdata));
05259       as->timeout = timeout;
05260       ast_set_variables(chan, vars);
05261       if (account)
05262          ast_cdr_setaccount(chan, account);
05263       /* Start a new thread, and get something handling this channel. */
05264       if (locked_channel)
05265          ast_channel_lock(chan);
05266       if (ast_pthread_create_detached(&as->p, NULL, async_wait, as)) {
05267          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Failed to start async wait\n");
05268          free(as);
05269          if (locked_channel)
05270             ast_channel_unlock(chan);
05271          ast_hangup(chan);
05272          res = -1;
05273          goto outgoing_app_cleanup;
05274       } else {
05275          if (locked_channel)
05276             *locked_channel = chan;
05277       }
05278       res = 0;
05279    }
05280 outgoing_app_cleanup:
05281    ast_variables_destroy(vars);
05282    return res;
05283 }
05284 
05285 void __ast_context_destroy(struct ast_context *con, const char *registrar)
05286 {
05287    struct ast_context *tmp, *tmpl=NULL;
05288    struct ast_include *tmpi;
05289    struct ast_sw *sw;
05290    struct ast_exten *e, *el, *en;
05291    struct ast_ignorepat *ipi;
05292 
05293    for (tmp = contexts; tmp; ) {
05294       struct ast_context *next;  /* next starting point */
05295       for (; tmp; tmpl = tmp, tmp = tmp->next) {
05296          if (option_debug)
05297             ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "check ctx %s %s\n", tmp->name, tmp->registrar);
05298          if ( (!registrar || !strcasecmp(registrar, tmp->registrar)) &&
05299               (!con || !strcasecmp(tmp->name, con->name)) )
05300             break;   /* found it */
05301       }
05302       if (!tmp)   /* not found, we are done */
05303          break;
05304       ast_wrlock_context(tmp);
05305       if (option_debug)
05306          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "delete ctx %s %s\n", tmp->name, tmp->registrar);
05307       next = tmp->next;
05308       if (tmpl)
05309          tmpl->next = next;
05310       else
05311          contexts = next;
05312       /* Okay, now we're safe to let it go -- in a sense, we were
05313          ready to let it go as soon as we locked it. */
05314       ast_unlock_context(tmp);
05315       for (tmpi = tmp->includes; tmpi; ) { /* Free includes */
05316          struct ast_include *tmpil = tmpi;
05317          tmpi = tmpi->next;
05318          free(tmpil);
05319       }
05320       for (ipi = tmp->ignorepats; ipi; ) { /* Free ignorepats */
05321          struct ast_ignorepat *ipl = ipi;
05322          ipi = ipi->next;
05323          free(ipl);
05324       }
05325       while ((sw = AST_LIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&tmp->alts, list)))
05326          free(sw);
05327       for (e = tmp->root; e;) {
05328          for (en = e->peer; en;) {
05329             el = en;
05330             en = en->peer;
05331             destroy_exten(el);
05332          }
05333          el = e;
05334          e = e->next;
05335          destroy_exten(el);
05336       }
05337       ast_rwlock_destroy(&tmp->lock);
05338       free(tmp);
05339       /* if we have a specific match, we are done, otherwise continue */
05340       tmp = con ? NULL : next;
05341    }
05342 }
05343 
05344 void ast_context_destroy(struct ast_context *con, const char *registrar)
05345 {
05346    ast_wrlock_contexts();
05347    __ast_context_destroy(con,registrar);
05348    ast_unlock_contexts();
05349 }
05350 
05351 static void wait_for_hangup(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05352 {
05353    int res;
05354    struct ast_frame *f;
05355    double waitsec;
05356    int waittime;
05357 
05358    if (ast_strlen_zero(data) || (sscanf(data, "%lg", &waitsec) != 1) || (waitsec < 0))
05359       waitsec = -1;
05360    if (waitsec > -1) {
05361       waittime = waitsec * 1000.0;
05362       ast_safe_sleep(chan, waittime);
05363    } else do {
05364       res = ast_waitfor(chan, -1);
05365       if (res < 0)
05366          return;
05367       f = ast_read(chan);
05368       if (f)
05369          ast_frfree(f);
05370    } while(f);
05371 }

05391 /*!
05392  * \ingroup applications
05393  */
05394 static int pbx_builtin_busy(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05395 {
05396    ast_indicate(chan, AST_CONTROL_BUSY);
05397    /* Don't change state of an UP channel, just indicate
05398       busy in audio */
05399    if (chan->_state != AST_STATE_UP)
05400       ast_setstate(chan, AST_STATE_BUSY);
05401    wait_for_hangup(chan, data);
05402    return -1;
05403 }

05405 /*!
05406  * \ingroup applications
05407  */
05408 static int pbx_builtin_congestion(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05409 {
05410    ast_indicate(chan, AST_CONTROL_CONGESTION);
05411    /* Don't change state of an UP channel, just indicate
05412       congestion in audio */
05413    if (chan->_state != AST_STATE_UP)
05414       ast_setstate(chan, AST_STATE_BUSY);
05415    wait_for_hangup(chan, data);
05416    return -1;
05417 }

05427       delay = atoi(data);
05428 
05429    return __ast_answer(chan, delay);
05430 }

05434    AST_APP_OPTION('a', AST_CDR_FLAG_LOCKED),
05435    AST_APP_OPTION('v', AST_CDR_FLAG_KEEP_VARS),

05440  */
05441 static int pbx_builtin_resetcdr(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05442 {

05445

05447       args = ast_strdupa(data);
05448       ast_app_parse_options(resetcdr_opts, &flags, NULL, args);
05449    }
05450 
05451    ast_cdr_reset(chan->cdr, &flags);
05452 
05453    return 0;

05465 
05466 /*!
05467  * \ingroup applications
05468  */
05469 static int pbx_builtin_hangup(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05470 {
05471    if (!ast_strlen_zero(data)) {
05472       int cause;
05473       char *endptr;
05474 
05475       if ((cause = ast_str2cause(data)) > -1) {
05476          chan->hangupcause = cause;
05477          return -1;
05478       }
05479       
05480       cause = strtol((const char *) data, &endptr, 10);
05481       if (cause != 0 || (data != endptr)) {
05482          chan->hangupcause = cause;
05483          return -1;
05484       }
05485          
05486       ast_log(LOG_NOTICE, "Invalid cause given to Hangup(): \"%s\"\n", (char *) data);
05487    }
05488 
05489    if (!chan->hangupcause) {
05490       chan->hangupcause = AST_CAUSE_NORMAL_CLEARING;
05491    }
05492 
05493    return -1;
05494 }
05495 
05496 /*!
05497  * \ingroup applications
05498  */
05499 static int pbx_builtin_gotoiftime(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05500 {
05501    int res=0;
05502    char *s, *ts;
05503    struct ast_timing timing;
05504 
05505    if (ast_strlen_zero(data)) {
05506       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "GotoIfTime requires an argument:\n  <time range>|<days of week>|<days of month>|<months>?[[context|]extension|]priority\n");
05507       return -1;
05508    }
05509 
05510    ts = s = ast_strdupa(data);
05511 
05512    /* Separate the Goto path */
05513    strsep(&ts,"?");
05514 
05515    /* struct ast_include include contained garbage here, fixed by zeroing it on get_timerange */
05516    if (ast_build_timing(&timing, s) && ast_check_timing(&timing))
05517       res = pbx_builtin_goto(chan, ts);
05518    
05519    return res;
05520 }
05521 
05522 /*!
05523  * \ingroup applications
05524  */
05525 static int pbx_builtin_execiftime(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05526 {
05527    char *s, *appname;
05528    struct ast_timing timing;
05529    struct ast_app *app;
05530    static const char *usage = "ExecIfTime requires an argument:\n  <time range>|<days of week>|<days of month>|<months>?<appname>[|<appargs>]";
05531 
05532    if (ast_strlen_zero(data)) {
05533       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s\n", usage);
05534       return -1;
05535    }
05536 
05537    appname = ast_strdupa(data);
05538 
05539    s = strsep(&appname,"?");  /* Separate the timerange and application name/data */
05540    if (!appname) {   /* missing application */
05541       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "%s\n", usage);
05542       return -1;
05543    }
05544 
05545    if (!ast_build_timing(&timing, s)) {
05546       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Invalid Time Spec: %s\nCorrect usage: %s\n", s, usage);
05547       return -1;
05548    }
05549 
05550    if (!ast_check_timing(&timing))  /* outside the valid time window, just return */
05551       return 0;
05552 
05553    /* now split appname|appargs */
05554    if ((s = strchr(appname, '|')))
05555       *s++ = '\0';
05556 
05557    if ((app = pbx_findapp(appname))) {
05558       return pbx_exec(chan, app, S_OR(s, ""));
05559    } else {
05560       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Cannot locate application %s\n", appname);
05561       return -1;
05562    }
05563 }
05564 
05565 /*!
05566  * \ingroup applications
05567  */
05568 static int pbx_builtin_wait(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05569 {
05570    double s;
05571    int ms;
05572 
05573    /* Wait for "n" seconds */
05574    if (data && (s = atof(data)) > 0.0) {
05575       ms = s*1000.0;
05576       return ast_safe_sleep(chan, ms);
05577    }
05578    return 0;
05579 }
05580 
05581 /*!
05582  * \ingroup applications
05583  */
05584 static int pbx_builtin_waitexten(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05585 {
05586    int ms, res;
05587    double s;
05588    struct ast_flags flags = {0};
05589    char *opts[1] = { NULL };
05590    char *parse;
05591    AST_DECLARE_APP_ARGS(args,
05592       AST_APP_ARG(timeout);
05593       AST_APP_ARG(options);
05594    );
05595 
05596    if (!ast_strlen_zero(data)) {
05597       parse = ast_strdupa(data);
05598       AST_STANDARD_APP_ARGS(args, parse);
05599    } else
05600       memset(&args, 0, sizeof(args));
05601 
05602    if (args.options)
05603       ast_app_parse_options(waitexten_opts, &flags, opts, args.options);
05604    
05605    if (ast_test_flag(&flags, WAITEXTEN_MOH) && !opts[0] ) {
05606       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "The 'm' option has been specified for WaitExten without a class.\n"); 
05607    } else if (ast_test_flag(&flags, WAITEXTEN_MOH))
05608       ast_indicate_data(chan, AST_CONTROL_HOLD, opts[0], strlen(opts[0]));
05609 
05610    /* Wait for "n" seconds */
05611    if (args.timeout && (s = atof(args.timeout)) > 0)
05612        ms = s * 1000.0;
05613    else if (chan->pbx)
05614       ms = chan->pbx->rtimeout * 1000;
05615    else
05616       ms = 10000;
05617 
05618    res = ast_waitfordigit(chan, ms);
05619    if (!res) {
05620       if (ast_exists_extension(chan, chan->context, chan->exten, chan->priority + 1, chan->cid.cid_num)) {
05621          if (option_verbose > 2)
05622             ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Timeout on %s, continuing...\n", chan->name);
05623       } else if (ast_exists_extension(chan, chan->context, "t", 1, chan->cid.cid_num)) {
05624          if (option_verbose > 2)
05625             ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Timeout on %s, going to 't'\n", chan->name);
05626          set_ext_pri(chan, "t", 0); /* XXX is the 0 correct ? */
05627       } else {
05628          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Timeout but no rule 't' in context '%s'\n", chan->context);
05629          res = -1;
05630       }
05631    }
05632 
05633    if (ast_test_flag(&flags, WAITEXTEN_MOH))
05634       ast_indicate(chan, AST_CONTROL_UNHOLD);
05635 
05636    return res;
05637 }
05638 
05639 /*!
05640  * \ingroup applications
05641  */
05642 static int pbx_builtin_background(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05643 {
05644    int res = 0;
05645    int mres = 0;
05646    struct ast_flags flags = {0};
05647    char *parse;
05648    AST_DECLARE_APP_ARGS(args,
05649       AST_APP_ARG(filename);
05650       AST_APP_ARG(options);
05651       AST_APP_ARG(lang);
05652       AST_APP_ARG(context);
05653    );
05654 
05655    if (ast_strlen_zero(data)) {
05656       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Background requires an argument (filename)\n");
05657       return -1;
05658    }
05659 
05660    parse = ast_strdupa(data);
05661 
05662    AST_STANDARD_APP_ARGS(args, parse);
05663 
05664    if (ast_strlen_zero(args.lang))
05665       args.lang = (char *)chan->language; /* XXX this is const */
05666 
05667    if (ast_strlen_zero(args.context))
05668       args.context = chan->context;
05669 
05670    if (args.options) {
05671       if (!strcasecmp(args.options, "skip"))
05672          flags.flags = BACKGROUND_SKIP;
05673       else if (!strcasecmp(args.options, "noanswer"))
05674          flags.flags = BACKGROUND_NOANSWER;
05675       else
05676          ast_app_parse_options(background_opts, &flags, NULL, args.options);
05677    }
05678 
05679    /* Answer if need be */
05680    if (chan->_state != AST_STATE_UP) {
05681       if (ast_test_flag(&flags, BACKGROUND_SKIP)) {
05682          goto done;
05683       } else if (!ast_test_flag(&flags, BACKGROUND_NOANSWER)) {
05684          res = ast_answer(chan);
05685       }
05686    }
05687 
05688    if (!res) {
05689       char *back = args.filename;
05690       char *front;
05691 
05692       ast_stopstream(chan);      /* Stop anything playing */
05693       /* Stream the list of files */
05694       while (!res && (front = strsep(&back, "&")) ) {
05695          if ( (res = ast_streamfile(chan, front, args.lang)) ) {
05696             ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "ast_streamfile failed on %s for %s\n", chan->name, (char*)data);
05697             res = 0;
05698             mres = 1;
05699             break;
05700          }
05701          if (ast_test_flag(&flags, BACKGROUND_PLAYBACK)) {
05702             res = ast_waitstream(chan, "");
05703          } else if (ast_test_flag(&flags, BACKGROUND_MATCHEXTEN)) {
05704             res = ast_waitstream_exten(chan, args.context);
05705          } else {
05706             res = ast_waitstream(chan, AST_DIGIT_ANY);
05707          }
05708          ast_stopstream(chan);
05709       }
05710    }
05711    if (args.context != chan->context && res) {
05712       snprintf(chan->exten, sizeof(chan->exten), "%c", res);
05713       ast_copy_string(chan->context, args.context, sizeof(chan->context));
05714       chan->priority = 0;
05715       res = 0;
05716    }
05717 done:
05718    pbx_builtin_setvar_helper(chan, "BACKGROUNDSTATUS", mres ? "FAILED" : "SUCCESS");
05719    return res;
05720 }
05721 
05722 /*! Goto
05723  * \ingroup applications
05724  */
05725 static int pbx_builtin_goto(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05726 {
05727    int res = ast_parseable_goto(chan, data);
05728    if (!res && (option_verbose > 2))
05729       ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_3 "Goto (%s,%s,%d)\n", chan->context,chan->exten, chan->priority+1);
05730    return res;
05731 }
05732 
05733 
05734 int pbx_builtin_serialize_variables(struct ast_channel *chan, struct ast_str **buf)
05735 {
05736    struct ast_var_t *variables;
05737    const char *var, *val;
05738    int total = 0;
05739 
05740    if (!chan)
05741       return 0;
05742 
05743    (*buf)->used = 0;
05744    (*buf)->str[0] = '\0';
05745 
05746    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(&chan->varshead, variables, entries) {
05747       if ((var=ast_var_name(variables)) && (val=ast_var_value(variables))
05748          /* && !ast_strlen_zero(var) && !ast_strlen_zero(val) */
05749          ) {
05750          if (ast_str_append(buf, 0, "%s=%s\n", var, val) < 0) {
05751             ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Data Buffer Size Exceeded!\n");
05752             break;
05753          } else
05754             total++;
05755       } else
05756          break;
05757    }
05758 
05759    return total;
05760 }
05761 
05762 const char *pbx_builtin_getvar_helper(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *name)
05763 {
05764    struct ast_var_t *variables;
05765    const char *ret = NULL;
05766    int i;
05767    struct varshead *places[2] = { NULL, &globals };
05768 
05769    if (!name)
05770       return NULL;
05771    if (chan)
05772       places[0] = &chan->varshead;
05773 
05774    for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
05775       if (!places[i])
05776          continue;
05777       if (places[i] == &globals)
05778          ast_rwlock_rdlock(&globalslock);
05779       AST_LIST_TRAVERSE(places[i], variables, entries) {
05780          if (!strcmp(name, ast_var_name(variables))) {
05781             ret = ast_var_value(variables);
05782             break;
05783          }
05784       }
05785       if (places[i] == &globals)
05786          ast_rwlock_unlock(&globalslock);
05787       if (ret)
05788          break;
05789    }
05790 
05791    return ret;
05792 }
05793 
05794 void pbx_builtin_pushvar_helper(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *name, const char *value)
05795 {
05796    struct ast_var_t *newvariable;
05797    struct varshead *headp;
05798 
05799    if (name[strlen(name)-1] == ')') {
05800       char *function = ast_strdupa(name);
05801 
05802       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Cannot push a value onto a function\n");
05803       ast_func_write(chan, function, value);
05804       return;
05805    }
05806 
05807    headp = (chan) ? &chan->varshead : &globals;
05808 
05809    if (value) {
05810       if ((option_verbose > 1) && (headp == &globals))
05811          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Setting global variable '%s' to '%s'\n", name, value);
05812       newvariable = ast_var_assign(name, value);
05813       if (headp == &globals)
05814          ast_rwlock_wrlock(&globalslock);
05815       AST_LIST_INSERT_HEAD(headp, newvariable, entries);
05816       if (headp == &globals)
05817          ast_rwlock_unlock(&globalslock);
05818    }
05819 }
05820 
05821 void pbx_builtin_setvar_helper(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *name, const char *value)
05822 {
05823    struct ast_var_t *newvariable;
05824    struct varshead *headp;
05825    const char *nametail = name;
05826 
05827    /* XXX may need locking on the channel ? */
05828    if (name[strlen(name)-1] == ')') {
05829       char *function = ast_strdupa(name);
05830 
05831       ast_func_write(chan, function, value);
05832       return;
05833    }
05834 
05835    headp = (chan) ? &chan->varshead : &globals;
05836 
05837    /* For comparison purposes, we have to strip leading underscores */
05838    if (*nametail == '_') {
05839       nametail++;
05840       if (*nametail == '_')
05841          nametail++;
05842    }
05843 
05844    if (headp == &globals)
05845       ast_rwlock_wrlock(&globalslock);
05846    AST_LIST_TRAVERSE (headp, newvariable, entries) {
05847       if (strcasecmp(ast_var_name(newvariable), nametail) == 0) {
05848          /* there is already such a variable, delete it */
05849          AST_LIST_REMOVE(headp, newvariable, entries);
05850          ast_var_delete(newvariable);
05851          break;
05852       }
05853    }
05854 
05855    if (value) {
05856       if ((option_verbose > 1) && (headp == &globals))
05857          ast_verbose(VERBOSE_PREFIX_2 "Setting global variable '%s' to '%s'\n", name, value);
05858       newvariable = ast_var_assign(name, value);
05859       AST_LIST_INSERT_HEAD(headp, newvariable, entries);
05860    }
05861 
05862    if (headp == &globals)
05863       ast_rwlock_unlock(&globalslock);
05864 }
05865 
05866 int pbx_builtin_setvar(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05867 {
05868    char *name, *value, *mydata;
05869    int argc;
05870    char *argv[24];      /* this will only support a maximum of 24 variables being set in a single operation */
05871    int global = 0;
05872    int x;
05873 
05874    if (ast_strlen_zero(data)) {
05875       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Set requires at least one variable name/value pair.\n");
05876       return 0;
05877    }
05878 
05879    mydata = ast_strdupa(data);
05880    argc = ast_app_separate_args(mydata, '|', argv, sizeof(argv) / sizeof(argv[0]));
05881 
05882    /* check for a trailing flags argument */
05883    if ((argc > 1) && !strchr(argv[argc-1], '=')) {
05884       argc--;
05885       if (strchr(argv[argc], 'g'))
05886          global = 1;
05887    }
05888 
05889    for (x = 0; x < argc; x++) {
05890       name = argv[x];
05891       if ((value = strchr(name, '='))) {
05892          *value++ = '\0';
05893          pbx_builtin_setvar_helper((global) ? NULL : chan, name, value);
05894       } else
05895          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Ignoring entry '%s' with no = (and not last 'options' entry)\n", name);
05896    }
05897 
05898    return(0);
05899 }
05900 
05901 int pbx_builtin_importvar(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05902 {
05903    char *name;
05904    char *value;
05905    char *channel;
05906    char tmp[VAR_BUF_SIZE]="";
05907 
05908    if (ast_strlen_zero(data)) {
05909       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Ignoring, since there is no variable to set\n");
05910       return 0;
05911    }
05912 
05913    value = ast_strdupa(data);
05914    name = strsep(&value,"=");
05915    channel = strsep(&value,"|");
05916    if (channel && value && name) { /*! \todo XXX should do !ast_strlen_zero(..) of the args ? */
05917       struct ast_channel *chan2 = ast_get_channel_by_name_locked(channel);
05918       if (chan2) {
05919          char *s = alloca(strlen(value) + 4);
05920          if (s) {
05921             sprintf(s, "${%s}", value);
05922             pbx_substitute_variables_helper(chan2, s, tmp, sizeof(tmp) - 1);
05923          }
05924          ast_channel_unlock(chan2);
05925       }
05926       pbx_builtin_setvar_helper(chan, name, tmp);
05927    }
05928 
05929    return(0);
05930 }
05931 
05932 static int pbx_builtin_noop(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05933 {
05934    return 0;
05935 }
05936 
05937 void pbx_builtin_clear_globals(void)
05938 {
05939    struct ast_var_t *vardata;
05940 
05941    ast_rwlock_wrlock(&globalslock);
05942    while ((vardata = AST_LIST_REMOVE_HEAD(&globals, entries)))
05943       ast_var_delete(vardata);
05944    ast_rwlock_unlock(&globalslock);
05945 }
05946 
05947 int pbx_checkcondition(const char *condition)
05948 {
05949    if (ast_strlen_zero(condition))  /* NULL or empty strings are false */
05950       return 0;
05951    else if (*condition >= '0' && *condition <= '9')   /* Numbers are evaluated for truth */
05952       return atoi(condition);
05953    else  /* Strings are true */
05954       return 1;
05955 }
05956 
05957 static int pbx_builtin_gotoif(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05958 {
05959    char *condition, *branch1, *branch2, *branch;
05960    int rc;
05961    char *stringp;
05962 
05963    if (ast_strlen_zero(data)) {
05964       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Ignoring, since there is no variable to check\n");
05965       return 0;
05966    }
05967 
05968    stringp = ast_strdupa(data);
05969    condition = strsep(&stringp,"?");
05970    branch1 = strsep(&stringp,":");
05971    branch2 = strsep(&stringp,"");
05972    branch = pbx_checkcondition(condition) ? branch1 : branch2;
05973 
05974    if (ast_strlen_zero(branch)) {
05975       if (option_debug)
05976          ast_log(LOG_DEBUG, "Not taking any branch\n");
05977       return 0;
05978    }
05979 
05980    rc = pbx_builtin_goto(chan, branch);
05981 
05982    return rc;
05983 }
05984 
05985 static int pbx_builtin_saynumber(struct ast_channel *chan, void *data)
05986 {
05987    char tmp[256];
05988    char *number = tmp;
05989    char *options;
05990 
05991    if (ast_strlen_zero(data)) {
05992       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SayNumber requires an argument (number)\n");
05993       return -1;
05994    }
05995    ast_copy_string(tmp, data, sizeof(tmp));
05996    strsep(&number, "|");
05997    options = strsep(&number, "|");
05998    if (options) {
05999       if ( strcasecmp(options, "f") && strcasecmp(options,"m") &&
06000          strcasecmp(options, "c") && strcasecmp(options, "n") ) {
06001          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "SayNumber gender option is either 'f', 'm', 'c' or 'n'\n");
06002          return -1;
06003       }
06004    }
06005    return ast_say_number(chan, atoi(tmp), "", chan->language, options);
06006 }
06007

06009 {
06010    int res = 0;
06011 
06012    if (data)
06013       res = ast_say_digit_str(chan, data, "", chan->language);
06014    return res;
06015 }

06034 
06035 int load_pbx(void)
06036 {
06037    int x;
06038 
06039    /* Initialize the PBX */
06040    if (option_verbose) {
06041       ast_verbose( "Asterisk PBX Core Initializing\n");
06042       ast_verbose( "Registering builtin applications:\n");
06043    }
06044    ast_cli_register_multiple(pbx_cli, sizeof(pbx_cli) / sizeof(struct ast_cli_entry));
06045 
06046    /* Register builtin applications */
06047    for (x=0; x<sizeof(builtins) / sizeof(struct pbx_builtin); x++) {
06048       if (option_verbose)
06049          ast_verbose( VERBOSE_PREFIX_1 "[%s]\n", builtins[x].name);
06050       if (ast_register_application(builtins[x].name, builtins[x].execute, builtins[x].synopsis, builtins[x].description)) {
06051          ast_log(LOG_ERROR, "Unable to register builtin application '%s'\n", builtins[x].name);
06052          return -1;
06053       }
06054    }
06055    
06056    /* Register manager application */
06057    ast_manager_register2("ShowDialPlan", EVENT_FLAG_CONFIG, manager_show_dialplan, "List dialplan", mandescr_show_dialplan);
06058    return 0;
06059 }

06202    struct ast_exten *exten)

06211    struct ast_sw *sw)
06212 {

06215    else
06216       return AST_LIST_NEXT(sw, list);

06236 {

06242 
06243 int ast_context_verify_includes(struct ast_context *con)
06244 {
06245    struct ast_include *inc = NULL;
06246    int res = 0;
06247 
06248    while ( (inc = ast_walk_context_includes(con, inc)) )
06249       if (!ast_context_find(inc->rname)) {
06250          res = -1;
06251          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Context '%s' tries includes nonexistent context '%s'\n",
06252                ast_get_context_name(con), inc->rname);
06253       }
06254    return res;
06255 }

06257 
06258 static int __ast_goto_if_exists(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *context, const char *exten, int priority, int async)
06259 {
06260    int (*goto_func)(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *context, const char *exten, int priority);
06261 
06262    if (!chan)
06263       return -2;
06264 
06265    if (context == NULL)
06266       context = chan->context;
06267    if (exten == NULL)
06268       exten = chan->exten;
06269 
06270    goto_func = (async) ? ast_async_goto : ast_explicit_goto;
06271    if (ast_exists_extension(chan, context, exten, priority, chan->cid.cid_num))
06272       return goto_func(chan, context, exten, priority);
06273    else
06274       return -3;
06275 }
06276 
06277 int ast_goto_if_exists(struct ast_channel *chan, const char* context, const char *exten, int priority)
06278 {
06279    return __ast_goto_if_exists(chan, context, exten, priority, 0);
06280 }
06281 
06282 int ast_async_goto_if_exists(struct ast_channel *chan, const char * context, const char *exten, int priority)
06283 {
06284    return __ast_goto_if_exists(chan, context, exten, priority, 1);
06285 }
06286 
06287 int ast_parseable_goto(struct ast_channel *chan, const char *goto_string)
06288 {
06289    char *exten, *pri, *context;
06290    char *stringp;
06291    int ipri;
06292    int mode = 0;
06293 
06294    if (ast_strlen_zero(goto_string)) {
06295       ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Goto requires an argument (optional context|optional extension|priority)\n");
06296       return -1;
06297    }
06298    stringp = ast_strdupa(goto_string);
06299    context = strsep(&stringp, "|"); /* guaranteed non-null */
06300    exten = strsep(&stringp, "|");
06301    pri = strsep(&stringp, "|");
06302    if (!exten) {  /* Only a priority in this one */
06303       pri = context;
06304       exten = NULL;
06305       context = NULL;
06306    } else if (!pri) {   /* Only an extension and priority in this one */
06307       pri = exten;
06308       exten = context;
06309       context = NULL;
06310    }
06311    if (*pri == '+') {
06312       mode = 1;
06313       pri++;
06314    } else if (*pri == '-') {
06315       mode = -1;
06316       pri++;
06317    }
06318    if (sscanf(pri, "%d", &ipri) != 1) {
06319       if ((ipri = ast_findlabel_extension(chan, context ? context : chan->context, exten ? exten : chan->exten,
06320          pri, chan->cid.cid_num)) < 1) {
06321          ast_log(LOG_WARNING, "Priority '%s' must be a number > 0, or valid label\n", pri);
06322          return -1;
06323       } else
06324          mode = 0;
06325    }
06326    /* At this point we have a priority and maybe an extension and a context */
06327 
06328    if (mode)
06329       ipri = chan->priority + (ipri * mode);
06330 
06331    ast_explicit_goto(chan, context, exten, ipri);
06332    ast_cdr_update(chan);
06333    return 0;
06334 
06335 }
